original: 'dir / bting ngo zhes grangs bzhin du sems bskyed par bya zhes pa ni dang po dge 'dun las nod pa na ni gding /
analyzed: 'dir / bting ngo zhes grangs bzhin du sems bskyed par bya zhes pa ni dang po dge 'dun las nod pa na ni gding /
translated: If you first receive it from the Saṅgha, then generate the thought, “I will spread it.”

original: bdag lag dar te byed na ni 'ding zin kar ni gding ngo zhes par sems skyed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bdag lag dar te byed na ni 'ding zin kar ni gding ngo zhes par sems skyed cig pa'o //
translated: If you make it yourself, then generate the thought, “I will spread it when I have finished.”

original: dang po nyams kyang mi 'grub pa ma yin zhes pa ni dang po nod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du sems bskyed pa de nyams su zin kyang gding ba'i don mi 'grub pa ni med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dang po nyams kyang mi 'grub pa ma yin zhes pa ni dang po nod pa'i tshe 'di snyam du sems bskyed pa de nyams su zin kyang gding ba'i don mi 'grub pa ni med par ston pa'o //
translated: “Even if you first damage it, it is not lost” shows that even if you damage the thought of generating the vow when you first receive it, it is not the case that the purpose of spreading it is not accomplished.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag sang bdag gis gtan pa 'ding bar 'tshal gyis khyed cag gis so so'i chos gos dbyung ba ltar mdzod cig ces tshogs pa la bsnyad ces pa ni sang 'ding ba'i do nub lta bu dge 'dun tshogs pa la 'di skad du snyod cig
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag sang bdag gis gtan pa 'ding bar 'tshal gyis khyed cag gis so so'i chos gos dbyung ba ltar mdzod cig ces tshogs pa la bsnyad ces pa ni sang 'ding ba'i do nub lta bu dge 'dun tshogs pa la 'di skad du snyod cig
translated: “Venerables, I will spread the mat tomorrow, so please take out your Dharma robes” is the announcement to the assembly.

original: pa'o // 'du bar gtogs pa'i zhal ta bya zhes pa ni dge 'dun 'du ba'i zhal ta'ang gding ba pa des gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // 'du bar gtogs pa'i zhal ta bya zhes pa ni dge 'dun 'du ba'i zhal ta'ang gding ba pa des gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase the work of the saṅgha means that the one who spreads the seat should also do the work of the saṅgha.

original: dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bsrung can gyis btul bas gtul te slo ma gzhi'i steng du du ma na yang cig car du bzhag la khyer nas rgan rabs kyi mdun du bzhag ste 'ding bar bya zhes pa ni gding ba'i tshe thabs 'di ltar gyis shig
analyzed: dri dang me tog gis mchod cing bsrung can gyis btul bas gtul te slo ma gzhi'i steng du du ma na yang cig car du bzhag la khyer nas rgan rabs kyi mdun du bzhag ste 'ding bar bya zhes pa ni gding ba'i tshe thabs 'di ltar gyis shig
translated: The phrase having worshipped with incense and flowers means that one should worship with incense and flowers. The phrase having subdued with the mantra means that one should subdue with the mantra. The phrase having placed on the seat means that one should place the seat on the ground. The phrase having carried means that one should carry the seat. The phrase having placed in front of the elders means that one should place the seat in front of the elders. The phrase one should spread means that one should spread the seat. The phrase at the time of spreading means that one should do this at the time of spreading the seat.

original: pa'o // tshes gcig la'o zhes pa ni de ltar gding ba'i tshes gcig la gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: pa'o // tshes gcig la'o zhes pa ni de ltar gding ba'i tshes gcig la gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase on the first day means that one should do this on the first day of spreading the seat.

original: zla tshigs gang gi tshes gcig ce na /
analyzed: zla tshigs gang gi tshes gcig ce na /
translated: What is the first day of the month?

original: ston gyi'o zhes pa yin te ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug la gyis shig @192b pa'o ;
analyzed: ston gyi'o zhes pa yin te ston zla 'bring po'i tshes bcu drug la gyis shig @192b pa'o ;
translated: The phrase in the autumn means that one should do this on the sixteenth day of the middle autumn month.

original: ; gsum brjod ces pa ni gdang ba'i sngags lan gsum du brjod cig pa'o //
analyzed: ; gsum brjod ces pa ni gdang ba'i sngags lan gsum du brjod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase three times means that one should recite the mantra three times.

original: brjod pa'i tshig ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: brjod pa'i tshig ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: What are the words of the mantra?

original: gding ngo zhes pa yin te btsun pa'i dge 'dun gson cig chos gos 'di dge 'dun gyis gtan bar bskos pa las bdag gtan pa 'ding ba ba ming 'di zhes bgyi bas chos gos 'di la dge 'dun gyi gtan pa gding ngo zhes gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gding ngo zhes pa yin te btsun pa'i dge 'dun gson cig chos gos 'di dge 'dun gyis gtan bar bskos pa las bdag gtan pa 'ding ba ba ming 'di zhes bgyi bas chos gos 'di la dge 'dun gyi gtan pa gding ngo zhes gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The word I spread is used. O monks, listen! This robe is designated by the Saṅgha as a permanent robe. I, so-and-so, spread this robe as the permanent robe of the Saṅgha.

original: dge slong re re'i mdun du dge 'dun la gding ngo zhes bsnyad ces pa ni dge slong re re'i mdun du gtan pa bting zin pa'i tshig 'di skad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong re re'i mdun du dge 'dun la gding ngo zhes bsnyad ces pa ni dge slong re re'i mdun du gtan pa bting zin pa'i tshig 'di skad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: In front of each monk, it is announced to the Saṅgha that it is spread. This is the statement of spreading the permanent robe in front of each monk.

original: de la tshig 'di lta ste tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / chos gos 'di la dge 'dun gyis gtan pa gding bar bskos pa ni bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lags te /
analyzed: de la tshig 'di lta ste tshe dang ldan pa dgongs shig / chos gos 'di la dge 'dun gyis gtan pa gding bar bskos pa ni bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba lags te /
translated: The statement is as follows: Venerable ones, please listen! This robe is designated by the Saṅgha as a permanent robe. I, so-and-so, am the one.

original: chos gos 'di la bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtan pa bting ngo zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos 'di la bdag gis dge 'dun gyi gtan pa bting ngo zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I spread this robe as the permanent robe of the Saṅgha.

original: gzhan gyis dge bar bting ngo //
analyzed: gzhan gyis dge bar bting ngo //
translated: It is spread by another as a good thing.

original: legs par bting ngo //
analyzed: legs par bting ngo //
translated: It is well spread.

original: 'di'i yon tan dang rnyed pa yang bdag cag gi'o zhes so zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyis snyad 'di skad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i yon tan dang rnyed pa yang bdag cag gi'o zhes so zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyis snyad 'di skad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The other monks should accuse him, saying, The merit and the wealth are ours!

original: de la rjes su yi rang ba ni dngos su myong ba bzhin zhes pa ni bting ba de la rjes su yi rang na yang bting ba'i las byas pa dang 'dra bar yon tan thob bo //
analyzed: de la rjes su yi rang ba ni dngos su myong ba bzhin zhes pa ni bting ba de la rjes su yi rang na yang bting ba'i las byas pa dang 'dra bar yon tan thob bo //
translated: As for rejoicing, it is as if one were to experience it directly means that if one rejoices in the spreading, one obtains the merit as if one had performed the act of spreading.

original: mngon sum du gyur bas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar yon tan thob pa yang dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs te /
analyzed: mngon sum du gyur bas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar yon tan thob pa yang dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs te /
translated: As for because of being present, the obtaining of merit as above also comes to the Sangha,

original: gnyid dam mnyam par 'jog par byas pa'i 'og tu phyis rjes su yi rang na gdod de ltar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnyid dam mnyam par 'jog par byas pa'i 'og tu phyis rjes su yi rang na gdod de ltar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: and if one rejoices after falling asleep or resting in equipoise, it will be like that.

original: 'ding ba pas gding ba'i rim gror bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'ding ba pas gding ba'i rim gror bya ba ni /
translated: The one who spreads the bedding should do the following in order to serve the one who spreads the bedding.

original: dus dus su bskam zhes pa dang / bsrad bskam sprug par bya zhes pa dang / du ba dang rdul can gyi khyim du mi gzhag ces pa dang / rgyal po'i der ma yin zhes pa dang / 'di las mi 'bral zhes pa dang / khyer la gung du mi 'gro zhes pa dang /
analyzed: dus dus su bskam zhes pa dang / bsrad bskam sprug par bya zhes pa dang / du ba dang rdul can gyi khyim du mi gzhag ces pa dang / rgyal po'i der ma yin zhes pa dang / 'di las mi 'bral zhes pa dang / khyer la gung du mi 'gro zhes pa dang /
translated: From time to time, it should be dried, it should be dried by being stretched, it should be beaten, it should not be placed in a smoky or dusty house, it should not be placed in the king's palace, it should not be separated from this, it should not be carried on the shoulder,

original: snam phyi sar mi 'jug ces pa dang / bla gab med par mi 'dug ces pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: snam phyi sar mi 'jug ces pa dang / bla gab med par mi 'dug ces pa rnams yin te /
translated: it should not be placed on the ground, and it should not be placed in the open.

original: chos gos 'ding ba par bskos pa des gding ba de'i zhal ta ming gis smos pa 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o /
analyzed: chos gos 'ding ba par bskos pa des gding ba de'i zhal ta ming gis smos pa 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o /
translated: The one appointed to spread the Dharma robes should spread them in this way, mentioning the name of the one who is the caretaker.

original: // / gtan pa gding ba'i cho ga de ltar rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: // / gtan pa gding ba'i cho ga de ltar rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the extensive ritual for spreading the mat,

original: dbyung ba'i cho ga ston pa ni /
analyzed: dbyung ba'i cho ga ston pa ni /
translated: the ritual for removing it is taught:🔽Removing is of two types: natural destruction and intentional destruction.

original: dbyung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te rang 'jig pa dang byas pas so zhes pa la sogs pa yin te ched du ma byas par rang 'jig pa dang ched du bshig pa gnyis yod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dbyung ba ni rnam pa gnyis te rang 'jig pa dang byas pas so zhes pa la sogs pa yin te ched du ma byas par rang 'jig pa dang ched du bshig pa gnyis yod par ston pa'o //
translated: It shows that there are two types: natural destruction without intention and intentional destruction.

original: de la rang 'jig pa je ston pa ni /
analyzed: de la rang 'jig pa je ston pa ni /
translated: The self-destruction of the boundary is taught.

original: rang 'jig pa ni gtan pa dang mtshams @193a * //🔽gzhan du son na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: rang 'jig pa ni gtan pa dang mtshams @193a * // gzhan du son na'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The self-destruction of the boundary is when the boundary is carried away and the boundary is moved to another place.

original: gtan pa khyer la mtshams gzhan du song na rang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gtan pa khyer la mtshams gzhan du song na rang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the boundary is carried away and the boundary is moved to another place, the boundary is self-destroyed.

original: mtshams kyi nang na'ang byin gyis rlob pa med na skya rengs shar na'o zhes pa ni dang po gtan pa 'ding ba'i dge slong mtshams kyi nang na gcig kyang med par gyur te skya rengs kyis tshod na gtan pa rang 'jig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi nang na'ang byin gyis rlob pa med na skya rengs shar na'o zhes pa ni dang po gtan pa 'ding ba'i dge slong mtshams kyi nang na gcig kyang med par gyur te skya rengs kyis tshod na gtan pa rang 'jig par ston pa'o //
translated: If there is no consecration within the boundary at dawn, it is taught that the boundary is self-destroyed at dawn when the first monk who established the boundary is not within the boundary at dawn.

original: dkyil 'khor der gtogs pa gud du chad na'o zhes pa ni gtan pa gding ba'i 'khor der gtogs pa las 'khor de'i nang nas chad cing gud du song na yang rang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor der gtogs pa gud du chad na'o zhes pa ni gtan pa gding ba'i 'khor der gtogs pa las 'khor de'i nang nas chad cing gud du song na yang rang 'jig par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If those belonging to that mandala are separated, it is taught that the boundary is self-destroyed when those belonging to the assembly of the boundary are separated and go elsewhere.

original: gud du song ba thams cad kyi 'jig gam zhe na /
analyzed: gud du song ba thams cad kyi 'jig gam zhe na /
translated: Is it the case that all who go elsewhere are destroyed?

original: 'dir de nyi tshe zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir de nyi tshe zhes pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is said that only that.

original: su gung song ba nyi tshe'i gtan pa rang 'jig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: su gung song ba nyi tshe'i gtan pa rang 'jig par ston pa'o //
translated: The going forth of a nun is shown to be a temporary rule, which is destroyed by herself.🔽If she is separated from the nunnery, she is destroyed by herself.

original: der gtogs pa las gud du chad na rang 'jig par 'gyur ba ma mo las rnam pa drug yod par ston te /
analyzed: der gtogs pa las gud du chad na rang 'jig par 'gyur ba ma mo las rnam pa drug yod par ston te /
translated: The mother scripture shows that there are six types of going forth:

original: song ba dang nges pa dang / re thag chad pa dang / stor ba dang / zin pa dang / mtshams las 'das pa rnams so ;
analyzed: song ba dang nges pa dang / re thag chad pa dang / stor ba dang / zin pa dang / mtshams las 'das pa rnams so ;
translated: going forth, certainty, discouragement, loss, seizure, and transgression of the boundary.

original: ; de la song ba ni /
analyzed: ; de la song ba ni /
translated: Going forth is

original: mtshams 'das na 'dir 'gyur zhes pa yin te gtan pa bting ba'i mtshams las 'das te gud du song na der gtogs pa las chad pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams 'das na 'dir 'gyur zhes pa yin te gtan pa bting ba'i mtshams las 'das te gud du song na der gtogs pa las chad pa'o //
translated: when one goes beyond the boundary, it is said. If one goes beyond the boundary of the area where the rule is laid down, she is separated from the nunnery.

original: song ngo cog gis de lta'am zhe na /
analyzed: song ngo cog gis de lta'am zhe na /
translated: Does every going forth have that?

original: slar mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis na'o zhes pa yin te slar mi 'ong ba'i sems yod na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: slar mi 'ong ba'i sems kyis na'o zhes pa yin te slar mi 'ong ba'i sems yod na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one has the intention not to return, it is said. If one has the intention not to return, then it is as above.

original: 'di'i mtshams kyi phyi rol tu skyes na yang ngo zhes pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol tu son nas gdod slar mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes na yang der gtogs pa las chad pa'o //
analyzed: 'di'i mtshams kyi phyi rol tu skyes na yang ngo zhes pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol tu son nas gdod slar mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes na yang der gtogs pa las chad pa'o //
translated: If one is born outside the boundary, one is also cut off from that stage.

original: mtshams las 'das pa dang phyi rol du slar mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa gnyis kyi bye brag ston pa ni /
analyzed: mtshams las 'das pa dang phyi rol du slar mi 'ong ba'i sems skyes pa gnyis kyi bye brag ston pa ni /
translated: The distinction between the two, passing beyond the boundary and the arising of the thought of non-return, is shown.

original: chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa med na de'i tshe mod la'o zhes pa yin te chos gos gtan pa 'di la ltos su mi rung gis byin gyis brlab pa'i chos gos gud du bya'o snyam pa'i sems med na ni mtshams 'das pa dang / phyi rol du sems skyes ma thag tu der gtogs pa las chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa med na de'i tshe mod la'o zhes pa yin te chos gos gtan pa 'di la ltos su mi rung gis byin gyis brlab pa'i chos gos gud du bya'o snyam pa'i sems med na ni mtshams 'das pa dang / phyi rol du sems skyes ma thag tu der gtogs pa las chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one has no thought of making a robe, then immediately. If one has no thought of making a robe, thinking, “I do not need to depend on this robe boundary, I will make a consecrated robe elsewhere,” then one is cut off from that stage immediately upon passing beyond the boundary and the arising of the thought of non-return.

original: yod kyang bya ba chad na'o zhes pa ni chos gos bya ba'i sems yod na nam bya ba'i sems de ma chad kyi bar du slar 'ong ba'i sems med du zin kyang der gtogs pa las mi 'chad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yod kyang bya ba chad na'o zhes pa ni chos gos bya ba'i sems yod na nam bya ba'i sems de ma chad kyi bar du slar 'ong ba'i sems med du zin kyang der gtogs pa las mi 'chad par ston pa'o //
translated: If one has it, but the action is interrupted, means that if one has the thought of the action of the robe, as long as that thought of action is not interrupted, even if one has no thought of returning, one is not separated from that which is included in it.

original: de la phyi nang gang du yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la phyi nang gang du yang rung ste /
translated: Whether it is external or internal,

original: slar mi 'ong ba dang / chos gos kyi bya ba gnyis ka'i sems yod @193b na gtan pa byung bar greg pa'o //
analyzed: slar mi 'ong ba dang / chos gos kyi bya ba gnyis ka'i sems yod @193b na gtan pa byung bar greg pa'o //
translated: if one has both the thought of not returning and the thought of the action of the robe, the boundary is considered to have arisen.

original: slar mi 'ong ba'i sems dang chos gos bya ba'i sems yod kyang bya ba'i bsam pa de nas med na /
analyzed: slar mi 'ong ba'i sems dang chos gos bya ba'i sems yod kyang bya ba'i bsam pa de nas med na /
translated: If one has the thought of not returning and the thought of the action of the robe, but the thought of the action is not there,

original: song bas gtan pa 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: song bas gtan pa 'jig pa'o //
translated: then the boundary is destroyed by going.🔽Even if one returns, it is no use,

original: slar 'khor kyang ngo zhes pa ni gong ma lta bur gyur na slar 'khor kyang mi phan te /
analyzed: slar 'khor kyang ngo zhes pa ni gong ma lta bur gyur na slar 'khor kyang mi phan te /
translated: means that if it becomes like the above, even if one returns, it is no use,

original: der gtogs pa las chad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: der gtogs pa las chad par ston pa'o //
translated: and it shows that one is separated from that which is included in it.

original: yod kyang bya ba chad pa la rnam pa gsum yod pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: yod kyang bya ba chad pa la rnam pa gsum yod pa ston pa ni /
translated: If one has it, but the action is interrupted, there are three types.

original: re thag chad pa dang / brtsams nas yal ba dang / zin pa gsum ni bya ba de'i tshul lo zhes pa yin te chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang rnyed du re ba'i re thag chad pa dang / bya bar brtsams pa las stor pa dang /🔽byas zin na der gtogs pa las chad par 'gyur te /🔽ma mo las re thag chad ces pa dang / stor zhes pa dang / zin zhes pa 'byung ba yang 'di gsum yin no the tshom ni nges par phyung ba bzhin zhes pa slar 'ong ngam mi 'ong chos gos bya'am /
analyzed: re thag chad pa dang / brtsams nas yal ba dang / zin pa gsum ni bya ba de'i tshul lo zhes pa yin te chos gos bya ba'i bsam pa yod du zin kyang rnyed du re ba'i re thag chad pa dang / bya bar brtsams pa las stor pa dang / byas zin na der gtogs pa las chad par 'gyur te / ma mo las re thag chad ces pa dang / stor zhes pa dang / zin zhes pa 'byung ba yang 'di gsum yin no the tshom ni nges par phyung ba bzhin zhes pa slar 'ong ngam mi 'ong chos gos bya'am /
translated: Even though one has the thought to make a Dharma robe, if one is discouraged about obtaining it, if one loses it after beginning the action or if one severs the continuity of the action, one’s limit is reached.🔽Doubt is like definite emergence.

original: mi bya snyam du the tshom yod bzhin du mtshams 'das na yang nges par 'byung ba dang 'dra ba ste /
analyzed: mi bya snyam du the tshom yod bzhin du mtshams 'das na yang nges par 'byung ba dang 'dra ba ste /
translated: If one transgresses the boundary while having doubt, thinking, Will I return or not?🔽Will I make a Dharma robe or not?🔽it is like definite emergence.

original: ma mo las mtshams zhes 'byung ba yang 'di yin no /
analyzed: ma mo las mtshams zhes 'byung ba yang 'di yin no /
translated: This is also the boundary in the Mūlasarvâstivāda Vinaya that is called the boundary.

original: rang 'jig pa de ltar bstan nas byas pas 'jig pa da ston pa ni /
analyzed: rang 'jig pa de ltar bstan nas byas pas 'jig pa da ston pa ni /
translated: Having explained the destruction of the boundary, now the destruction by action will be explained.

original: las las gzhan pa'i bya ba mi sgrub /
analyzed: las las gzhan pa'i bya ba mi sgrub /
translated: One does not accomplish an action that is other than karma.

original: ces pa yin te /
analyzed: ces pa yin te /
translated: This is the rule.

original: gtan pa la mi ltos par sems bskyed pas kyang 'byung bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
analyzed: gtan pa la mi ltos par sems bskyed pas kyang 'byung bar ni 'gyur mod kyi /
translated: Although the generation of the Thought may occur without regard to the rule,

original: las kyis mi dbyung du mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: las kyis mi dbyung du mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught that it is not suitable not to be generated by the rule.

original: de'i dus dpyid zla ra ba'o zhes pa ni gtan pa dbyung ba'i dus te dpyid zla ra ba'i tshes bco lnga yin bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i dus dpyid zla ra ba'o zhes pa ni gtan pa dbyung ba'i dus te dpyid zla ra ba'i tshes bco lnga yin bar ston pa'o //
translated: The time for that is the first spring month is the time for the rule, and it teaches that it is the fifteenth day of the first spring month.

original: de ma thag pa'o zhes pa ni gtan pa bting ba'i dpyid zla ra ba la bya'i /
analyzed: de ma thag pa'o zhes pa ni gtan pa bting ba'i dpyid zla ra ba la bya'i /
translated: The immediately following is to be taken as the first spring month in which the rule is laid out,

original: de phyi de lo'i dpyid zla ra ba la bya ba ni ma yin bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de phyi de lo'i dpyid zla ra ba la bya ba ni ma yin bar ston pa'o //
translated: and it teaches that it is not to be taken as the first spring month of the following year.

original: nyams nyes pa'i phyir ni snga rol du'ang dbyung ngo zhes pa yin te chom rkun gyis thebs te gos med pa'i phyir ni zla tshigs 'di bas sngar phyung yang bla ba'o //
analyzed: nyams nyes pa'i phyir ni snga rol du'ang dbyung ngo zhes pa yin te chom rkun gyis thebs te gos med pa'i phyir ni zla tshigs 'di bas sngar phyung yang bla ba'o //
translated: Because of the possibility of damage, it is to be generated even earlier, and it teaches that it is better to generate it earlier than this month of the rule, because of the possibility of being struck by thieves and being without clothes.

original: 'di ma myong pa ni ma thos kyi bar du yon tan rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni yul du dong bas gtan pa byung bar ma thos na nam thos kyi bar du gtan pa'i yon tan thob par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ma myong pa ni ma thos kyi bar du yon tan rjes su 'jug go zhes pa ni yul du dong bas gtan pa byung bar ma thos na nam thos kyi bar du gtan pa'i yon tan thob par ston pa'o //
translated: Until one experiences this, one does not obtain the qualities. This shows that until one hears the rule, one does not obtain the qualities of the rule.

original: 'di ni thos pa'i mthas gtan pa 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ni thos pa'i mthas gtan pa 'byung ba'o //
translated: This is the rule that arises from the limit of hearing.

original: thos pa'o cog gis 'byung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: thos pa'o cog gis 'byung ngam zhe na /
translated: Does it arise from all hearing?

original: bya ba'i sems med na'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bya ba'i sems med na'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: It does if one has no intention to act.

original: chos gos bya ba'i sems med na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: chos gos bya ba'i sems med na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If one has no intention to act on the Dharma robes, then it becomes as above.

original: bya ba'i sems yod ji srid kyi bar du skye zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba'i sems yod ji srid kyi bar du skye zhe na /
translated: For as long as one has the intention to act, does it arise?

original: yod na 'chang @194a * //
analyzed: yod na 'chang @194a * //
translated: If one has, it arises until one keeps them.

original: kyi bar du'o zhes pa yin te chos gos bya ba'i sems nam ma chad kyi bar du yod pa'o //
analyzed: kyi bar du'o zhes pa yin te chos gos bya ba'i sems nam ma chad kyi bar du yod pa'o //
translated: As long as one has the intention to act on the Dharma robes, it arises.

original: ma phyung gi bar du thams cad la 'dus te de'i rnyed pa'o cog mi bgo zhes pa ni gtan pa ma byung gi bar du dus de'i rnyed par gtogs so cog go snga tshegs su ma 'god cig pa'o //
analyzed: ma phyung gi bar du thams cad la 'dus te de'i rnyed pa'o cog mi bgo zhes pa ni gtan pa ma byung gi bar du dus de'i rnyed par gtogs so cog go snga tshegs su ma 'god cig pa'o //
translated: Until one gives up the robes, all the gains belong to the community. This means that until the rule arises, all the gains belong to that time. Do not set them aside in advance.

original: gtan pa'i dngos po'o /
analyzed: gtan pa'i dngos po'o /
translated: It is a fixed thing.🔽Now, in order to teach the summary of what appears in the Questions of Sagaramati Sutra and so forth, it says above, “The fixed date should be set on the sixteenth day of the middle month of autumn.” The fixed date should be set on the sixteenth day of the middle month of autumn.

original: // / da ni zhus pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa la gong du ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la gtan pa gding bar bya'o zhes gtan pa gal te na rgyal po'i shol 'dums kyi tshes grangs kyis ston zla 'bring po gzhan du🔽bsgo ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: // / da ni zhus pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa la gong du ston zla 'bring po tshes bcu drug la gtan pa gding bar bya'o zhes gtan pa gal te na rgyal po'i shol 'dums kyi tshes grangs kyis ston zla 'bring po gzhan du bsgo ba bstsal ba'i phyir /
translated: If the king postpones the date, then in order to issue the command to set the middle month of autumn on another day,

original: gding ba ni tshul nas 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa yin te nam tshul nas 'byung ba'i rjes la gtan pa gding bar bya'i shol 'dums kyi zla tshigs dang ma sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: gding ba ni tshul nas 'byung ba bzhin zhes pa yin te nam tshul nas 'byung ba'i rjes la gtan pa gding bar bya'i shol 'dums kyi zla tshigs dang ma sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: it says, “The setting should be in accordance with the rule.” The setting should be done in accordance with the rule that appears in the Vinaya. It should not be done in conjunction with the postponed month and day.

original: gso sbyin las ma bsgyang zhes pa ni gtan pa gding ba gso sbyin gyi dus la ma bsgyang shig pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyin las ma bsgyang zhes pa ni gtan pa gding ba gso sbyin gyi dus la ma bsgyang shig pa'o //
translated: It says, “Do not postpone the poṣadha,” meaning do not postpone the setting of the fixed date to the time of the poṣadha.

original: dbyung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni dus bzhin du dbyung ba yang rung dus ma yin par dbyung ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: dbyung ba yang ngo zhes pa ni dus bzhin du dbyung ba yang rung dus ma yin par dbyung ba yang rung ste /
translated: It says, “The exclusion is also,” meaning that whether the exclusion is done at the proper time or at the improper time,

original: gso sbyin gyi dus dang sbyor cig pa'o //
analyzed: gso sbyin gyi dus dang sbyor cig pa'o //
translated: it should be done in conjunction with the month and day of the poṣadha.

original: 'di ni de'i nyin par nyid du'o zhes pa ni gtan pa dbyung ba gso sbyin gyi nyin par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de'i nyin par nyid du'o zhes pa ni gtan pa dbyung ba gso sbyin gyi nyin par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This is on that very day means that the rule should be laid down on the day of the poṣadha.

original: tshes bco lnga la gso sbyin byas na /
analyzed: tshes bco lnga la gso sbyin byas na /
translated: If the poṣadha is performed on the fifteenth day,

original: tshes bcu drug la gtan pa bting ba'i 'og tu dge slong gud nas phal cher lhags te de dag dga' bar gso sbyin bslas na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: tshes bcu drug la gtan pa bting ba'i 'og tu dge slong gud nas phal cher lhags te de dag dga' bar gso sbyin bslas na ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: and the rule is laid down on the sixteenth day, then if a majority of monks arrive later and they enjoy the poṣadha, what should be done?

original: gso sbyin bslas na phyung bar gyur zhes pa yin te gso sbyin gyi dus ma nges par gyur na bslas nas /
analyzed: gso sbyin bslas na phyung bar gyur zhes pa yin te gso sbyin gyi dus ma nges par gyur na bslas nas /
translated: If the poṣadha is enjoyed, the rule is broken. If the time of the poṣadha is uncertain, then it is enjoyed.

original: tshes bcu drug kyang zla la mi rung bar mngon bas gtan pa bting ba rang 'jig go //
analyzed: tshes bcu drug kyang zla la mi rung bar mngon bas gtan pa bting ba rang 'jig go //
translated: Since the sixteenth day is not suitable for the month, the rule is broken.

original: de lta bas na gtan pa gding ba yang slos la gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na gtan pa gding ba yang slos la gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the rule should be laid down again.

original: bting nas byed na 'dir so sor gyur zhes pa ni gtan la bting ba'i 'og tu dge 'dun sder chad cing so sor bye na gtan pa yang tha dad du 'gyur te /
analyzed: bting nas byed na 'dir so sor gyur zhes pa ni gtan la bting ba'i 'og tu dge 'dun sder chad cing so sor bye na gtan pa yang tha dad du 'gyur te /
translated: If it is performed after it is laid down, then here it is divided means that if the saṃgha is divided and split after the rule is laid down, the rule is also divided.

original: sde gcig gis phyung bas sde gcig gi phyung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: sde gcig gis phyung bas sde gcig gi phyung bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The one who is a bodhisattva is not the one who is not a bodhisattva.🔽If there is a Dharma teacher, it is his mat.

original: chos smra ba yod na de'i gding ba'o zhes pa ni chos smra ba dang / chos ma yin ba smra ba sde gnyis kyis gtan pa bting na /
analyzed: chos smra ba yod na de'i gding ba'o zhes pa ni chos smra ba dang / chos ma yin ba smra ba sde gnyis kyis gtan pa bting na /
translated: If both the Dharma teacher and the non-Dharma teacher spread out a mat,

original: chos smra ba rnams kyis gtan ba'i gding bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: chos smra ba rnams kyis gtan ba'i gding bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: it is the mat of the Dharma teacher,

original: chos smra ba ma yin pa rnams kyir mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: chos smra ba ma yin pa rnams kyir mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: not the mat of the non-Dharma teacher.

original: gtan pa bsrung ba'i rim gro yang chos smra ba rnams kyis bya'o//
analyzed: gtan pa bsrung ba'i rim gro yang chos smra ba rnams kyis bya'o//
translated: Therefore, the Dharma teacher should also perform the ritual of protecting the mat.🔽Here, even if spread by another, it is from these gains.

original: @194b 'dir gzhan gyis bting yang gzhan gyi rnyed pa 'di dag las so zhes pa ni chos smra ba ma yin ba rnams kyis gtan pa bting du zin kyang yun 'di srid kyi bar du gnas 'di na 'khod pa rnams la yon 'di dbul lo zhes gnas kyi
analyzed: @194b 'dir gzhan gyis bting yang gzhan gyi rnyed pa 'di dag las so zhes pa ni chos smra ba ma yin ba rnams kyis gtan pa bting du zin kyang yun 'di srid kyi bar du gnas 'di na 'khod pa rnams la yon 'di dbul lo zhes gnas kyi
translated: Even if the mat is spread by the non-Dharma teacher, the gains in that place, such as The residents here should give this gift for this long,

original: rnyed par gyur pa rnams chos smra ba dbang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed par gyur pa rnams chos smra ba dbang bar ston pa'o //
translated: are shown to belong to the Dharma teacher.

original: tha mal pa'i gnas su bkar ba dgag mi skye zhes pa ni dge slong tha mal ba rnams kyi sar chad pas chod cing bkar bas gtan pa bting du zin kyang bting bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i gnas su bkar ba dgag mi skye zhes pa ni dge slong tha mal ba rnams kyi sar chad pas chod cing bkar bas gtan pa bting du zin kyang bting bar mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase it does not arise in the case of a normal monk means that when a normal monk is the object of the boundary, the boundary is not established even though it is laid out.

original: bsam pa bzhag na bting ba'o zhes pa ni 'di ni bdag cag gi gtan pa bting ba'o //
analyzed: bsam pa bzhag na bting ba'o zhes pa ni 'di ni bdag cag gi gtan pa bting ba'o //
translated: The phrase it is established when the intention is set means that the boundary is established when the intention is set in this way: This is our boundary.

original: 'di rnyed pa dang / yon tan yang bdag cag gi'o zhes sems kyi ched du dmigs shing gtad na gdod gtan pa bting ba'i don du 'gyur ba'o //🔽dad pa phul ba'i dbang gis na lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig tu bya ba byas par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gtan pa 'ding ba'i tshe kho na ngos ni med kyi /
analyzed: 'di rnyed pa dang / yon tan yang bdag cag gi'o zhes sems kyi ched du dmigs shing gtad na gdod gtan pa bting ba'i don du 'gyur ba'o // dad pa phul ba'i dbang gis na lhag ma rnams dang lhan cig tu bya ba byas par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gtan pa 'ding ba'i tshe kho na ngos ni med kyi /
translated: The phrase it is established when the intention is directed means that the boundary is established when the intention is directed in this way: We will obtain and enjoy the benefits of this boundary.🔽The phrase by the power of offering faith, the remaining monks are considered to have performed the rite together means that the boundary is not established by the power of offering faith alone.

original: dad pas phul na yang dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu byas shing las su rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas phul na yang dge 'dun dang lhan cig tu byas shing las su rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase the remaining monks are considered to have performed the rite together shows that the boundary is established when the remaining monks are suitable to perform the rite together with the one who offers faith.

original: des btang na phyung ba'o zhes pa ni gtan pa mi dgos shing gtan pa'i yon tan la mi re ba sems thag bcad na gtan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: des btang na phyung ba'o zhes pa ni gtan pa mi dgos shing gtan pa'i yon tan la mi re ba sems thag bcad na gtan pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that if one is not concerned about the benefits of the vow, and one's mind is determined, the vow will be given.🔽Therefore, if one does not offer faith, and one is in a state of sleep, then even if one is filled with the vow, it is not spread out and not removed until one hears.

original: de lta bas na dad pa ma phul zhing gnyid dang mnyam par 'jog na bkang du zin kyang ma thos kyi bar du bting ba dang phyung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gong ma ltar ched du bsam pa brtsan pa'i phyir gral du bkod de /
analyzed: de lta bas na dad pa ma phul zhing gnyid dang mnyam par 'jog na bkang du zin kyang ma thos kyi bar du bting ba dang phyung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa ni gong ma ltar ched du bsam pa brtsan pa'i phyir gral du bkod de /
translated: This is as stated above, because the intention is to be respected.

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs su zin kyang gnyid dang mnyam par 'jog pa lta bu la sogs par gyur na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du 'ongs su zin kyang gnyid dang mnyam par 'jog pa lta bu la sogs par gyur na /
translated: Even if one has come into the midst of the Sangha, if one is in a state of sleep, etc.,

original: mthos kyi bar du bting bar yang mi 'gyur phyung bar yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mthos kyi bar du bting bar yang mi 'gyur phyung bar yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: then it is not spread out and not removed until one hears.

original: bting ba'i mtshams gcig na gnas tha dad par 'khod kyang de 'khod pa'o zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang kha tha dad du zin kyang dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe thams cad kyi phyir mtshams gcig tu byas na gtan pa bting ba'i tshe yang gtsug lag khang du🔽ma'i gtan pa cig car du bting du rung bar ston pa'o //🔽'di 'ding ba'i tshe na yang de'i gnas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyar tshul du 'jug pa nas phyi mtshams gcig tu byas pa ni med kyi gtan pa gding ba'i tshe /🔽thams cad kyi phyi mtshams gcig tu byas na yang gtsug lag khang de dag kun gtan pa de'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bting ba'i mtshams gcig na gnas tha dad par 'khod kyang de 'khod pa'o zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang kha tha dad du zin kyang dbyar tshul du 'jug pa'i tshe thams cad kyi phyir mtshams gcig tu byas na gtan pa bting ba'i tshe yang gtsug lag khang du ma'i gtan pa cig car du bting du rung bar ston pa'o // 'di 'ding ba'i tshe na yang de'i gnas so zhes pa ni gong ma ltar dbyar tshul du 'jug pa nas phyi mtshams gcig tu byas pa ni med kyi gtan pa gding ba'i tshe / thams cad kyi phyi mtshams gcig tu byas na yang gtsug lag khang de dag kun gtan pa de'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This shows that when entering the rainy season, if the boundary is set for all, then when the boundary is set, all the temples are within the boundary.🔽This shows that when setting the boundary, if the boundary is set for all, then all those temples become the place of that boundary.

original: bting nas mtshams tha dad du byas na gang yang de'i @195a * //
analyzed: bting nas mtshams tha dad du byas na gang yang de'i @195a * //
translated: If the boundary is set and then the boundary is made different, then none of them are within the boundary.

original: gnas so zhes pa ni gtan pa bting zin pa'i 'og tu mtshams so sor chad na yang gtan pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gnas so zhes pa ni gtan pa bting zin pa'i 'og tu mtshams so sor chad na yang gtan pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: The phrase “it is released” means that if the boundary is divided after the boundary markers have been laid out, the boundary will not be released.

original: mtshams so sor chad pa kun kyang gtan pa de'i gnas yin bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams so sor chad pa kun kyang gtan pa de'i gnas yin bar ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “all the divisions of the boundary are the place of the boundary” indicates that the boundary is released in all the places where the boundary was divided.

original: 'di ltar tha dad du gyur na 'byung ba yang gnas so sor ro zhes pa ni gong ma ltar tha dad du gyur na 'byung ba'i tshe yang so sor 'byung dgos pa'i phyir gnas gcig pas dus dang dus ma yin bar phyung na /
analyzed: 'di ltar tha dad du gyur na 'byung ba yang gnas so sor ro zhes pa ni gong ma ltar tha dad du gyur na 'byung ba'i tshe yang so sor 'byung dgos pa'i phyir gnas gcig pas dus dang dus ma yin bar phyung na /
translated: The phrase “if it is divided, the elements are also released in their individual places” means that if the boundary is divided, the elements must be released in their individual places. Therefore, if the boundary is released in one place, it is not released in the other places.

original: gnas gzhan pa rnams kyi phyung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i bsrung ba yang gud nas btang ba'am gtan pa nyid gnas gzhan du blang dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gnas gzhan pa rnams kyi phyung bar mi 'gyur ba'i phyir de'i bsrung ba yang gud nas btang ba'am gtan pa nyid gnas gzhan du blang dgos pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the boundary must be released in the other places either by a separate action or by taking up the boundary in another place.

original: bye na phyogs kyang so sor ro zhes pa ni mtshams gcig na 'khod pa las phyogs so sor chad na yang gtan pa so so nas dbyung dgos par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bye na phyogs kyang so sor ro zhes pa ni mtshams gcig na 'khod pa las phyogs so sor chad na yang gtan pa so so nas dbyung dgos par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “if it is divided, the directions are also divided” indicates that if the boundary is divided into different directions, the boundary must be released in each of the directions.

original: ma bting bas phyung ba yang ma phyung ba ma yin zhes pa gtan pa 'di bting ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis gtan pa phyung na yang gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma bting bas phyung ba yang ma phyung ba ma yin zhes pa gtan pa 'di bting ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis gtan pa phyung na yang gtan pa phyung bar mi 'gyur ba med pa'o //
translated: This means that if one who is not included in the rule of spreading the mat removes the mat, it is not that the rule is not removed.🔽Also, one who does not change it is not one who does not end it.

original: ma gyur kyang mi 'chad pa ma yin zhes pa ni gnas gcig na dge slong gcig pu zhig 'dug pa'i gtan pa bting ba'i don rogs dge slong 'gron pa gzhan gyis byas te /🔽gtan pa bting na sder ma langs shig gtan pa bting bar mi 'gyur ba med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: ma gyur kyang mi 'chad pa ma yin zhes pa ni gnas gcig na dge slong gcig pu zhig 'dug pa'i gtan pa bting ba'i don rogs dge slong 'gron pa gzhan gyis byas te / gtan pa bting na sder ma langs shig gtan pa bting bar mi 'gyur ba med par ston pa'o //
translated: This means that if the purpose of spreading the mat is fulfilled by a single monk staying in one place, and another visiting monk acts as his companion,🔽if the mat is spread, it is not that the mat is not spread.🔽Also, one who does not spread the mat is not one who does not remove it.

original: ma bting bas ma phyung ba ma yin zhes pa ni gtan ba 'byin pa'i tshe yang gtan pa gding ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis btang ste phyung na der dge 'dun mi tshang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: ma bting bas ma phyung ba ma yin zhes pa ni gtan ba 'byin pa'i tshe yang gtan pa gding ba la ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis btang ste phyung na der dge 'dun mi tshang ba med pa'o //
translated: This means that when removing the mat, if one who is not included in the rule of spreading the mat sends it away and removes it, there is no lack of completeness of the Saṅgha there.

original: gtan pa brubs na sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa sum mdor 'dug pa'i bar du nyes med ces pa ni gtan pa bting na sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa lam po che'i sum mdor 'dug tu zin kyang nyes🔽med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gtan pa brubs na sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa sum mdor 'dug pa'i bar du nyes med ces pa ni gtan pa bting na sbyar ma med par grong du 'jug pa la sogs pa lam po che'i sum mdor 'dug tu zin kyang nyes med par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that if one spreads a mat, there is no fault in entering a village without a robe, and so on, up to sitting in a crossroads.

original: gtan pa'i dngos po zhus pa la sogs par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gtan pa'i dngos po zhus pa la sogs par gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the topic of spreading a mat.

original: gtan pa'i dngos po rdzogs so /
analyzed: gtan pa'i dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: The topic of spreading a mat is finished.

original: // / gos kyi dngos po bsdus te ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / gos kyi dngos po bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: The summary teaching on the topic of robes is:

original: mtshon gyis ma dras pa'i gos mi bgo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: mtshon gyis ma dras pa'i gos mi bgo zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Do not wear robes that are not cut with a knife, and so on.

original: kha tshar ma bcad mtshon gyis ma dras na khyim pa'i gos su 'gyur bas na dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha tshar ma bcad mtshon gyis ma dras na khyim pa'i gos su 'gyur bas na dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If the edges are not cut and the robe is not cut with a knife, it becomes a householder's robe, so this is a prohibition.

original: dras shing drubs pa'i chos gos la byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni 'di lta bu'i chos gos gsum la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: dras shing drubs pa'i chos gos la byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni 'di lta bu'i chos gos gsum la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: Bless the cut and sewn Dharma robes means Bless these three types of Dharma robes.

original: ji lta bu drubs she na /
analyzed: ji lta bu drubs she na /
translated: How are they sewn?

original: tshal @195b bu dbus nas lhag ma dang mnyam pa 'dab ngos spel te gzhan gyi 'og tu bsrul cing mtha' bskor ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: tshal @195b bu dbus nas lhag ma dang mnyam pa 'dab ngos spel te gzhan gyi 'og tu bsrul cing mtha' bskor ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The middle section is divided into equal parts, and the remaining sections are placed in the other directions, alternating and surrounding.

original: tshal bu dbus nas kha so sor gyes la tshal bu lhag ma rnams dang / zheng tshad mnyam zhing tshal bu phyed du bgo ba'i thog ma rtse sprod du mi bya bar spel te /
analyzed: tshal bu dbus nas kha so sor gyes la tshal bu lhag ma rnams dang / zheng tshad mnyam zhing tshal bu phyed du bgo ba'i thog ma rtse sprod du mi bya bar spel te /
translated: The middle section is divided into two parts. The remaining sections are equal in width. The first half is not placed together at the tip, but is separated.

original: tsham bu gzhan gyi 'og 'og tu bsrul ba dang / tha ma yang khor yug tu tshal bu'i tshad kyis bskor ba'o /
analyzed: tsham bu gzhan gyi 'og 'og tu bsrul ba dang / tha ma yang khor yug tu tshal bu'i tshad kyis bskor ba'o /
translated: The other sections are placed below. The last one is also surrounded by the measure of the sections.

original: byin gyis brlab pa'i gos gang zhe na /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab pa'i gos gang zhe na /
translated: What is the robe for consecration?

original: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang sbyar ma'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: stod g-yogs dang smad g-yogs dang sbyar ma'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The upper robe, the lower robe, and the patched robe.

original: smad du bgo ba dang / stod du bgo ba dang / dum bur lhag pa'i sbyar ma dang gsum la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: smad du bgo ba dang / stod du bgo ba dang / dum bur lhag pa'i sbyar ma dang gsum la byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: The three are the lower robe, the upper robe, and the patched robe with remaining pieces.

original: dge slong ma'i lhag mar byin gyis brlab pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong ma'i lhag mar byin gyis brlab pa ston pa ni /
translated: The teaching on the consecration of the nun's remainder is:

original: gong lugs dang rdul gzan yang ngo zhes pa dang / dge slong ma'i ste ji ltar yang rung zhes pa yin te gong ma gsum gyi steng du 'di gnyis kyis bsnan te lnga la byin gyis rlobs shig pa dang / gong lugs dang rdul gzan dras shing drubs pa yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gong lugs dang rdul gzan yang ngo zhes pa dang / dge slong ma'i ste ji ltar yang rung zhes pa yin te gong ma gsum gyi steng du 'di gnyis kyis bsnan te lnga la byin gyis rlobs shig pa dang / gong lugs dang rdul gzan dras shing drubs pa yang rung ba'o //
translated: And the above system and a dust cloth, whether woven or sewn, are suitable.

original: yod par gyur na bsnyad pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dras shing drubs pa brnyas te rnyed na yang /

original: dras shing drubs pa brnyan por ma rnyed na /

translated: It is said, Without these, one should not let the dawn break, meaning that if one does not bless a woven or unwoven cloth, and lets the dawn break, one commits an offense.

original: gzhan ma rnyed na yang kha dog ma bsgyur ba la yang byin gyis brlabs zhes pa ni gong du smos pa lta bu ma rnyed na kha dog bsgyur ba'i dkar po la yang byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //

translated: This is the consecration of the first and last, which is to say, if one gives anything at all, even a needle and thread, to the first or last of the row, it is called the consecration of the first and last.

translated: The consecration as if it were the inside of the boundary is the consecration as if it were the outside of the boundary.🔽 The

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim pa'i der lus pa ni khyim bdag gis gar byin ba de dbang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong khyim pa'i der shin lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad rnams khyim pa des su la byin ba de dbang ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos khyim pa'i der lus pa ni khyim bdag gis gar byin ba de dbang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong khyim pa'i der shin lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad rnams khyim pa des su la byin ba de dbang ba'o //
translated: The one who gave the monk the bowl and so on belongs to the one who gave them to the monk.🔽But if they are suitable and there is no need,

original: ji nas kyang 'os shing nges bral na'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar khyim pas su byin ba dbang ba yang mtshan mthun zhing tha mal ba zhig ste sbyin bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: ji nas kyang 'os shing nges bral na'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar khyim pas su byin ba dbang ba yang mtshan mthun zhing tha mal ba zhig ste sbyin bar 'os pa'o //
translated: as above, the one who gave them to the monk belongs to the one who gave them to the monk.

original: lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad des brel ba zhig na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed la sogs pa yo byad des brel ba zhig na gdod gong ma ltar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If the monk is in need of the bowl and so on, then it is as above.

original: khyim pas su la yang ma byin na su dbang zhe na /
analyzed: khyim pas su la yang ma byin na su dbang zhe na /
translated: If the monk does not give them to anyone, to whom do they belong?

original: ma byin na slong ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: ma byin na slong ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: If he does not give them, they belong to the one who asked for them.

original: khyim pas ma byin na sus bslangs pa de dbang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pas ma byin na sus bslangs pa de dbang bar ston pa'o //
translated: If the monk does not give them to anyone, they belong to the one who asked for them.

original: gnyis la sogs pas bslangs su mtshungs na su dbang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis la sogs pas bslangs su mtshungs na su dbang zhe na /
translated: If two or more people ask for them, to whom do they belong?

original: rim gyis na snga ma zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis na snga ma zhes pa yin te /
translated: They belong to the one who asked first.

original: snga phyir bslangs na gang kha snga bde dbang @199a * //
analyzed: snga phyir bslangs na gang kha snga bde dbang @199a * //
translated: If they ask for it at different times, the one who asks first is the owner.

original: ba'o ; ; shi ba'i nor de'i gzhi 'dzin pa ye med dam /
analyzed: ba'o ; ; shi ba'i nor de'i gzhi 'dzin pa ye med dam /
translated: If there is no one at all who is the owner of the property of the dead person,

original: yod du zin gyis kyang gang zag 'ga' la dmigs kyis bsngos pa med de sus khyer yang rung bar byas pa zhig na su dbang zhe na /🔽med dam dmigs kyis btang ba ma yin na son pa'o zhes pa yin te gzhi 'dzin pa'i mi med dam /
analyzed: yod du zin gyis kyang gang zag 'ga' la dmigs kyis bsngos pa med de sus khyer yang rung bar byas pa zhig na su dbang zhe na / med dam dmigs kyis btang ba ma yin na son pa'o zhes pa yin te gzhi 'dzin pa'i mi med dam /
translated: or if there is someone but it is not specified to whom it belongs, then it is suitable for anyone to take it.

original: dmigs kyis btang ba med na su der 'ongs pa dbang ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs kyis btang ba med na su der 'ongs pa dbang ba'o //
translated: If there is no one who is the owner of the property or it is not specified to whom it belongs, then it belongs to whoever comes there.

original: du ma zhig snga phyir 'ongs na su dbang zhe na /🔽rim gyis pa yang de bzhin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: du ma zhig snga phyir 'ongs na su dbang zhe na / rim gyis pa yang de bzhin zhes pa yin te /
translated: If many people come there at different times, then who is the owner?

original: slong ba la kha snga brtsan pa bzhin du 'dir yang su sngar phyin pa dbang ba'o //
analyzed: slong ba la kha snga brtsan pa bzhin du 'dir yang su sngar phyin pa dbang ba'o //
translated: The one who comes first is the owner, just as it is in the case of a beggar.

original: chags nyen yod par 'gyur na ji tsam chags pa shi ba'i yo byad las bcal zhes pa dang / bgos kyang ngo shi ba la gzhan gyi chags nyen yod na bgos zin kyang de'i yo byad las bu lon gcol cig pa'o //
analyzed: chags nyen yod par 'gyur na ji tsam chags pa shi ba'i yo byad las bcal zhes pa dang / bgos kyang ngo shi ba la gzhan gyi chags nyen yod na bgos zin kyang de'i yo byad las bu lon gcol cig pa'o //
translated: If there is a danger of attachment to the share of the deceased, then even if the estate has been divided, the value of the deceased’s share should be calculated and the debt repaid.🔽The Blessed One said that the value of the deceased’s share should be calculated and the debt repaid as if the deceased were present and had been arrested.🔽The value of the deceased’s share should not be taken from others or repaid to others.

original: blang ba 'am bcal ba deng 'thams pa bzhin du bya'i gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ni tha ga pa las ras kyi rin ma len par dngos su long shig ces pa dang / 'tshod pa'i be'u ras kyi rin du ma byin gyis slar byin ba lta bu ma byed cig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bzhin du shi ba'i nor gzhan las blang ba 'am gzhan las gcal yang gshin nyid dang ji ltar 'thams pa bzhin du gyis shig pa'o
analyzed: blang ba 'am bcal ba deng 'thams pa bzhin du bya'i gzhan du ma yin zhes pa ni tha ga pa las ras kyi rin ma len par dngos su long shig ces pa dang / 'tshod pa'i be'u ras kyi rin du ma byin gyis slar byin ba lta bu ma byed cig par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa bzhin du shi ba'i nor gzhan las blang ba 'am gzhan las gcal yang gshin nyid dang ji ltar 'thams pa bzhin du gyis shig pa'o
translated: The Blessed One said that the value of the deceased’s share should not be taken from others or repaid to others, as if the deceased were present and had been arrested.

original: // 'di'i bu lon ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan la ma yin zhes pa ni shi ba la chags pa'i bu lon kho na nyid kyi yo byad kyis ma khyed na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan gyis gzhal ba'o //
analyzed: // 'di'i bu lon ni tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan la ma yin zhes pa ni shi ba la chags pa'i bu lon kho na nyid kyi yo byad kyis ma khyed na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa gzhan gyis gzhal ba'o //
translated: The debt is not to other practitioners. If the deceased had a debt to someone else, that person should be repaid from the deceased’s property.

original: las sar pa pa la dkon mchog gi dkor las na ji rnyed las de rnyed mnyam bar bcal zhes pa ni las sar pa bas dkon mchog gi khyer ba las de shi ba'i 'og tu dkor bsres te /
analyzed: las sar pa pa la dkon mchog gi dkor las na ji rnyed las de rnyed mnyam bar bcal zhes pa ni las sar pa bas dkon mchog gi khyer ba las de shi ba'i 'og tu dkor bsres te /
translated: If the deceased was a novice, the value of the articles of a novice monk should be calculated and added to the deceased’s property.

original: dkon mchog gang gang sku skal ji snyed yod pa so sor dbyer mi mngon na /
analyzed: dkon mchog gang gang sku skal ji snyed yod pa so sor dbyer mi mngon na /
translated: If it is not clear what share of the articles of the Three Jewels each of the Three Jewels represents,

original: dkon mchog gsum gyi sku skal cha gsum du mnyam par phye la stsobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum gyi sku skal cha gsum du mnyam par phye la stsobs shig pa'o //
translated: the share of the Three Jewels should be divided into three equal parts and distributed to the Three Jewels.

original: nad g-yog yod na yo byad drug cha dbang ba'i phyir byin gyis mi rlob /
analyzed: nad g-yog yod na yo byad drug cha dbang ba'i phyir byin gyis mi rlob /
translated: If there is a nurse, he or she should not be given a share of the property, because he or she is entitled to the six articles.

original: ces pa dang / bar dang 'bring dang tha ma las so zhes pa dang / du ma zhig na yang de la thun mong ngo zhes pa ni shi ba'i yo byad las rab gnyis 'bring gnyis tha ma gnyis te drug nad g-yog yong na de dbang bas dge 'dun byin gyis rlob tu mi dbang ba dang nad g-yog du ma zhig 'khod na
analyzed: ces pa dang / bar dang 'bring dang tha ma las so zhes pa dang / du ma zhig na yang de la thun mong ngo zhes pa ni shi ba'i yo byad las rab gnyis 'bring gnyis tha ma gnyis te drug nad g-yog yong na de dbang bas dge 'dun byin gyis rlob tu mi dbang ba dang nad g-yog du ma zhig 'khod na
translated: The six are the two best, two medium and two average articles of the dead monk. If a nurse is present, he or she has control over them. If many nurses are present, they share them.

original: de drug dang dbang du zad pa'o //
analyzed: de drug dang dbang du zad pa'o //
translated: Those six are the only ones who have control over them.

original: de'i phyir song pa la nad pa shin spyin zhes pa ni don ched kyi phyir dge slong 'ga' zhig gud du song ba'i 'og @199b tu nad g-yog gi yo byad drug las dbang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir song pa la nad pa shin spyin zhes pa ni don ched kyi phyir dge slong 'ga' zhig gud du song ba'i 'og @199b tu nad g-yog gi yo byad drug las dbang bar ston pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the sick person's gift is called a gift of the sick, because it is for the sake of the sick. It is taught that a few monks who have gone elsewhere have control over the six articles of the sick nurse.

original: mi 'os pa la shi ba'i rdzas de ma yin zhes pa ni khyim pa'am dge slong ma lta bu nad g-yog byed na shi ba'i yo byad las dbang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'os pa la shi ba'i rdzas de ma yin zhes pa ni khyim pa'am dge slong ma lta bu nad g-yog byed na shi ba'i yo byad las dbang ba med pa'o //
translated: The text continues, Those not eligible do not have the dead person's articles. If a layperson or a nun acts as a nurse, they do not have control over the dead person's articles.

original: tshul gzhan du zhugs pa la mi sbyin ba ma yin zhes pa ni nad g-yog byed na tshul gzhan du zhugs pa zhig yin du zin kyang yo byad drug las mi sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gzhan du zhugs pa la mi sbyin ba ma yin zhes pa ni nad g-yog byed na tshul gzhan du zhugs pa zhig yin du zin kyang yo byad drug las mi sbyin pa'o //
translated: If one is nursing the sick, even if they have entered another order, one should not give them more than the six articles.

original: 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang thams cad dbang zhes pa ni 'og nas sum cha sum gnyis su 'god pa zhig 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin gyi shi ba'i yo byad la dge 'dun yan chad dbang bar mtshungs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: 'di bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang thams cad dbang zhes pa ni 'og nas sum cha sum gnyis su 'god pa zhig 'byung ba lta bu ni ma yin gyi shi ba'i yo byad la dge 'dun yan chad dbang bar mtshungs par ston pa'o //
translated: This ordination is also called “the power of the majority” when the majority of the saṅgha is present.

original: nad pas sbyin par smras pa bzhin du bya zhes pa ni nad pas so sor sbyin par byas shing spags pa las lag tu ma son pa rnams phyi ma'i rnams kyis so so'i lag tu son par byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: nad pas sbyin par smras pa bzhin du bya zhes pa ni nad pas so sor sbyin par byas shing spags pa las lag tu ma son pa rnams phyi ma'i rnams kyis so so'i lag tu son par byin cig pa'o //
translated: One should act in accordance with what the sick person says about giving his things away. If the sick person has given things away individually, and they have not come into the hands of the recipients, the latter should be given from the possessions of the deceased.

original: 'chi ba na yang bdag gir bsgrubs pa'i nor ni mi dbang zhes pa ni nga shi dang nor 'di dag 'di dang 'di la kha byin cig ces kha chems bzhag pa lta bu ni ma shi ba'i tshe byin pa ma yin pas /
analyzed: 'chi ba na yang bdag gir bsgrubs pa'i nor ni mi dbang zhes pa ni nga shi dang nor 'di dag 'di dang 'di la kha byin cig ces kha chems bzhag pa lta bu ni ma shi ba'i tshe byin pa ma yin pas /
translated: When dying, the wealth that one has acquired for oneself is not under one's control. The phrase one says refers to the testament, When I die, give this and that wealth to this and that person. Since one does not give it when one is not dead,

original: gshin gyi kha chems mi brtsan bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: gshin gyi kha chems mi brtsan bar ston pa'o //
translated: it shows that one should not rely on the testament of the dead.

original: khyim pa ni dbang zhes pa ni khyim pa de skad du zer pa'i kha chems ni khyim pa slar ston pa'i phyir brtsan par ston pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa ni dbang zhes pa ni khyim pa de skad du zer pa'i kha chems ni khyim pa slar ston pa'i phyir brtsan par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase the householder says shows that the testament of the householder is not to be relied on, because the householder is a teacher of that doctrine.

original: khyim pa las bsngos te shin bu smad ji bder bya zhes pa dang / glang po rnga mo bong bu dri'u go cha rnams ni rgyal po la dbul zhes pa dang / gser dngul dang / gzhan yang byas pa dang / ma byas ni gsum la'o zhes pa dang /
analyzed: khyim pa las bsngos te shin bu smad ji bder bya zhes pa dang / glang po rnga mo bong bu dri'u go cha rnams ni rgyal po la dbul zhes pa dang / gser dngul dang / gzhan yang byas pa dang / ma byas ni gsum la'o zhes pa dang /
translated: The householder dedicates to the three jewels the wealth that he has set aside for his wife and children, and he says that they should do whatever is pleasant. He says that he will give the elephant, camel, donkey, plow, and armor to the king, and that he will give the gold, silver, and other things, both those that are made and those that are not made, to the three jewels.

original: rin po che yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pa slod po che 'chi kar bu smad la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rin po che yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pa slod po che 'chi kar bu smad la sogs pa'o //
translated: The jewels are also for the wife and children of the generous householder at the time of his death.

original: gzhi slong thams cad dkon mchog gsum la phul nas so sor bgo zhing gso ba'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi slong thams cad dkon mchog gsum la phul nas so sor bgo zhing gso ba'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Having offered all the basic materials to the Three Jewels, divide them up and use them as means of healing.

original: de la byas pa dang ma byas zhes pa ni brdungs su byas pa dang ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: de la byas pa dang ma byas zhes pa ni brdungs su byas pa dang ma byas pa'o //
translated: In this regard, done and not done means done and not done by beating.

original: gal te de las gzhan yod na de dag gi shas sam lhag pa 'am gal te mu tig sha dag na de nyid sangs rgyas la'o zhes pa ni mu tig la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs par yod na rin po che gzhan gyis mu tig blu
analyzed: gal te de las gzhan yod na de dag gi shas sam lhag pa 'am gal te mu tig sha dag na de nyid sangs rgyas la'o zhes pa ni mu tig la sogs pa rin po che sna tshogs par yod na rin po che gzhan gyis mu tig blu
translated: If there is anything else besides that, then either the portion or the remainder, or if there is pearl essence, then that itself is for the Buddha. If there are various jewels such as pearls, then with another jewel, one should substitute the pearl.

original: ba dang ; gzhan pas mu tig pa la che 'am mu tig sha dag las gzhan med na /
analyzed: ba dang ; gzhan pas mu tig pa la che 'am mu tig sha dag las gzhan med na /
translated: If there is nothing else besides the pearl essence,

original: ril gyis sangs rgyas la phul cig pa'o //
analyzed: ril gyis sangs rgyas la phul cig pa'o //
translated: then offer the whole to the Buddha.

original: tshon chen po yang ngo zhes pa mtshal dang ting shin la sogs pa tshon po yang sangs rgyas la phul cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshon chen po yang ngo zhes pa mtshal dang ting shin la sogs pa tshon po yang sangs rgyas la phul cig pa'o //
translated: Also the great colors means vermilion, indigo, and so forth. Offer the great colors to the Buddha.

original: btags la 'dis dri gtsang byug par dbul zhes pa ni /
analyzed: btags la 'dis dri gtsang byug par dbul zhes pa ni /
translated: Having tied it, offer this with perfume.🔽 Pearl essence

original: mu tig dang @200a * //
analyzed: mu tig dang @200a * //
translated: and so forth.

original: tshon chen po de dag btags la dri gtsang khang gi skyang nul gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: tshon chen po de dag btags la dri gtsang khang gi skyang nul gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Having dyed those great colors, you should use them to plaster the temple.

original: de ma yin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang dri gtsang khang dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bya zhes pa ni gong du smos pa ma yin pa'i rin po che la sogs pa yo byad gzhan sangs rgyas kyi sku skal du thob pa ni ming
analyzed: de ma yin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi sku gzugs dang dri gtsang khang dang mchod rten gyi yo byad du bya zhes pa ni gong du smos pa ma yin pa'i rin po che la sogs pa yo byad gzhan sangs rgyas kyi sku skal du thob pa ni ming
translated: The other [property] is to be used for the Buddha image, the temple, and the stūpa. This refers to other materials such as jewels that are not mentioned above, which are obtained as a share for the Buddha image.

original: gis smos pa 'di dag gi yo byad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gis smos pa 'di dag gi yo byad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: [The Buddha] says, “You should use them for the materials of these [images] that are mentioned by name.”

original: chos kyi ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bri ba dang seng ge'i stan du'o zhes pa ni chos kyi sku skal du mnga' ba rnams ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu'i smos pa rnams ni bza' ba yin bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi ni sangs rgyas kyi bka' bri ba dang seng ge'i stan du'o zhes pa ni chos kyi sku skal du mnga' ba rnams ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu'i smos pa rnams ni bza' ba yin bar ston pa'o //
translated: [The Buddha] says, “For the Dharma, [you should use them] for writing the Buddha’s words and the lion throne.” This shows that what is obtained as a share for the Dharma body is to be used for the things mentioned by name such as this.

original: theg pa ni sku gzugs la'o zhes pa ni rta dang bzhin pa lta sku gzugs kyi bzhon par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: theg pa ni sku gzugs la'o zhes pa ni rta dang bzhin pa lta sku gzugs kyi bzhon par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: [The Buddha] says, “For the vehicle, [you should use them] for the image.” This means you should use it as a vehicle for the Buddha image, like a horse or a chariot.

original: rgyal mtshan dang de'i smyig ma dang de'i shing rnams ni de'i yo byad du'o zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan dang rgyal mtshan gyi shing dang / smyig ma yang rgyal mtshan gyi yo byad du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rgyal mtshan dang de'i smyig ma dang de'i shing rnams ni de'i yo byad du'o zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan dang rgyal mtshan gyi shing dang / smyig ma yang rgyal mtshan gyi yo byad du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The other weapons are for the Sangha.🔽Having beaten them with a hammer, distribute them.🔽The banner, its bamboo pole, and its wood are for the Sangha.

original: gzhan dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la'o zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi shing ma yin pa'i yol shing dang / khar gsil gyi yu ba la sogs pa gzhan dang de'i mtshon rnams ni dge 'dun gyir gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan dang mtshon cha rnams ni dge 'dun la'o zhes pa ni rgyal mtshan gyi shing ma yin pa'i yol shing dang / khar gsil gyi yu ba la sogs pa gzhan dang de'i mtshon rnams ni dge 'dun gyir gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The other weapons, such as the sword-tree and the handle of the razor, are for the Sangha.🔽Having beaten them with a hammer, distribute them.🔽The other weapons, such as the sword-tree and the handle of the razor, are for the Sangha.

original: de dag khar gsil dang khab dang grir brdungs la brim zhes pa ni ral gri la sogs pa de'i mtshon ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bur gyis la dge 'dun la brims shig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag khar gsil dang khab dang grir brdungs la brim zhes pa ni ral gri la sogs pa de'i mtshon ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bur gyis la dge 'dun la brims shig pa'o //
translated: Having beaten them with a hammer, distribute them.

original: dge 'dun gyi gzhan ni bzhag ba dang bgo ba dang bza' ba rnams gar rigs par bya zhes pa ni gong du smos pa la ma gtogs pa'i yo byad dge 'dun mnga' ba gzhan ni gzhag pa 'am bgo ba 'am bza' ba gar rigs par gyis shig pa'o
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi gzhan ni bzhag ba dang bgo ba dang bza' ba rnams gar rigs par bya zhes pa ni gong du smos pa la ma gtogs pa'i yo byad dge 'dun mnga' ba gzhan ni gzhag pa 'am bgo ba 'am bza' ba gar rigs par gyis shig pa'o
translated: The property of the Sangha that is not included in the above is to be used as appropriate, either by keeping it, distributing it or consuming it.

original: // gar rigs par bya ba'i yo byad nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: // gar rigs par bya ba'i yo byad nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the property that should be used as appropriate?

original: zhing khyim tshong khar mal stan lcags mgar dang / khar ba mkhan dang 'dreg mkhan dang / rdza mkhan dang shing mkhan dang se ba pa rnams kyi lag cha dang / bran pho smos las mi bshol las pa /
analyzed: zhing khyim tshong khar mal stan lcags mgar dang / khar ba mkhan dang 'dreg mkhan dang / rdza mkhan dang shing mkhan dang se ba pa rnams kyi lag cha dang / bran pho smos las mi bshol las pa /
translated: The tools of farmers, shopkeepers, blacksmiths, staff-carriers, barbers, potters, carpenters and weavers, male and female servants, and animals that are not to be used for riding or milk.

original: ba lang / chu glang ra lug sman sangs rgyas kyi gtsug lag gi glegs bam myur du mi 'grub pa'i dbang rgya rnams ni dang po 'dir 'os so zhes pa dang / ras ras chen be'u ras mchil lham lham til mar gyi snod bya ma bum kun 'de gzhan gyi glegs bam /
analyzed: ba lang / chu glang ra lug sman sangs rgyas kyi gtsug lag gi glegs bam myur du mi 'grub pa'i dbang rgya rnams ni dang po 'dir 'os so zhes pa dang / ras ras chen be'u ras mchil lham lham til mar gyi snod bya ma bum kun 'de gzhan gyi glegs bam /
translated: The cow, the water buffalo, the goat, the sheep, the medicine, and the seal for quickly accomplishing the scriptures of the Buddha's teachings are suitable for the first one here.

original: dpang rgya tshon rnams ni gnyi ga la 'dir 'os zhes pa dang / 'bras /
analyzed: dpang rgya tshon rnams ni gnyi ga la 'dir 'os zhes pa dang / 'bras /
translated: The cloth, the large cloth, the calf cloth, the beak shoes, the bird pot of sesame oil, the universal seat, and the seal for the other scriptures are suitable for both.🔽 The rice,

original: til / nas /
analyzed: til / nas /
translated: the sesame,

original: bal sran ser po /
analyzed: bal sran ser po /
translated: the yellow beans,

original: bal sran nag po /
analyzed: bal sran nag po /
translated: the black beans,

original: 'bras bal / zas skom @200b rnams ni gsum pa'i 'o zhes pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'bras bal / zas skom @200b rnams ni gsum pa'i 'o zhes pa rnams yin te /
