analyzed: dge 'dun gyis ni ji lta bu yang bcang du rung ba dang / nor bus spras pa lta bu'i bzang po zhig rnyed na mchod rten la phul @205a * //
translated: The phrase also the Saṃgha may use any kind and if you find a good one decorated with jewels, offer it to the stūpa means that you should offer it to the stūpa.

original: cig pa'o // mal stan dang sngas dang gor bu bcang zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: cig pa'o // mal stan dang sngas dang gor bu bcang zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase use a bed, pillow, and mattress means that you should use these things mentioned by name.

original: bu smad rnyed na sbyin bdag gis dbang du bya zhes pa dang / ldun ji 'dod tsam du lngar gzhug ces pa dang / slar 'bul na yang rung zhes pa ni yon bdag gis ji dga' bar bya zhing ldu na yang yon bdag gi rin ci dpags su bya ba dang /
analyzed: bu smad rnyed na sbyin bdag gis dbang du bya zhes pa dang / ldun ji 'dod tsam du lngar gzhug ces pa dang / slar 'bul na yang rung zhes pa ni yon bdag gis ji dga' bar bya zhing ldu na yang yon bdag gi rin ci dpags su bya ba dang /
translated: If one obtains a son-in-law, he should be under the control of the patron, and If one obtains a wife, she should be under the control of the patron for as long as one desires, and If one offers her back, it is also proper, means that the patron should do as he pleases, and if he obtains a wife, he should be paid the price of the wife by the patron.

original: gzhan yang phul zhing ldu ba'o cog mi rung ba med par ston pa'o //🔽shing la phul ba gal te rgyan zhig na yo lang g-yos pa'i rgyan du bzhag ces pa ni grib shing la sogs pa shing la phul ba'i rdzas rgyan du rung ba'am /🔽rgyan zhig yin na yo lang g-yogs pa'i shing gi rgyan bya ba'i phyir zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang phul zhing ldu ba'o cog mi rung ba med par ston pa'o // shing la phul ba gal te rgyan zhig na yo lang g-yos pa'i rgyan du bzhag ces pa ni grib shing la sogs pa shing la phul ba'i rdzas rgyan du rung ba'am / rgyan zhig yin na yo lang g-yogs pa'i shing gi rgyan bya ba'i phyir zhog shig pa'o //
translated: Moreover, it shows that there is nothing improper in offering and obtaining.🔽If one offers a tree, if it is a decoration, it should be set aside as a decoration for the feast, means that a substance offered to a tree such as a shade tree is suitable as a decoration,🔽or if it is a decoration, it should be set aside as a decoration for the tree of the feast.

original: gal te gnas khang gi rtsig pa la ni bri ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnas khang gi rtsig pa la phul ba zhig na de'i ri mo bri ba'i rgyur gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gal te gnas khang gi rtsig pa la ni bri ba'i phyir ro zhes pa ni gnas khang gi rtsig pa la phul ba zhig na de'i ri mo bri ba'i rgyur gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it is a wall of a house, it is for the purpose of painting, means that if one offers a wall of a house, it should be used as the cause for painting it.

original: gal te ma yin na ka ba dang las sar pa'i 'o zhes pa ni gnas khang gi rtsig pa ma yin pa'i rtsig pa gzhan la phul ba zhig na ka ba'am bcos legs kyi rgyur zhog shig pa'o //
analyzed: gal te ma yin na ka ba dang las sar pa'i 'o zhes pa ni gnas khang gi rtsig pa ma yin pa'i rtsig pa gzhan la phul ba zhig na ka ba'am bcos legs kyi rgyur zhog shig pa'o //
translated: If not, then if it is offered to another wall, not the wall of the residence, then make it the cause of a pillar or a well-built house.

original: sa zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba thams cad dang sbyar bar ston pa'o //🔽me gang gir na sbrang bar bya zhes pa ni me khang gi sar phul na snang bar sgyur cig pa'o //
analyzed: sa zhes pa ni 'og nas 'byung ba thams cad dang sbyar bar ston pa'o // me gang gir na sbrang bar bya zhes pa ni me khang gi sar phul na snang bar sgyur cig pa'o //
translated: The word ground shows that it is to be applied to everything that follows.🔽 If it is offered to the place of the fire house, then make it the light.

original: snum pa'i rnyed pa'am zhes pa ni me khang gi sar phul ba yang snum gyi rnyed par gyis shig pa'o //🔽nad pa'i rung ba'i sar sman du bzhag ces pa ni sman bzhag pa'i gnas su phul na sman du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: snum pa'i rnyed pa'am zhes pa ni me khang gi sar phul ba yang snum gyi rnyed par gyis shig pa'o // nad pa'i rung ba'i sar sman du bzhag ces pa ni sman bzhag pa'i gnas su phul na sman du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it is offered to the place of the fire house, then make it the light.🔽 If it is offered to the place of the sick person, then make it medicine.🔽 If it is offered to the place of the sick person, then make it medicine.

original: tshang bar gir na zas su bya zhes pa ni tshang bar sar phul na zas su gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: tshang bar gir na zas su bya zhes pa ni tshang bar sar phul na zas su gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If it is offered to the place of the assembly, then make it food.🔽 If it is offered to the place of the assembly, then make it food.

original: gru tshang du na btung bar ro zhes pa ni gru tshar du phul na /
analyzed: gru tshang du na btung bar ro zhes pa ni gru tshar du phul na /
translated: If it is offered to the place of the boat, then make it drink.

original: skom du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: skom du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Drink it!🔽If one offers a sauna, one will be given a sauna.

original: bsro gang du na sro bar ro zhes pa dang / snum pa'i rnyed pa'i rnyed pa'am zhes pa ni bsro gang du phul na bsro ba'am /🔽snum gyi rnyed par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsro gang du na sro bar ro zhes pa dang / snum pa'i rnyed pa'i rnyed pa'am zhes pa ni bsro gang du phul na bsro ba'am / snum gyi rnyed par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If one offers a bath, one will be given a bath.🔽If one offers a bathhouse, one will be given a bathhouse.🔽If one offers a monastery, one will be given a monastery.🔽If one offers a temple, one will be given a temple.🔽If one offers a courtyard, one will be given a courtyard.

original: bkad sa dang 'dun tshar na snum gyi rnyed par ro zhes pa dang / rabs bri ba'am zhes pa ni bkad sa dang / 'dun sar phul ba lta bu snum gyi rnyed pa'am /🔽byang chub sems dpa'i rabs gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bkad sa dang 'dun tshar na snum gyi rnyed par ro zhes pa dang / rabs bri ba'am zhes pa ni bkad sa dang / 'dun sar phul ba lta bu snum gyi rnyed pa'am / byang chub sems dpa'i rabs gyis shig pa'o //
translated: If one offers a gateway, one will be given a gateway.🔽If one offers a portico, one will be given a portico.🔽If one offers a pavilion, one will be given a pavilion.🔽If one offers a skylight, one will be given a skylight.

original: dag ra dang 'chags dang sgo khang dang / chags khyams sun bgo zhes pa dang / mthongs kyang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di lta bu'i phyogs bzhi dge 'dun gyir gzhag go zhes kyang kha cig ces pa ni dgar la sogs par phul ba ni bgo ba dang @205b mthongs su phul ba yang bgo ba'o //
analyzed: dag ra dang 'chags dang sgo khang dang / chags khyams sun bgo zhes pa dang / mthongs kyang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di lta bu'i phyogs bzhi dge 'dun gyir gzhag go zhes kyang kha cig ces pa ni dgar la sogs par phul ba ni bgo ba dang @205b mthongs su phul ba yang bgo ba'o //
translated: Some say, “In this way, the four directions are to be set aside for the Saṅgha.”

original: slob dpon kha cig ni mthongs su phul ba phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyir bzhag gi bgo ba ma yin no zhes 'chad pa yang yod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon kha cig ni mthongs su phul ba phyogs bzhi'i dge 'dun gyir bzhag gi bgo ba ma yin no zhes 'chad pa yang yod par ston pa'o //
translated: Some masters explain that it is not to be shared, since it is set aside for the Saṅgha of the four directions.🔽It is proper to request for the sake of the Three Jewels, and it is also proclaimed, and it is accepted.

original: dkon mchog gi phyir bslang ba rung zhes pa dang / bsgrags pa yang ngo zhes pa dang / len pa'o zhes pa dang / snang bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor lo bya zhes pa dang / tsha ba dang / rlung dang / char pas mi brdzi bar khang pa rtseg ma sgo bzhi pa bya zhes pa dang /
analyzed: dkon mchog gi phyir bslang ba rung zhes pa dang / bsgrags pa yang ngo zhes pa dang / len pa'o zhes pa dang / snang bar bya ba'i phyir 'khor lo bya zhes pa dang / tsha ba dang / rlung dang / char pas mi brdzi bar khang pa rtseg ma sgo bzhi pa bya zhes pa dang /
translated: A wheel is to be made for the sake of illumination, and a four-doored mansion is to be made that cannot be destroyed by heat, wind, or rain.

original: yo lang gi rjes la 'khod la btul zhes pa ni dkon mchog gi phyir yon bdag la ched du yang bslang zhing /
analyzed: yo lang gi rjes la 'khod la btul zhes pa ni dkon mchog gi phyir yon bdag la ched du yang bslang zhing /

original: shing rta'i steng du yon bdag gi ji phul bas sgrogs shing spyoms pa'i yo lang dang rlung dang char pa 'ongs na khang pa rtseg ma la sogs pa'i yo lang lan kar gyis shig pa dang / yo lang brim pa'i rjes la rtul cig pa'o //

translated: When there is a feast on a chariot, or a feast in a multi-storied building, and so on, when it rains or blows, one should cover it with a canopy.

analyzed: dkor bas rnyed pa spa zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi rnyed pa 'di sbos shig pa'o // ston pa mchod pa'i tshe gnyis la ma phye bar phul na dge 'dun gyi ste dge slong ma mi chud ces pa ni ston pa mchod pa'i tshe yon bdag gis gnyi ga la dbul bar gnyis kyis ma phye ba lta bu ni dge slong pha nyi tshe dbang
translated: After the feast is distributed, one should clean it up.🔽When the Teacher is worshipped, if one offers without distinguishing the two, it belongs to the Saṅgha, and the nuns are not included.

original: gi dge slong ma mi dbang ba'o //
analyzed: gi dge slong ma mi dbang ba'o //

translated: When the Teacher is worshipped,

translated: The line this should be accumulated and the line what is suitable for sale should be sold and the line the assembly of the saṅgha and the line should be moved and the line this should be used for the service of the saṅgha means that the wealth of the stūpa should be distributed and that the saṅgha should be served by that wealth.

translated: One should not sell humans, or a monastery, or its property, or bedding. This shows that one should not sell or exchange these things mentioned by name.

analyzed: gtar mi gzhug ces pa ni kun dga' dang gtsug lag khang la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams gtar ma gzhug shig pa'o //
translated: One should not bleed them. One should not bleed the monastery, etc., mentioned above.

translated: One should not consecrate them. One should not consecrate dyed cloth as a robe.

original: pha ma la gos dang zas bstab ces pa dang / lhung bzed dang chos gos las rnyed pa lhag pa med na bslang zhes pa dang / ma grub na bza' ba'i phyed kyang sbyin zhes pa ni pha ma la zas dang gos stobs shig pa dang /

translated: One should give food and clothing to one’s parents, and if one does not have any extra alms-bowl or robes, one should request them, and if that is not possible, one should give half of one’s food. This means that one should give food and clothing to one’s parents.

analyzed: med na gzhan las slongs shig pa dang / bslangs te yang ma rnyed na zas las kyang phyed chod de byin cig pa'o //
translated: If one does not have any, one should request them from others, and if one does not get them by requesting, one should give half of one’s food.

original: phran tshegs la sogs pa gos kyi dngos por gtogs so //
analyzed: phran tshegs la sogs pa gos kyi dngos por gtogs so //

analyzed: phran tshegs dang zhus pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni /
translated: The summary of the questions and answers that appear in the Ksudraka is taught:

original: bye brag shes par bya ba'i phyir gos la mtshan ma gdab ces pa ni mi 'dra ba bye brag mi phyed pa'i mtshan ma gos la thob shig pa'o //
analyzed: bye brag shes par bya ba'i phyir gos la mtshan ma gdab ces pa ni mi 'dra ba bye brag mi phyed pa'i mtshan ma gos la thob shig pa'o //
translated: In order to know the distinctions, one should place a mark on the clothing. This means that one should place a mark on the clothing in order to distinguish it from similar, indistinguishable items.

original: de la gdab par bya zhes pa dang / snag tsha'i thig le ni de'o zhes pa ni gos la snag tsha'i thig le gcig gam gnyis byas na /
analyzed: de la gdab par bya zhes pa dang / snag tsha'i thig le ni de'o zhes pa ni gos la snag tsha'i thig le gcig gam gnyis byas na /
translated: In that case, one should place it, and the drop of ink is that. This means that if one makes one or two drops of ink on the clothing,

original: de la mtshan ma btab pa yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de la mtshan ma btab pa yin par ston pa'o //
translated: it shows that a mark has been placed on it.

original: sbyang ba yang ngo zhes pa ni be'u ras lta bu lci ba breng la sbyang ba dang / lcang gis mi thub na srad bu'i 'ong nga las @207a * //
analyzed: sbyang ba yang ngo zhes pa ni be'u ras lta bu lci ba breng la sbyang ba dang / lcang gis mi thub na srad bu'i 'ong nga las @207a * //
translated: Also purification. This means that if a heavy cloth such as a woolen blanket is not able to be washed, one should put it in a bag made of string

original: btsud la 'or cig pa'o //
analyzed: btsud la 'or cig pa'o //
translated: and wash it.

original: kha tshar dang mtha' tshar gyi gor cha ga bya zhes pa ni kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pa'i rjes la cha ga gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: kha tshar dang mtha' tshar gyi gor cha ga bya zhes pa ni kha tshar dang mtha' tshar bcad pa'i rjes la cha ga gyis shig pa'o //
translated: One should place a patch on the place of the edge and the end. This means that after cutting the edge and the end, one should place a patch.

original: sbyar ma ma yin pa ni dras te byin gyis brlab bar nges pa med ces pa ni sbyar ma ma yin pa'i chos gos gzhan ma drar mi rung bar nges pa med de chos gos sbyar ma yang rkyen gyis thebs na ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab🔽dgos pas na'o //
analyzed: sbyar ma ma yin pa ni dras te byin gyis brlab bar nges pa med ces pa ni sbyar ma ma yin pa'i chos gos gzhan ma drar mi rung bar nges pa med de chos gos sbyar ma yang rkyen gyis thebs na ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab dgos pas na'o //
translated: The non-patch robe is not necessarily cut and consecrated. This means that it is not certain that other non-patch robes are not suitable to be cut, because if the patch robe is also affected by circumstances, it must be consecrated without being cut.

original: de dang 'dra ba'i rkyen med par 'di ma dras pa dang / grong dang khyim du 'jug cing 'dug par mi bya zhes pa dang / mu stegs pa'i gnas su yang de bzhin zhes pa ni chos gos bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen gyis ma thebs na ma dras pas chos gos gyon la ming gis smos pa'i gnas 'di rnams su 'gro ba'am 'dug par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba'i rkyen med par 'di ma dras pa dang / grong dang khyim du 'jug cing 'dug par mi bya zhes pa dang / mu stegs pa'i gnas su yang de bzhin zhes pa ni chos gos bskur du mi rung ba'i rkyen gyis ma thebs na ma dras pas chos gos gyon la ming gis smos pa'i gnas 'di rnams su 'gro ba'am 'dug par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: If there are no such circumstances, one should not enter and stay in a village or house without cutting it, and one should not do the same in the abode of the tīrthikas. This means that if one is not affected by circumstances that make it unsuitable to send the robe, one should wear the robe without cutting it, and one should not go or stay in these places mentioned by name.

original: yod na mi 'dug ces pa ni mu stegs pa'i gnas su 'ongs pa'i tshe mu stegs pa yod na de'i thad dus la 'dug shig pa'o //
analyzed: yod na mi 'dug ces pa ni mu stegs pa'i gnas su 'ongs pa'i tshe mu stegs pa yod na de'i thad dus la 'dug shig pa'o //
translated: If there are tīrthikas, one should not stay in their presence. This means that when one comes to the abode of the tīrthikas, if there are tīrthikas, one should not stay in their presence.

original: spu can la chos gos gsum du byin gyis mi brlab ces pa dang / de bgos te zas mi bza' zhes pa ni spu yod pa'i gos la 'di dag ltar ma byed cig pa'o //🔽seng ras bdag gir bya zhes pa dang / 'di ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes pa dang / bal gyi dang zar ma'i dang du gu la'i dang shing bal gyi rnams so zhes pa dang / gzhan yang ras kyi rnam pa dang phrug la sogs pa yang ba rnams so zhes pa dang /
analyzed: spu can la chos gos gsum du byin gyis mi brlab ces pa dang / de bgos te zas mi bza' zhes pa ni spu yod pa'i gos la 'di dag ltar ma byed cig pa'o // seng ras bdag gir bya zhes pa dang / 'di ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes pa dang / bal gyi dang zar ma'i dang du gu la'i dang shing bal gyi rnams so zhes pa dang / gzhan yang ras kyi rnam pa dang phrug la sogs pa yang ba rnams so zhes pa dang /
translated: The statement One should not consecrate the woolen cloth as the three robes and One should not eat food wearing that means that one should not do these things with cloth that has wool.

original: la ba yang ngo zhes pa'i seng ras ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu dang / gzhan yang ras kyi rnam pa la sogs pa yang ba'i gos ni chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: la ba yang ngo zhes pa'i seng ras ming gis smos pa 'di dag lta bu dang / gzhan yang ras kyi rnam pa la sogs pa yang ba'i gos ni chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The statement One should keep woolen cloth and These are the four types and They are woolen, cotton, dukūla, and silk and One should also keep other light cloth such as linen and One should also keep blankets indicates that one should keep woolen cloth that is mentioned by name and other light cloth such as linen.

original: 'tshe ba ma yin na bzlog cing mi bgo zhes pa dang / 'di bzhin du bgos te mi bcag ces pa ni shig za ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis btab pa ma yin na spu can phyir slog tu ma byed cig pa dang / phyi zlog byas na yang de gyon la phan tshun du ma 'gro shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'tshe ba ma yin na bzlog cing mi bgo zhes pa dang / 'di bzhin du bgos te mi bcag ces pa ni shig za ba la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis btab pa ma yin na spu can phyir slog tu ma byed cig pa dang / phyi zlog byas na yang de gyon la phan tshun du ma 'gro shig pa'o //
translated: If it is not torn, one should not turn it inside out and not tear it. This means that if it is not damaged by the conditions of wearing it, such as being eaten by bugs, one should not turn it inside out. If one does turn it inside out, one should not go about wearing it like that.

original: aa rya na'i la ba dang be'u ras dang dre'u rdog khra bo rnams gang zag nyid kyir bya zhing mi spyod ces pa dang / 'chag sar dre'u bting ba ni sdom par bya zhes pa dang / rtag par gcig tshugs su mi bcag ces pa dang /
analyzed: aa rya na'i la ba dang be'u ras dang dre'u rdog khra bo rnams gang zag nyid kyir bya zhing mi spyod ces pa dang / 'chag sar dre'u bting ba ni sdom par bya zhes pa dang / rtag par gcig tshugs su mi bcag ces pa dang /
translated: One should not use the āryana cloth, the cloth of a calf, or the cloth of a donkey, which are for individuals. One should not use the cloth spread on the walking path. One should not tear it constantly in one place.

original: nus na bcos pa ni btsem pa dang mnan pa dang glan par bya zhes pa rnams ni aa rya na'i la ba la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams gang zag nyid kyir bya ba dang / 'chag sar dre'u rdog lta bu khra bo bting na sdom par bya zhing spyod pa dang /
analyzed: nus na bcos pa ni btsem pa dang mnan pa dang glan par bya zhes pa rnams ni aa rya na'i la ba la sogs pa ming gis smos pa rnams gang zag nyid kyir bya ba dang / 'chag sar dre'u rdog lta bu khra bo bting na sdom par bya zhing spyod pa dang /
translated: If one spreads a multicolored mat on the walking path, like a donkey’s hoof, one should practice with restraint.

original: btsem pa'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: btsem pa'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: These are the methods of darning.

original: @207b de la aarya na zhes pa ni par gyi la ba bzang po be'u ras zhes pa ni spu ring po'i be'u ras la bya'o //
analyzed: @207b de la aarya na zhes pa ni par gyi la ba bzang po be'u ras zhes pa ni spu ring po'i be'u ras la bya'o //
translated: “Āryana” refers to a good blanket. “Calf wool” refers to wool with long fur.

original: ma nus na lci ba dang sas bcag sa de bsku zhes pa ni rnying pa ste gong ma ltar glan cing btsem du yang mi rung na /
analyzed: ma nus na lci ba dang sas bcag sa de bsku zhes pa ni rnying pa ste gong ma ltar glan cing btsem du yang mi rung na /
translated: If one is unable to do so, one should break it with clay and earth. “Break” means to break up the old blanket. If it is not suitable to darn and sew it as above,

original: des bcag sa skyang nul du bsku ba'i ched du gyis shig pa'o zhes pa dang / sbyin bdag la yid brtan te'o zhes pa ni gong ma lta bu la ba spu ring po ma yin pa ni sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang ba'o //🔽sham thabs kyi 'theb dang rdul gzhan gyi 'theb zhes pa dang / yo byad kyi gos kyang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di ni dkar ba dang kha tshar dang mtha' tshar yod kyang nyes med ces pa dang / dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa 'di sham thabs la sogs pa'i 'theb dang /
analyzed: des bcag sa skyang nul du bsku ba'i ched du gyis shig pa'o zhes pa dang / sbyin bdag la yid brtan te'o zhes pa ni gong ma lta bu la ba spu ring po ma yin pa ni sbyin bdag la yid brtan te bcang ba'o // sham thabs kyi 'theb dang rdul gzhan gyi 'theb zhes pa dang / yo byad kyi gos kyang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di ni dkar ba dang kha tshar dang mtha' tshar yod kyang nyes med ces pa dang / dge 'dun gyi yang ngo zhes pa 'di sham thabs la sogs pa'i 'theb dang /
translated: The phrase one should wear it after cutting it means that one should cut it in order to make it even. The phrase one should wear it after having confidence in the patron means that one should wear it after having confidence in the patron, if the robe is not long-haired.🔽The phrase the hem of the lower robe and the hem of the other robe and the phrase one should also wear the robe of requisites and the phrase this is faultless if it has a white border and a border of thread and the phrase also of the community mean that one should wear the hem of the lower robe and so on.

original: sman zong la sogs pa'i gos bcang ba dang / de dag dang / dge 'dun gyi dkar zhing kha tshar ma bcad kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: sman zong la sogs pa'i gos bcang ba dang / de dag dang / dge 'dun gyi dkar zhing kha tshar ma bcad kyang bla ba'o //
translated: The phrase and so on means that one should wear the robe of medicine and so on, and that one should wear the white robe of the community even if the border of thread is not cut.

original: gnang ba'i gos rnams de dag nyid du byin du brlab cing bcad zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i yo byad bcu gsum de dag so so'i ming ngang tshul bzhin du byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
analyzed: gnang ba'i gos rnams de dag nyid du byin du brlab cing bcad zhes pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gnang ba'i yo byad bcu gsum de dag so so'i ming ngang tshul bzhin du byin gyis rlobs shig pa'o //
translated: The thirteen articles permitted by the Bhagavān are blessed according to their individual names and characteristics.

original: rung bar byas na gzhan du ma yang bcang zhes pa dang / sems mi brtan pa la rung bar mi bya zhes pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ma yin zhes pa dang / mngon du ma yin zhes pa ni rung ba'i cho ga byas na yo byad bcu gsum du ma zad kyi phal po che du ma bcangs kyang nyes med pa dang /
analyzed: rung bar byas na gzhan du ma yang bcang zhes pa dang / sems mi brtan pa la rung bar mi bya zhes pa dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ma yin zhes pa dang / mngon du ma yin zhes pa ni rung ba'i cho ga byas na yo byad bcu gsum du ma zad kyi phal po che du ma bcangs kyang nyes med pa dang /
translated: If one makes them suitable, one may also keep other things. One should not make them suitable for the unstable mind, nor for the unordained, nor in the presence of others. If one performs the rite of suitability, not only the thirteen articles, but also many other things may be kept without fault.

original: rung bar byas pa sems mi brtan pa la sogs pa smyon pa la mi bya ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang de'i mngon sum du rung bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: rung bar byas pa sems mi brtan pa la sogs pa smyon pa la mi bya ba dang / bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang de'i mngon sum du rung bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: One should not make the suitable for the unstable mind and so on, the insane, nor for the unordained, nor in their presence.

original: yul gud na 'dug kyang rung ba mi 'jig ces pa dang / shi na 'jig ces pa dang / shes na'o zhes pa ni su'i ming gis rung bar byas pa de shi bar ma shes kyi bar du yul gud na 'dug kyang mi 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: yul gud na 'dug kyang rung ba mi 'jig ces pa dang / shi na 'jig ces pa dang / shes na'o zhes pa ni su'i ming gis rung bar byas pa de shi bar ma shes kyi bar du yul gud na 'dug kyang mi 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is suitable by whose name it is made suitable, until it is known that the one who died is dead, even if the object is elsewhere, it is not destroyed.🔽This is the master of making suitable.🔽Do not make the relinquished your own.

original: 'di rung bar byed pa bdag po'o zhes pa dang / spangs pa bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni rung bar byed pa nyid bdag po yin pa dang / su la spangs pa de yo lang du ma bskur cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rung bar byed pa bdag po'o zhes pa dang / spangs pa bdag gir mi bya zhes pa ni rung bar byed pa nyid bdag po yin pa dang / su la spangs pa de yo lang du ma bskur cig pa'o //
translated: This is that the one who makes suitable is the master, and to whom the relinquished is not given, do not give it to him.🔽Relinquish to the monk,🔽not to the saṅgha,🔽not to the unskilled,🔽take it if it is not given,🔽and take it by force.

original: dge slong la spang zhes pa dang / dge 'dun ma yin zhes pa dang / mi mkhas pa lam yin zhes pa dang / ma byin na blang zhes pa dang / mthus kyang blang zhes pa rnams ni su la spang bar bya ba dang / su la mi spang ba dang spangs nas mi ster na blang ba'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong la spang zhes pa dang / dge 'dun ma yin zhes pa dang / mi mkhas pa lam yin zhes pa dang / ma byin na blang zhes pa dang / mthus kyang blang zhes pa rnams ni su la spang bar bya ba dang / su la mi spang ba dang spangs nas mi ster na blang ba'i thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: These are the methods of taking if it is not given to whom the relinquished is to be given, to whom it is not to be given, and if it is relinquished but not given.

original: gos la bsung gis gos na bkrus te @208a * //
analyzed: gos la bsung gis gos na bkrus te @208a * //
translated: If the robes are stained by perfume, wash them.🔽If they are stained by flour, shake them. If they are stained by oil, clean them.

original: bgo zhes pa dang / phye mas na sprug ces pa dang / snum gyis na 'dag pas so zhes pa rnams ni gos la tsan dan la sogs pa bsung gis gos sam phye mas reg gam snum gyis phog na thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: bgo zhes pa dang / phye mas na sprug ces pa dang / snum gyis na 'dag pas so zhes pa rnams ni gos la tsan dan la sogs pa bsung gis gos sam phye mas reg gam snum gyis phog na thabs 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: These refer to the following. If the robes are stained by perfume such as sandalwood, or touched by flour, or stained by oil, you should use these methods to clean them.🔽If it is raining, do not go out in the robes of the saṅgha without a covering.

original: char 'bab na bla gab med par dge 'dun gyi ma yin zhes pa dang / bkru ba dang / tshon dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing gshegs pa la sogs pa'i tshe ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gos ma gyon cig pa'o //
analyzed: char 'bab na bla gab med par dge 'dun gyi ma yin zhes pa dang / bkru ba dang / tshon dang lhung bzed kyi las dang shing gshegs pa la sogs pa'i tshe ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu'i tshe dge 'dun gyi gos ma gyon cig pa'o //

translated: Give the share of the offerings.🔽The monk is not the senior of the nun in receiving alms. This means that since the monk is the senior of the nun, the monk should take the seat, water for washing, and so on first.

translated: If others come for the sake of the food that has been prepared for the sick, then one should inform the donors.

original: shi na stong g-yogs smad g-yogs dang bcas te bskyal zhes pa dang / 'bring gis so zhes pa dang / lhag par ma yin zhes pa ni shi ba'i rus bu gcer bur mi dor bar stong g-yogs dang smad g-yogs 'bring pos g-yogs shing bskyal gyi de las lhag pas kyang ma yin par ston pa'o //

translated: The phrase if he dies, he should be carried with an upper and lower garment means that the bones of the dead should not be left naked, but should be carried with an upper garment and a middle garment, and not with anything more than that.

original: zhus pa dang bcas pa'i phran tshegs la sogs pa gos kyi dngos por gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa dang bcas pa'i phran tshegs la sogs pa gos kyi dngos por gtogs pa'o //
translated: The miscellaneous topics with questions and so forth are included in the topic of robes.

original: gos kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
analyzed: gos kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: The topic of robes is finished.

original: // / gos kyi dngos po de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: // / gos kyi dngos po de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught the topic of robes in that way,

original: khol lpags dngos po da ston pa ni /
analyzed: khol lpags dngos po da ston pa ni /
translated: now, the topic of leather is taught.

analyzed: yul dbus kyi mtshams ni zhes pa la sogs pa yin te yul mtha' khob tu ni khol lpags spyod du gnang ba la dbus dang mtha'i tshad je ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase the border of the central region and so forth shows the allowance to use leather in the border regions, and teaches the measure of the central and border regions.

original: de la shar phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
analyzed: de la shar phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
translated: In that regard, the eastern border is:

analyzed: shar phyogs kyi spu 'dra bar dha na 'i mdun du phu 'dra ka tsha zhes bya ba'i tshal lo zhes pa yin no //
translated: In the east, in front of the country of Pu-tra, is the forest called Pu-traka-tsa.

original: lho phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
analyzed: lho phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
translated: In the south,

analyzed: 'di lho phyogs @209b ni sha ra pa te zhes bya ba de'i ming gi chu klung ngo zhes pa yin no //
translated: in the country of the south is the river called Sara-pati.

original: nub phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
analyzed: nub phyogs kyi mtshams ni /
translated: In the west,

original: bram ze'i grong sthu na dang / au pa sthu na'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: bram ze'i grong sthu na dang / au pa sthu na'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: are the brahmin villages of Sthuna and Upa-sthuna.🔽In the north,

original: byang phyogs kyi mtshams ni ri au shi ra'o zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: byang phyogs kyi mtshams ni ri au shi ra'o zhes pa yin no //
translated: is the mountain called Usiragiri.

original: mtha' 'khob tu lham bcang zhes pa ni sa mtshams gong du smos pa las ma gtogs pa'i mtha' 'khob tu lham chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: mtha' 'khob tu lham bcang zhes pa ni sa mtshams gong du smos pa las ma gtogs pa'i mtha' 'khob tu lham chongs shig pa'o //

original: mal stan sba ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gzims chal bag bya ba'i phyir ni yul dbus su yang lham chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: mal stan sba ba'i phyir yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi gzims chal bag bya ba'i phyir ni yul dbus su yang lham chongs shig pa'o //
translated: In the central region, one should also wear shoes in order to protect the bedding.

original: chig rkyang ngo zhes pa dang / lhan pa gdab cing bcos zhes pa dang / rim pa gzhan gyis ma yin zhes pa ni mchil cig rkyang par bya ba dang / rdol na lhan pa nyis rim dum byed par 'brong mig du klon cig pa'o //
analyzed: chig rkyang ngo zhes pa dang / lhan pa gdab cing bcos zhes pa dang / rim pa gzhan gyis ma yin zhes pa ni mchil cig rkyang par bya ba dang / rdol na lhan pa nyis rim dum byed par 'brong mig du klon cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase only one means that it should be made with only one layer. The phrase to patch and repair means that if it is torn, one should patch it with two layers. The phrase not by another process means that one should not make a shoe with many layers.

original: khyim pas gom pa bdun yan chad spyad na rim pa mang po yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pas ji tsam du spyad na mchil rim pa mang por byas pa'i lham yang chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pas gom pa bdun yan chad spyad na rim pa mang po yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pas ji tsam du spyad na mchil rim pa mang por byas pa'i lham yang chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase if a householder uses more than seven patches, many layers are also acceptable means that if a householder uses many patches, he may also use many layers in his shoes.

original: rung ba tsam gyi phyir de'i ched du blangs pa ni mi rung ba blangs pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong gcig la khyim pas lham rim pa mang po byin pa chig rkyang du bya ba'i phyir khyer ba bzhin du mi rung ba 'am /
analyzed: rung ba tsam gyi phyir de'i ched du blangs pa ni mi rung ba blangs pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge slong gcig la khyim pas lham rim pa mang po byin pa chig rkyang du bya ba'i phyir khyer ba bzhin du mi rung ba 'am /
translated: The phrase if one takes it for the purpose of making it suitable, it is not taking what is unsuitable means that if a householder gives a monk shoes with many layers, if the monk takes them in order to make them suitable by making them with only one layer, he does not commit a fault.

original: ma gnang bar rung bcos pa'i phyir khyer ba ni nyes med pa'o //

translated: The phrase these six means that one should do these six things. The phrase in a secluded place means that one should do these things in a secluded place. original: khyim pa der gzhan med na pags pa la 'dug par bya zhes pa dang / 'dir de lta bu'i rkyen gyis na'ang mi zhal ba yang ngo zhes pa ni khyim pa der 'ongs la stan med na khol lpags kyi stan la yang 'dug shig pa'o /

translated: The phrase this is for all hemorrhoids means that this is for all hemorrhoids. The phrase on the many, a single layer means that on the many, a single layer.

translated: One should not carry the sinews, bones, tusks, flesh, or fat of those whose skin is prohibited.🔽One should carry a bag,🔽or a white one,🔽but not a variegated one.

translated: One should carry a bag of a respected person or a white ordinary one.

analyzed: rgyal mi shes pa dang sta gon ma byas par 'jing zab mor mi 'jug ces pa dang / phyogs dben par rkyal bslab ces pa dang / rkyal ba na khyu mchog ma gtogs par ba la mi ltos zhes pa dang / glang po rta chu klung g-yog la ltos zhes pa ni rkyal mi shes par 'jing du ma 'gro shig pa dang /

analyzed: phyogs dben par rgyal bslab cing ming gis smos pa 'di dag la 'jus te rgal bar gyis shig pa'o //

analyzed: sman la bsten par bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te sman gyis shig pa'o //

original: 'di ni rnam pa bzhi'o zhes pa ni dus kyi sman dang / thun gyi sman dang / bdun pa'i sman dang / tshe gcig gi sman dang rnam pa bzhi yod par ston pa'o //

translated: The first is not for the sick. The remaining three are medicines for the sick.🔽Sugar is for everyone.🔽Sugar, molasses, honey, ghee, and oil are for everyone, both the sick and the healthy.

analyzed: rgun 'brum dang / kha rdzu ra'i skom rnams ni thams cad kyi'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag gi skom @211a * //
translated: Sugarcane juice, grape juice, and pomegranate juice are for everyone.

original: thams cad kyis dus dang dus ma yin par btung du rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis dus dang dus ma yin par btung du rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: These drinks are allowed at all times, both when it is the right time and when it is not.

original: dgun tshva tsa dang / zho ku chur ku /
analyzed: dgun tshva tsa dang / zho ku chur ku /
translated: In winter, one may drink hot gruel and hot milk.

original: rtsab mo rnams chus bslad pa dang / tshags kyis btsags te bzhin snang bar gdang la kha dog 'dab ma'i mdog 'dra na de bzhin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag gi skom gdang khyad 'di tsam du btsags na gong ma dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: rtsab mo rnams chus bslad pa dang / tshags kyis btsags te bzhin snang bar gdang la kha dog 'dab ma'i mdog 'dra na de bzhin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag gi skom gdang khyad 'di tsam du btsags na gong ma dang 'dra bar ston pa'o //
translated: The roots are spoiled by water and strained by a cloth. If the color of the liquid is like the color of the leaves, it is like that. This is said by name. If it is strained to this extent, it is shown to be like the above.

original: de ltar ma gyur pa'i snga rol du ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'am mtshan mthun pas reg par bya ba'i mi rigs so zhes pa ni gdang khyad gong ma tsam du ma gyur cing ma bslad pa'i tshe ni mtshan mthun pa'i bsnyen par rdzogs pas reg par ma byed
analyzed: de ltar ma gyur pa'i snga rol du ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa'am mtshan mthun pas reg par bya ba'i mi rigs so zhes pa ni gdang khyad gong ma tsam du ma gyur cing ma bslad pa'i tshe ni mtshan mthun pa'i bsnyen par rdzogs pas reg par ma byed
translated: Before it becomes like that, it is not suitable to touch one who is fully ordained or has similar characteristics. This means that when it is not spoiled and does not have the above special color, one should not touch one who is fully ordained with similar characteristics.

original: cig pa'o // aa ru ra la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni aa ru ra dang dang skyu rur dang ba rur dgan le sham dag pi pi ling lnga yang thams cad kyis bzar rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: cig pa'o // aa ru ra la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni aa ru ra dang dang skyu rur dang ba rur dgan le sham dag pi pi ling lnga yang thams cad kyis bzar rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: Also myrobalan and so on. This shows that all five - myrobalan, sour fruit, ba ru ra, long pepper, and pippali - are suitable to be eaten.

original: bur ma yang ngo zhes pa ni bu ra ma byin gyis brlabs pa yang gong ma ltar 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: bur ma yang ngo zhes pa ni bu ra ma byin gyis brlabs pa yang gong ma ltar 'dra ba'o //
translated: This is similar to the above consecration of jaggery.🔽This jaggery consecrated by the path, the caretaker of the house, and the field worker is suitable to eat like a patient, and this is also suitable to eat at the wrong time by one who has fasted.

original: lam bgrod pa dang khang skyong dang / las sar pas byin gyis brlabs pa 'di nad pa bzhin du bzar rung zhes pa dang / zan bcad pas 'di dang dus ma yin pa'i bza' ba yang ngo zhes pa ni bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis nad pa dang 'dra bar bzang rung ba dang /
analyzed: lam bgrod pa dang khang skyong dang / las sar pas byin gyis brlabs pa 'di nad pa bzhin du bzar rung zhes pa dang / zan bcad pas 'di dang dus ma yin pa'i bza' ba yang ngo zhes pa ni bu ram byin gyis brlabs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis nad pa dang 'dra bar bzang rung ba dang /
translated: These mentioned by name, consecrated jaggery, are suitable to eat like a patient.

original: smyung bas kyang de bzar rung zhing dus ma yin pa'i zas sbrang rtsi la sogs pa yang bzar rung ba'o //
analyzed: smyung bas kyang de bzar rung zhing dus ma yin pa'i zas sbrang rtsi la sogs pa yang bzar rung ba'o //
translated: Also fasting is suitable to eat that, and it is suitable to eat the wrong time food such as honey.

original: skom ni thun gyi'o zhes pa dang / gdang na'o zhes pa ni thun gyi sman skom gdang ba yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: skom ni thun gyi'o zhes pa dang / gdang na'o zhes pa ni thun gyi sman skom gdang ba yin par ston pa'o //
translated: Drink is for the period, and when thirsty is for the period medicine drink when thirsty.

original: rdzas de der ma gyur la gal te dus kyi na bsnyen par ma rdzogs par mnye zhing tshags kyis btsag go zhes pa ni dgun lta bu dus kyi sman las bkru zhing btsags pa gdang bar ma gyur bar du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas mnye zhing btsags pa🔽la sogs pa'i las gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas de der ma gyur la gal te dus kyi na bsnyen par ma rdzogs par mnye zhing tshags kyis btsag go zhes pa ni dgun lta bu dus kyi sman las bkru zhing btsags pa gdang bar ma gyur bar du bsnyen par ma rdzogs pas mnye zhing btsags pa la sogs pa'i las gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This means that if the medicine of the time, such as winter, is not ready to be washed and boiled, then knead it and boil it in a pot until the vow is taken.🔽Other substances such as cherry and madhuka seeds, etc.

original: de dag las gzhan pa se'u dang ma tu lung 'bru la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang ngo zhes pa ni se'u dang ma tu lung ga la sogs pa gzhan las 'tshag cing 'khru na yang thabs gong ma ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las gzhan pa se'u dang ma tu lung 'bru la sogs pa'i rdzas kyang ngo zhes pa ni se'u dang ma tu lung ga la sogs pa gzhan las 'tshag cing 'khru na yang thabs gong ma ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This means that if other substances such as cherry and madhuka seeds, etc. are to be squeezed and washed, then do it in the above manner.

original: dus kyi ni thun gyi mtha'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dus kyi ni thun gyi mtha'i bar du'o //
translated: The time is until the end of the period.

original: zhes pa ni dgun chu lta bu la sogs pa dus kyi rdzas las thun gyi sman du byas pa ni thun gyi dus ma zad kyi bar du byin gyis rlobs shig ba'o //

original: 'dir dus ni bzhi ste zhes pa dang / dang po rmang 'dre ba bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin pa gzhan gyi tshe yang dge slong bzhi la 'khod bzhin pa de dag 'thon nas dge slong gnas pa lhags pa rnams so zhes pa yin te rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlab pa'i dus rnam
analyzed: 'dir dus ni bzhi ste zhes pa dang / dang po rmang 'dre ba bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin pa gzhan gyi tshe yang dge slong bzhi la 'khod bzhin pa de dag 'thon nas dge slong gnas pa lhags pa rnams so zhes pa yin te rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlab pa'i dus rnam
translated: Here, time is fourfold.🔽The first is when the foundation is laid, and also when the work is still ongoing, and also when the resident monks have left, and also when other monks have arrived.

original: pa bzhi yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: pa bzhi yin par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that there are four times for consecrating a suitable house.

original: de la dang po rmang 'dre zhes pa ni dang po nyid du pha gu la sogs pa 'god pa de dang po'o //
analyzed: de la dang po rmang 'dre zhes pa ni dang po nyid du pha gu la sogs pa 'god pa de dang po'o //
translated: The first is when the foundation is laid, that is, when the door frame and so on are first set.

original: bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin zhes pa ni dang po rmang bres nas gtsug lag khang brtsigs ma zin pa'i bar du ste gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin zhes pa ni dang po rmang bres nas gtsug lag khang brtsigs ma zin pa'i bar du ste gnyis pa'o //
translated: Also when the work is still ongoing is the second, from when the foundation is laid until the monastery is completed.

original: gzhan gyi tshe na yang dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin pa na yang dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin pa ste gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi tshe na yang dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang brtsigs zin pa na yang dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin pa ste gsum pa'o //
translated: And also when the resident monks have left is the third, even when the monastery is completed, if the resident monks have left.

original: de dag 'thon nas dge slong gnas par lhags zhes pa ni gzhi la 'khod pa rnams gud du dong nas /
analyzed: de dag 'thon nas dge slong gnas par lhags zhes pa ni gzhi la 'khod pa rnams gud du dong nas /
translated: This means that those who are already there go elsewhere,

original: gud nas kha cig gsar du lhags te bzhi'o //
analyzed: gud nas kha cig gsar du lhags te bzhi'o //
translated: and some who are not there come.

original: gud nas lhags pa'i drod cis gzung zhe na /
analyzed: gud nas lhags pa'i drod cis gzung zhe na /
translated: How is it known that those who come are warm?🔽They are warm if they have begun other activities or are resting,

original: bya pa gzhan brtsams pa dang / ngal bso ba tshun na de'o zhes pa ni chu btsags pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan dang / chos gos dang lhung bzed gzhag pa'i ngal bso ba yang byas na lhags pa'o //
analyzed: bya pa gzhan brtsams pa dang / ngal bso ba tshun na de'o zhes pa ni chu btsags pa la sogs pa'i bya ba gzhan dang / chos gos dang lhung bzed gzhag pa'i ngal bso ba yang byas na lhags pa'o //
translated: but not if they are doing other activities such as straining water, or if they are resting by putting down their robes and begging bowls.🔽In all cases, the rite of the Saṅgha is required.

original: thams cad du dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes pa ni rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlab pa'i dus rnam pa bzhi po de dag kun kyang dge 'dun gyi las kyis brlab dgos par ston pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad du dge 'dun gyi las kyis so zhes pa ni rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlab pa'i dus rnam pa bzhi po de dag kun kyang dge 'dun gyi las kyis brlab dgos par ston pa ste /
translated: This shows that all four types of times for consecrating a suitable house must be consecrated by the rite of the Saṅgha.

original: btsun pa'i dge 'dun gson cig / gnas 'di ni phyi rol lam 'dom gang gi nye spyod dang bcas shing rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: btsun pa'i dge 'dun gson cig / gnas 'di ni phyi rol lam 'dom gang gi nye spyod dang bcas shing rnam pa thams cad dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The rite is as follows: “Venerable Saṅgha, please listen! This place, together with its surrounding area of one fathom, is in all aspects

original: dge 'dun thams cad mthun pa'i rung ba'i khang pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i snyad kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad mthun pa'i rung ba'i khang pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i snyad kyis byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: The consecration is by the expression a suitable house in which all the Sangha are in agreement, and so on.

original: dge 'dun ma yin pa gzhan gyis byar ye mi rung ngam zhe na //
analyzed: dge 'dun ma yin pa gzhan gyis byar ye mi rung ngam zhe na //
translated: Is it not completely unsuitable for anyone other than the Sangha to do it?

original: dang po gnyis ni gang zag gis kyang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: dang po gnyis ni gang zag gis kyang zhes pa yin te /
translated: The first two are even by an individual,

original: rmang 'dre ba dang bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin pa gnyis ni gang zag gis kyang byar rung ba'o //
analyzed: rmang 'dre ba dang bres nas kyang las sar pa byed bzhin pa gnyis ni gang zag gis kyang byar rung ba'o //
translated: and the two, even while the work is being done, are suitable even for an individual to do.

original: gang zag gang gis she na /
analyzed: gang zag gang gis she na /
translated: By which individual?

original: las sar pa pas so zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: las sar pa pas so zhes pa yin no //
translated: By one who is a novice worker, it says.

original: las sar pa 'ba' zhig gis sam @217a * //
analyzed: las sar pa 'ba' zhig gis sam @217a * //
translated: Is it only by a novice worker?

original: zhe na / thog ma ni gcig gis kyang zhes pa yin te thog ma ni gcig pos kyang rung /
analyzed: zhe na / thog ma ni gcig gis kyang zhes pa yin te thog ma ni gcig pos kyang rung /
translated: It says, Even by one alone, and Even by one alone means that it is suitable even by one alone,

original: zla ba 'ga' dang stong kyang rung ba'o //
analyzed: zla ba 'ga' dang stong kyang rung ba'o //
translated: for a few months or a few years.

original: ji ltar byin gyis brlab ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar byin gyis brlab ce na /
translated: How is it consecrated?

original: smras te 'o zhes pa yin te sems kyis bsam pa nyi tshe'am kha rog pas ma yin gyi dngos po 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa'o zhes tshig tu brjod na gdod byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: smras te 'o zhes pa yin te sems kyis bsam pa nyi tshe'am kha rog pas ma yin gyi dngos po 'di ni dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang pa'o zhes tshig tu brjod na gdod byin gyis brlab par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The word say means that it is not just a limited thought in the mind or whispered, but when it is said aloud, This is the Sangha's suitable house, then it becomes consecrated.

original: gnyis pa ni dge slong phal po che soms shig pas na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin pas byin gyis brlab pa ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dngos po 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlabs kyis dgongs shig ces snyad 'di
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge slong phal po che soms shig pas na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gzhi la 'khod bzhin pas byin gyis brlab pa ni tshe dang ldan pa dag dngos po 'di dge 'dun gyi rung ba'i khang par byin gyis brlabs kyis dgongs shig ces snyad 'di
translated: The second is when a large number of monks think, It is said that when a monk who is present consecrates it, he should announce, Venerable ones, please consider that this thing is consecrated as a suitable house for the Sangha.

original: skad du byas la byin gyis brlab pa'o //
analyzed: skad du byas la byin gyis brlab pa'o //
translated: This is how it is said.🔽The fourth is when as many as are present gather and say all at once, It is said that the resident monks should consecrate it by saying, This is a suitable place, and speak with restraint.

original: bzhi pa ni ji snyed pa de snyed 'dus nas rung ba'i gnas so zhes cig car du brjod pa bsnyad na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gnas pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i snyad 'di skad du gyis la kha bsdams te brjod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni ji snyed pa de snyed 'dus nas rung ba'i gnas so zhes cig car du brjod pa bsnyad na'o zhes pa ni dge slong gnas pa rnams kyis byin gyis brlab pa'i snyad 'di skad du gyis la kha bsdams te brjod par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that it is taught to be said like this.

original: 'di gcig pas gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa ni mi mdzes pa ma yin zhes pa ni rung ba'i khang pa gcig la gtsug lag khang kha du ma'i rung ba ltos na yang mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gcig pas gtsug lag khang du ma'i bya ba byed pa ni mi mdzes pa ma yin zhes pa ni rung ba'i khang pa gcig la gtsug lag khang kha du ma'i rung ba ltos na yang mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: It is not improper for one to perform the duties of many temples. This means that there is no impropriety in one suitable dwelling being the suitable dwelling of many temples.

original: de ni tha dad du rung bar smras pa ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar rung ba yang gtsug lag khang kha so sor rung ba re re thob pa ni ma yin gyi de 'ba' zhig la ltos na rung ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de ni tha dad du rung bar smras pa ma yin zhes pa ni gong ma ltar rung ba yang gtsug lag khang kha so sor rung ba re re thob pa ni ma yin gyi de 'ba' zhig la ltos na rung ba'i gnas su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is not said that they are suitable separately. As above, the suitable is not obtained as a separate suitable for each temple, but in dependence on just that, it becomes a suitable dwelling.

original: dge slong gis btsos pa dang dge slong thug thub du blangs nas byin len byas pa bza' zhes pa ni lo nyes kyi tshe ming gis smos pa 'di ltar byas kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis btsos pa dang dge slong thug thub du blangs nas byin len byas pa bza' zhes pa ni lo nyes kyi tshe ming gis smos pa 'di ltar byas kyang bla ba'o //
translated: A monk should eat the cooked food of a monk who has been able to eat, having received it. This means that in times of famine, even if one does this as specified by name, it is permissible.

original: g-yar sus kyang zhes pa ni lo nyes kyi tshe g-yar sus kyang zar dbang ba ste btang nas bza' ba dang / yang yang gi zas kyang zar dbang bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: g-yar sus kyang zhes pa ni lo nyes kyi tshe g-yar sus kyang zar dbang ba ste btang nas bza' ba dang / yang yang gi zas kyang zar dbang bar ston pa'o //
translated: Anyone means that in times of famine, anyone is able to eat it, showing that it is permissible to eat after giving it away, and also to eat food again and again.

original: thug pa ni nam yang zhes pa ni lo legs nyes gang gi tshe na yang 'thung du dbang ba ste /
analyzed: thug pa ni nam yang zhes pa ni lo legs nyes gang gi tshe na yang 'thung du dbang ba ste /
translated: The word “ever” means that one is allowed to drink at any time, whether the harvest is good or bad.

original: gong ma'i nyes pa gnyis med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: gong ma'i nyes pa gnyis med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that the two faults mentioned above do not apply.

original: sngar blangs pa btang ste langs pa yang zhes pa ni sngar byin len byas te blangs pa las mi 'dod par byas te btang nas langs pa las kyang slar za ba yang btang ba zos pa'i yang bar mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o //🔽de len par ldang zhes pa ni za bar 'dug pa las mi ldang zhes pa 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: sngar blangs pa btang ste langs pa yang zhes pa ni sngar byin len byas te blangs pa las mi 'dod par byas te btang nas langs pa las kyang slar za ba yang btang ba zos pa'i yang bar mi 'gyur bar ston pa'o // de len par ldang zhes pa ni za bar 'dug pa las mi ldang zhes pa 'brel pa'o //
translated: “Having given up what was previously accepted” means that even if one gives up and discards what was previously accepted after having taken it, one is not at fault if one eats it again.

original: lhag ma @217b zhes pa ni zos pa'i lhag ma yang zar dbang ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma @217b zhes pa ni zos pa'i lhag ma yang zar dbang ba'o //
translated: “One is allowed to eat what was left” means that one is allowed to eat what was left by someone else.

original: mnos pa zhes pa ni mi 'dod par btang ba las gzhan gyis mnos te sbyin pa yang nyes pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mnos pa zhes pa ni mi 'dod par btang ba las gzhan gyis mnos te sbyin pa yang nyes pa med pa'o //
translated: “What was accepted” means that there is no fault if one accepts food from someone else other than the one from whom one gave up accepting.

original: nyid kyis skyos ma bskur ba'i mi rigs par dogs pa sel ba ni /
analyzed: nyid kyis skyos ma bskur ba'i mi rigs par dogs pa sel ba ni /
translated: The following verse is stated to dispel the doubt that it would be improper for one to eat what was left by one’s parents.

original: de'i skyos ma zhes pa yin te bdag gi skyos ma dang lhag ma khyer yang ba'o //
analyzed: de'i skyos ma zhes pa yin te bdag gi skyos ma dang lhag ma khyer yang ba'o //
translated: The word “and” means “my mother’s and the rest.”🔽“The bones of the forest” and so on.

original: nags kyi rus pa rnams kyang zhes pa dang / der smra ba ni 'di lta ste rgun se'u /
analyzed: nags kyi rus pa rnams kyang zhes pa dang / der smra ba ni 'di lta ste rgun se'u /
translated: The words “and so on” refer to grapes,

original: khardzu ra starga tha ma /🔽be 'bru thang shing ga 'bru ni kho tsha /
analyzed: khardzu ra starga tha ma / be 'bru thang shing ga 'bru ni kho tsha /
translated: kharjūra, dates,🔽and jujube, which are like the bones of the forest.🔽“The fruits of the bhava tree” and so on.

original: bha phru sin tshi ka rnams so zhes pa ni nags kyi rus pa dang 'dra ba'i rnams mi 'dod par btang ba las slar zas dbang ba'o //
analyzed: bha phru sin tshi ka rnams so zhes pa ni nags kyi rus pa dang 'dra ba'i rnams mi 'dod par btang ba las slar zas dbang ba'o //
translated: The words “and so on” refer to the fruits of the bhavya tree, the fruits of the sinduka tree, and so on.

original: rdzing gi yang ngo zhes pa dang / der sma ba ni 'di lta ste /🔽pang mo'i rtsa ba mdzer bu /
analyzed: rdzing gi yang ngo zhes pa dang / der sma ba ni 'di lta ste / pang mo'i rtsa ba mdzer bu /
translated: “The water of the pond” and so on.🔽The words “and so on” refer to the roots of the lotus, the roots of the utpala, and the heart of the lotus.

original: autpa la'i rtsa ba pad mo'i snying po rnams so zhes pa ni rdzing las 'byung ba 'di rnams btang ba las slar zos kyang nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: autpa la'i rtsa ba pad mo'i snying po rnams so zhes pa ni rdzing las 'byung ba 'di rnams btang ba las slar zos kyang nyes med pa'o //
translated: These things that come from the pond are to be given up, but if one eats them again, there is no fault.

original: sman gyi dngos po'o /
analyzed: sman gyi dngos po'o /
translated: The things that are medicine.

original: // / sman gyi dngos po phran tshegs la sogs pa las byung ba bsdus te de dang 'brel pa je ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / sman gyi dngos po phran tshegs la sogs pa las byung ba bsdus te de dang 'brel pa je ston pa ni /
translated: The things that are medicine are summarized in the Kṣudraka Collection and so on.

original: rgyal po'am / rgyal po'i phyed mi blang zhes pa yin te bkres pa dang skom pa nad du che ba'i sman zas dang skom yin te /
analyzed: rgyal po'am / rgyal po'i phyed mi blang zhes pa yin te bkres pa dang skom pa nad du che ba'i sman zas dang skom yin te /
translated: Since hunger and thirst are great illnesses, food and drink are medicine.

original: des mi brel cing de dag ske ba'i gzhi rgyal po las 'byung ba'i phyir rgyal po'am rgyal po'i phyed mi blang zhes smos pa yin no //🔽dge 'dun gyi phyir na grong blang zhes pa dang / zhing yang ngo zhes pa yin la de yal bar mi bya zhes pa dang / 'di sham su btang zhes pa dang / shas blang zhes pa dang / 'di rmed pas gtsug lag khang du bskyal zhes pa dang /
analyzed: des mi brel cing de dag ske ba'i gzhi rgyal po las 'byung ba'i phyir rgyal po'am rgyal po'i phyed mi blang zhes smos pa yin no // dge 'dun gyi phyir na grong blang zhes pa dang / zhing yang ngo zhes pa yin la de yal bar mi bya zhes pa dang / 'di sham su btang zhes pa dang / shas blang zhes pa dang / 'di rmed pas gtsug lag khang du bskyal zhes pa dang /
translated: Since one is not busy with those and the basis for their arising is from the king, it is said, “One should not accept a village or half a village for the Saṅgha.”

original: bdag gi bas thog mar ro zhes pa dang bsrung ba'i dge slong bsko zhes pa rnams ni dge 'dun gyi phyir grong dang zhing blang zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi bas thog mar ro zhes pa dang bsrung ba'i dge slong bsko zhes pa rnams ni dge 'dun gyi phyir grong dang zhing blang zhing /
translated: “For the Saṅgha, one should accept a village and a field,” “One should not neglect it,” “To whom should this be given?” “One should accept a share,” “This should be brought to the monastery by a messenger,” and “First, from my own,” and “One should appoint a monk to guard it” are the ways of accepting a village and a field for the Saṅgha.

original: zhing yal bar mi 'dor ba'i tshul 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zhing yal bar mi 'dor ba'i tshul 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not neglect the field.”

original: de la bdag gi bas thog mar ro zhes pa ni thos shas len pa'i tshe bdag gi sgo bas dge 'dun gyi thog mar long shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la bdag gi bas thog mar ro zhes pa ni thos shas len pa'i tshe bdag gi sgo bas dge 'dun gyi thog mar long shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase first of all, my own means that when one is taking what has been heard, one should think, First of all, I will take care of the community's.

original: mdung 'god dam gnyi ga'am gang yang rung mi mngon na rtsis la mi dgug ces pa ni mdung 'god gnyi ga'am 'ga' las ji ltar 'byung ba la sogs pa mi mngon na rtsis la ma dgug shig pa ste klu gzhon nu dge slong du sprul nas dge 'dun🔽gyi 'tsho ba yo byad sbyar ba drug sde po rnams kyis rtsis la dgug cing gtses pa lta bu'o //🔽gzhan du na dran pa dang shes @218a * //
analyzed: mdung 'god dam gnyi ga'am gang yang rung mi mngon na rtsis la mi dgug ces pa ni mdung 'god gnyi ga'am 'ga' las ji ltar 'byung ba la sogs pa mi mngon na rtsis la ma dgug shig pa ste klu gzhon nu dge slong du sprul nas dge 'dun gyi 'tsho ba yo byad sbyar ba drug sde po rnams kyis rtsis la dgug cing gtses pa lta bu'o // gzhan du na dran pa dang shes @218a * //
translated: The phrase if the stake is not visible, do not summon him to the reckoning means that if the stake, the two, or any one of them is not visible, do not summon him to the reckoning.

original: bzhin pa mdun du byas te 'jug ces pa ni mdung 'god pa la sogs pa brtsir mngon pa zhig na ji nas dran pa dang / shes bzhin du tshas la rtsis byed pa'i sar song shig pa'o //
analyzed: bzhin pa mdun du byas te 'jug ces pa ni mdung 'god pa la sogs pa brtsir mngon pa zhig na ji nas dran pa dang / shes bzhin du tshas la rtsis byed pa'i sar song shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase otherwise, with mindfulness and vigilance in the forefront means that if the stake, etc., are visible, then with mindfulness and vigilance in the forefront, go to the place of the reckoning.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir g-yog blang zhes ba dang / gtsug lag khang du sgra mi grag pa gang na ba der rung bar byed pa'i khyim brtsigs zhes pa dang / gal te las byed na zas sbyin zhes pa ni gang zag sgo gcig gi phyir ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir g-yog blang zhes ba dang / gtsug lag khang du sgra mi grag pa gang na ba der rung bar byed pa'i khyim brtsigs zhes pa dang / gal te las byed na zas sbyin zhes pa ni gang zag sgo gcig gi phyir ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The line one may accept servants for the sake of the community means that one may build a house for them in a place where the sound of the monastery is not heard. The line if they work, give them food means that it is not for the sake of an individual, but

original: dge 'dun spyi'i phyir bran g-yog blang zhing de dag gi khyim gtsug lag khang du sgra mi grag par brtsigs pa dang / de dag las la g-yor na 'dod zas byin cig ba rnams su ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun spyi'i phyir bran g-yog blang zhing de dag gi khyim gtsug lag khang du sgra mi grag par brtsigs pa dang / de dag las la g-yor na 'dod zas byin cig ba rnams su ston pa'o //
translated: for the sake of the community as a whole that one accepts servants and builds a house for them in a place where the sound of the monastery is not heard, and that if they work, one should give them food.

original: ba glang chu glang ra lug glang po rta dang rnga mo bong bu 'bru rjen snod rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag kyang dge 'dun gyi phyir ni long shig pa'o //
analyzed: ba glang chu glang ra lug glang po rta dang rnga mo bong bu 'bru rjen snod rnams kyang ngo zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag kyang dge 'dun gyi phyir ni long shig pa'o //
translated: The line cows, oxen, goats, sheep, elephants, horses, camels, donkeys, grain, and vessels refers to the fact that one may accept these things by name for the sake of the community.

original: 'di dag mchod rten gyir yang mi ba med ces pa ni bran g-yog la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams mchod rten gyi phyir blangs kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag mchod rten gyir yang mi ba med ces pa ni bran g-yog la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams mchod rten gyi phyir blangs kyang bla ba'o //
translated: It is not improper to use these for the stupa means that it is not improper to use the servants and so forth mentioned above for the stupa.

original: kha gzar bcang zhes ba dang / tsha stegs kyang ngo zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag kyang chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: kha gzar bcang zhes ba dang / tsha stegs kyang ngo zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag kyang chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The words and the water-strainer and and the foot-wiping mat mean that you should also use these mentioned by name.

original: 'di gnyis dang brnang ba 'phul ba las gzhan pa'i khar snod gang zag gis ma bcad zhes pa ni gong du smos pa gnyis dang / brnang ba 'phul ba'i snod ma gtogs par khar snod kyi bag gang zag gir ma 'chang shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis dang brnang ba 'phul ba las gzhan pa'i khar snod gang zag gis ma bcad zhes pa ni gong du smos pa gnyis dang / brnang ba 'phul ba'i snod ma gtogs par khar snod kyi bag gang zag gir ma 'chang shig pa'o //
translated: The words except for the two and the bowl for leftovers mean that you should not use as your own any other vessel for eating or drinking except for the two mentioned above and the bowl for leftovers.

original: kun dga' ba bzhag ces pa ni gang zag gis kyang g-yog ni chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: kun dga' ba bzhag ces pa ni gang zag gis kyang g-yog ni chongs shig pa'o //
translated: The words except for the attendant mean that you should use the attendant.

original: byis pa bsrung du bcug na mtshan mthun pa blang zhes pa dang / mgul du chos gos kyi tshal bu gdags pa ni 'di dag gi tshul lo zhes pa dang / rked par yang ngo zhes pa dang / rjes su brtse ba'i sems kyis btsal zhes pa ni byis pa mi bzhin pa srung du bcol na /
analyzed: byis pa bsrung du bcug na mtshan mthun pa blang zhes pa dang / mgul du chos gos kyi tshal bu gdags pa ni 'di dag gi tshul lo zhes pa dang / rked par yang ngo zhes pa dang / rjes su brtse ba'i sems kyis btsal zhes pa ni byis pa mi bzhin pa srung du bcol na /
translated: And around the waist and search with a mind of loving kindness means if you entrust the protection of a child who is not a boy or girl,

original: khye'u bu mo gang yin pa las mtshan mthun mthun du blang ba dang mgul lam rked par chos gos kyi tshal bu gdags pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis btsal rdzi gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: khye'u bu mo gang yin pa las mtshan mthun mthun du blang ba dang mgul lam rked par chos gos kyi tshal bu gdags pa dang / snying brtse ba'i sems kyis btsal rdzi gyis shig pa'o //
translated: you should take on the same sex as the boy or girl, tie a piece of Dharma robe around the neck or waist, and search with a mind of loving kindness.

original: 'di'i gnyen gyis byin pa blang zhes pa dang / mjug tu rngan pa yang ngo zhes pa dang / de dag gi byas par shes na yang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di gla rngan mi dgug ces ba ni byis pa bsrung ba'i dor de'i gnyen @218b gyis byin pa dang /
analyzed: 'di'i gnyen gyis byin pa blang zhes pa dang / mjug tu rngan pa yang ngo zhes pa dang / de dag gi byas par shes na yang ngo zhes pa dang / 'di gla rngan mi dgug ces ba ni byis pa bsrung ba'i dor de'i gnyen @218b gyis byin pa dang /
translated: Here, accept what is given by the child's relatives and at the end, a reward as well and if you know what they have done, also that and do not summon wages for this means if you entrust the protection of a child, accept what is given by the child's relatives,

original: mjug tu rngan dags lta bu byin pa dang / de dag nyid drin gso bas byin pa ni blang gi / byis pa gso gso ba'i dngan dags ched du ni ma nged cig pa'o //
analyzed: mjug tu rngan dags lta bu byin pa dang / de dag nyid drin gso bas byin pa ni blang gi / byis pa gso gso ba'i dngan dags ched du ni ma nged cig pa'o //
translated: The third is a gift given in return for a favor.🔽The fourth is a gift given for the sake of heaven.🔽The fifth is a gift given for the sake of fame.🔽The sixth is a gift given for the sake of overcoming others.🔽The seventh is a gift given for the sake of overcoming pride.🔽The eighth is a gift given for the sake of obtaining the result of giving.

original: 'bras bu'i rnyed pa bdag gir bya zhes pa dang / mar til mar sbrang rtsi bu ram gyi bum pa'o zhes pa dang / de'i snod kyang ngo zhes pa dang / der gzhug ces pa dang / gzhi la'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag gzhan gyis byin na ni gang zag nyid kyir yang long shig pa ste /
analyzed: 'bras bu'i rnyed pa bdag gir bya zhes pa dang / mar til mar sbrang rtsi bu ram gyi bum pa'o zhes pa dang / de'i snod kyang ngo zhes pa dang / der gzhug ces pa dang / gzhi la'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di dag gzhan gyis byin na ni gang zag nyid kyir yang long shig pa ste /
translated: The ninth is a gift given for the sake of protecting oneself.🔽The tenth is a gift given for the sake of protecting others.🔽The eleventh is a gift given for the sake of protecting both.🔽The twelfth is a gift given for the sake of the Dharma.

original: de la der gzhug ces pa ni mar dang til mar la sogs pa de dag gi snod du chug shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la der gzhug ces pa ni mar dang til mar la sogs pa de dag gi snod du chug shig pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth is a gift given for the sake of the ultimate.🔽The fourteenth is a gift given for the sake of the ultimate.🔽The fifteenth is a gift given for the sake of the ultimate.

original: gzhi la'o zhes pa ni snod de dag kyang lcug gor ram shing leb la sogs pa gzhi'i steng du long shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhi la'o zhes pa ni snod de dag kyang lcug gor ram shing leb la sogs pa gzhi'i steng du long shig pa'o //
