original: bshang gci dang chang gi snod rnams mi spya ces pa ni bshang gci'i snod spyad du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar chang gi snod kyang ma spyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: bshang gci dang chang gi snod rnams mi spya ces pa ni bshang gci'i snod spyad du mi rung ba dang 'dra bar chang gi snod kyang ma spyod cig pa'o //
translated: The line Do not use vessels for excrement and urine for beer means that just as vessels for excrement and urine are not suitable for use, so also vessels for beer should not be used.

original: dge 'dun gyi phyir g-yos kyi zhal ta bya zhes pa ni dge 'dun spyi'i gtsang sbyor gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi phyir g-yos kyi zhal ta bya zhes pa ni dge 'dun spyi'i gtsang sbyor gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The line Do the cooking for the Saṅgha means Be the general cleaner for the Saṅgha.

original: bsod snyoms la zhugs pas ma 'ongs pa'i snga rol du thel gyis mi gzhag par mi bya zhes pa ni bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i tshe zas ma 'ongs kyi bar du lhung bzed ma dag na par thel tam zur gyis khyer cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsod snyoms la zhugs pas ma 'ongs pa'i snga rol du thel gyis mi gzhag par mi bya zhes pa ni bsod snyoms la 'gro ba'i tshe zas ma 'ongs kyi bar du lhung bzed ma dag na par thel tam zur gyis khyer cig pa'o //
translated: The line Do not put away the begging bowl before the meal is finished means that when you go for alms, if the begging bowl is not clean until the meal is finished, you should carry it with the lid closed or with the edge covered.

original: zas g-yogs pa bcang zhes pa ni kha zas de rdul la sogs pa mi phog par bya ba'i phyir kha dag g-yogs pa'am kha gab gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zas g-yogs pa bcang zhes pa ni kha zas de rdul la sogs pa mi phog par bya ba'i phyir kha dag g-yogs pa'am kha gab gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The line Carry a covering for the food means that you should cover the food with a cloth or a lid in order to prevent dust and so forth from falling into it.

original: 'di dang khar ba'i snod mi bcang ba mi 'drar ma re shig ces pa ni zas g-yogs ba 'di bcang ba dang khar ba'i snod gzhan mi bcang ba dge slong la bzhin du dge slong mas kyang bslab dgos par ston pa'o //🔽nad pas zha bcang ba yang mi rung bar zhes pa ni dge slong ma nad pas kyang zha bcang mi rung bar ma gtogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dang khar ba'i snod mi bcang ba mi 'drar ma re shig ces pa ni zas g-yogs ba 'di bcang ba dang khar ba'i snod gzhan mi bcang ba dge slong la bzhin du dge slong mas kyang bslab dgos par ston pa'o // nad pas zha bcang ba yang mi rung bar zhes pa ni dge slong ma nad pas kyang zha bcang mi rung bar ma gtogs shig pa'o //
translated: Do not hope that this is different from not keeping a spittoon. This means that just as the monk must keep a spittoon and not keep another vessel for spitting, so the nun must also train.🔽Do not allow that it is not proper for the sick to keep one. This means that even a sick nun must not keep a spittoon, except if she is exempt.

original: 'khar gsil ma gsil bar khyim du bsod snyoms la mi 'jug ces pa dang / 'di bcang zhes pa ni bsod snyoms pas 'khar gsil ma bsil bar khyim du 'jug tu mi rung bas na 'khar gsil chongs shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'khar gsil ma gsil bar khyim du bsod snyoms la mi 'jug ces pa dang / 'di bcang zhes pa ni bsod snyoms pas 'khar gsil ma bsil bar khyim du 'jug tu mi rung bas na 'khar gsil chongs shig pa'o //
translated: Do not enter a house for alms without shaking the begging bowl. This means that because it is not proper for the alms-goer to enter a house without shaking the begging bowl, he should keep a begging bowl.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la mkhas par bya zhes pa dang / mngon mtshan bya ba'i phyir zas brul dor ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni bsod snyoms la grong du 'gro ba dang / slar 'byung ba ci nas kyang ma nor cing mkhas par bya ba dang /
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jug pa la mkhas par bya zhes pa dang / mngon mtshan bya ba'i phyir zas brul dor ba la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni bsod snyoms la grong du 'gro ba dang / slar 'byung ba ci nas kyang ma nor cing mkhas par bya ba dang /
translated: The line one should be skilled in coming and going and one should leave food scraps, etc. at the door for the sake of making a sign refer to going to town for alms and returning.🔽 One should not err in any way, but be skilled in coming and going.

original: @219a * // blangs pa dang ma blangs pa'i khyim mi nor bar bya ba'i phyir sgor zas brul la sogs pa mtshan ma 'or cig pa'o //
analyzed: @219a * // blangs pa dang ma blangs pa'i khyim mi nor bar bya ba'i phyir sgor zas brul la sogs pa mtshan ma 'or cig pa'o //
translated: In order to not err in the homes where one has received alms and those where one has not, one should leave a sign, such as food scraps, at the door.

original: chos 'tshong bas 'tsho bar mi bya zhes pa chos bshad cing bstan pa'i gla rngan gyis 'tsho ba lta bu chos 'tshong bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: chos 'tshong bas 'tsho bar mi bya zhes pa chos bshad cing bstan pa'i gla rngan gyis 'tsho ba lta bu chos 'tshong bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The line one should not make a living by selling the Dharma means one should not make a living by selling the Dharma, as if one were to explain the Dharma and then receive a fee for the teaching.

original: chu med na zho khu la sogs pas rkang pa bkru zhes pa ni chu med na zho khu la sogs pas rkang lag bkrus kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: chu med na zho khu la sogs pas rkang pa bkru zhes pa ni chu med na zho khu la sogs pas rkang lag bkrus kyang bla ba'o //
translated: The line if there is no water, one should wash one's feet with whey, etc. means that if there is no water, it is acceptable to wash one's feet and hands with whey, etc.

original: rtsva bam la 'dug par bya zhes pa dang / 'di bla gab med par logs shig tu bzhag ces pa dang / spungs te yang zhes pa dang / mjug tu dor zhes pa ni mchod rten nam yo lang chen po zhig g-yos te stan gyis mi khyed na rtsva stan la 'khod kyang bla ba'o //🔽de'i sta gon du rtsva phal cher spungs pa dang mchod ston zin pa'i rjes la dor ba rnams su ston pa'o //🔽phal chen gral du mar bya zhes pa dang / lda brgya tshar du'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun phal che na lnga brgya tshar la sogs pa tshar du mar yang chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva bam la 'dug par bya zhes pa dang / 'di bla gab med par logs shig tu bzhag ces pa dang / spungs te yang zhes pa dang / mjug tu dor zhes pa ni mchod rten nam yo lang chen po zhig g-yos te stan gyis mi khyed na rtsva stan la 'khod kyang bla ba'o // de'i sta gon du rtsva phal cher spungs pa dang mchod ston zin pa'i rjes la dor ba rnams su ston pa'o // phal chen gral du mar bya zhes pa dang / lda brgya tshar du'o zhes pa ni dge 'dun phal che na lnga brgya tshar la sogs pa tshar du mar yang chod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should place it separately in the open means that one should place the bundle of straw in a separate place in the open. The phrase one should pile it up means that one should pile up the straw. The phrase one should discard it in the end means that one should discard it after the festival or after the great festival.🔽The phrase one should make it in the order of the assembly means that if the assembly is large, one should make it in many rows of five hundred, and so on.

original: rgan rabs so sor bsham zhes pa ni gral tshar re zhing 'grim pa la sogs pa'i spen skal so sor chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: rgan rabs so sor bsham zhes pa ni gral tshar re zhing 'grim pa la sogs pa'i spen skal so sor chod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should set it up separately for each elder means that one should set it up separately for each person who goes for alms, and so on, in each row.

original: 'brim pa rnams mi bzhod par spyan bsko zhes pa dang / zas kyi zhal ta thog mar zos te'o zhes pa dang / phal cher 'dus pa'i tshe rgan rabs su bkod cing sbyin pa'i dge slong bsko zhes pa ni zas 'brim pa rnams mi bzhod par spyan bsko ba dang /
analyzed: 'brim pa rnams mi bzhod par spyan bsko zhes pa dang / zas kyi zhal ta thog mar zos te'o zhes pa dang / phal cher 'dus pa'i tshe rgan rabs su bkod cing sbyin pa'i dge slong bsko zhes pa ni zas 'brim pa rnams mi bzhod par spyan bsko ba dang /
translated: The phrase without appointing servers means that the servers are not appointed. The phrase the first to eat is the food supervisor means that the supervisor eats first. The phrase when most of the saṅgha has gathered, appoint the elder and the monk who distributes the food means that the servers are not appointed.

original: zhal ta byed pas zan thog mar je zos la bya ba dang / dge 'dun phal po che rgan rabs su bkod cing zas rim bzhin du 'brim pa'i zhal ta pa skos shig pa'o //
analyzed: zhal ta byed pas zan thog mar je zos la bya ba dang / dge 'dun phal po che rgan rabs su bkod cing zas rim bzhin du 'brim pa'i zhal ta pa skos shig pa'o //
translated: The supervisor eats first and the saṅgha is arranged in order of seniority and the monk who distributes the food is appointed.

original: 'dir dge slong ma dag gis gnyis gsum gyi go bzhag nas gar dga' bar 'god ces pa ni de lta bu'i tshe de dge slong mas dge slong gnyis gsum gyi gral bzhag nas gar dga' mgur 'khod kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: 'dir dge slong ma dag gis gnyis gsum gyi go bzhag nas gar dga' bar 'god ces pa ni de lta bu'i tshe de dge slong mas dge slong gnyis gsum gyi gral bzhag nas gar dga' mgur 'khod kyang bla ba'o //
translated: The phrase the nuns should be placed in groups of two or three and then placed wherever there is room means that at that time the nuns should be placed in groups of two or three and then placed wherever there is room.

original: zas kyi khyim du sgra bskyungs te 'dong zhes pa dang / spyod lam shin tu bsdams nas zhes pa dang / mdzes par ro zhes pa dang / 'dug pa yang de bzhin zhes pa ni sgra bskyungs shing spyod lam bsdams pa legs par bya ba dang /
analyzed: zas kyi khyim du sgra bskyungs te 'dong zhes pa dang / spyod lam shin tu bsdams nas zhes pa dang / mdzes par ro zhes pa dang / 'dug pa yang de bzhin zhes pa ni sgra bskyungs shing spyod lam bsdams pa legs par bya ba dang /
translated: Go to the house of food silently and with very restrained behavior and beautifully and sitting down in the same way means to go to the house of food silently and with restrained behavior, and to do it well.

original: gom zul mkhas par byas la zas kyi khyim du 'dong ba dang / bkad cing 'khod pa na yang @219b de bzhin gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gom zul mkhas par byas la zas kyi khyim du 'dong ba dang / bkad cing 'khod pa na yang @219b de bzhin gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Having done that, go to the house of food with skillful gait, and when seated in the assembly hall, do the same.

original: zas la rkang pas mi brdzi zhes pa dang / 'og re la rkang pas reg par mi bya zhes pa ni gral du bkad pa'i tshe 'di dag ltar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: zas la rkang pas mi brdzi zhes pa dang / 'og re la rkang pas reg par mi bya zhes pa ni gral du bkad pa'i tshe 'di dag ltar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not step over food and do not touch it with your feet means that when seated in the assembly hall, do not do these things.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing ma g-yengs pa'i sems kyis bsod snyoms blang zhes pa dang / ma gtor cing ran pa dang zhes pa dang / 'di dag ma 'dres pa dang / ma dkrugs pa dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / dus las mi 'da' bar bza' zhes pa ni zas za ba'i thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing ma g-yengs pa'i sems kyis bsod snyoms blang zhes pa dang / ma gtor cing ran pa dang zhes pa dang / 'di dag ma 'dres pa dang / ma dkrugs pa dang / shin tu sbas pa dang / dus las mi 'da' bar bza' zhes pa ni zas za ba'i thabs 'di ltar gyis shig pa ste /
translated: The line one should take alms with a mind that is not distracted and is mindful and the line one should eat without scattering, in moderation, and the line without mixing these, without stirring, well-concealed, and without exceeding the proper time, are the method for eating food.

original: de la ma gtor zhes pa ni zas so sor ma gtor ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma gtor zhes pa ni zas so sor ma gtor ba'o //
translated: The line without scattering means not scattering the food into individual portions.

original: ran ces pa ni 'grangs pa tsam du bza' ba'o //
analyzed: ran ces pa ni 'grangs pa tsam du bza' ba'o //
translated: The line in moderation means eating just the amount that fills one up.

original: ma 'dres zhes pa ni thug pa dang zan du 'dres pa lta bu ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres zhes pa ni thug pa dang zan du 'dres pa lta bu ma yin pa'o //
translated: The line without mixing means not mixing soup and rice, for example.

original: ma dkrugs zhes pa ni sna tshogs pa lhung bzed gcig tu blugs pa las dkrugs te za bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: ma dkrugs zhes pa ni sna tshogs pa lhung bzed gcig tu blugs pa las dkrugs te za bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The line without stirring means not stirring various foods together in a single begging bowl and then eating them.

original: shin tu sbas zhes pa ni lam ka 'am rgyun sar ma za shig pa'o //
analyzed: shin tu sbas zhes pa ni lam ka 'am rgyun sar ma za shig pa'o //
translated: The line well-concealed means not eating in a place that is visible from the road or from the village.

original: dus las mi 'da' zhes pa ni nyi ma'i gung las ma yol bar bza' ba'o //
analyzed: dus las mi 'da' zhes pa ni nyi ma'i gung las ma yol bar bza' ba'o //
translated: The line without exceeding the proper time means eating before noon.

original: ji la gnyer pa de las gzhan rnyed pa bdag gir byed pa mi rigs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
analyzed: ji la gnyer pa de las gzhan rnyed pa bdag gir byed pa mi rigs pa ma yin zhes pa ni /
translated: It is not wrong to accept what is offered by someone other than the one for whom the food was originally intended.

original: dang po thug pa la bos pa las phyis zas bzang po gzhan yang sbyar te /🔽byin na blangs pa ni mi rung ba med pa'o //🔽bdag zas bzhin du gzhan blangs ba ni nyes med ces pa ni /🔽bdag zas za ba'i 'phro la yang gzhan gyis byin pa blangs te /
analyzed: dang po thug pa la bos pa las phyis zas bzang po gzhan yang sbyar te / byin na blangs pa ni mi rung ba med pa'o // bdag zas bzhin du gzhan blangs ba ni nyes med ces pa ni / bdag zas za ba'i 'phro la yang gzhan gyis byin pa blangs te /
translated: At first, one is invited to a meal and later, other good food is also offered.

original: zos pa ni nyes pa med pa'o /
analyzed: zos pa ni nyes pa med pa'o /
translated: It is not wrong to accept it.🔽It is not wrong to accept food for oneself, just as one would accept it for another.🔽While one is in the process of eating one's own food, it is not wrong to accept food offered by another.

original: gzhan gyis gnyer te 'dug pa la gzhan gyis byin pa des bstan na der gtogs su zad ces pa ni yon bdag gcig gi khyim du gnyer te za zhing 'dug pa las spang yon bdag gcig gis zas bshams te phul ba mi 'dod par byas pa las /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gnyer te 'dug pa la gzhan gyis byin pa des bstan na der gtogs su zad ces pa ni yon bdag gcig gi khyim du gnyer te za zhing 'dug pa las spang yon bdag gcig gis zas bshams te phul ba mi 'dod par byas pa las /
translated: If one is invited to eat in the house of a patron and another patron offers food, it is permissible to accept it.

original: yon bdag snga ma des phe'u thams su bstabs na yang yang la sogs pa bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi snga ma des byin pa'i khongs su gtogs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: yon bdag snga ma des phe'u thams su bstabs na yang yang la sogs pa bzhin du mi 'gyur gyi snga ma des byin pa'i khongs su gtogs par ston pa'o //
translated: The master of the house is not the same as the one who gave the food, but he is included in the category of the one who gave it.🔽The words are applied to the meaning of the thought, not to the prestige. The prestige is not important means that if someone gives me food, thinking that I am an arhat or a Buddha, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a beggar, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a dog, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.

original: tshig ni bsam pa'i don dang sbyar gyi grags pa mi btsan zhes pa ni bdag la dgra bcom pa 'am sangs rgyas su btags te zas la sogs pa byin na des ji ltar bsams te byin pa rmas la bdag la gyi na'i snyad de skad du btags te
analyzed: tshig ni bsam pa'i don dang sbyar gyi grags pa mi btsan zhes pa ni bdag la dgra bcom pa 'am sangs rgyas su btags te zas la sogs pa byin na des ji ltar bsams te byin pa rmas la bdag la gyi na'i snyad de skad du btags te
translated: If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a human, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.

original: byin na ni @220a * //🔽des bsam pa'i don dang sbyar du zad kyi grags pa'i ming mi brtsan pa'o //
analyzed: byin na ni @220a * // des bsam pa'i don dang sbyar du zad kyi grags pa'i ming mi brtsan pa'o //
translated: If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a god, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a naga, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.

original: blangs nas mi spang zhes pa ni sngar blangs nas khros sam zos te slar gtong zhing dor ba lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: blangs nas mi spang zhes pa ni sngar blangs nas khros sam zos te slar gtong zhing dor ba lta bu ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a yaksha, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a gandharva, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a kinnara, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a mahoraga, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a human, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a non-human, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.🔽If someone gives me food, thinking that I am a hungry ghost, I will accept it, but I will not think that I am that.

original: lta ba dang tshul khrims rdzogs pa gnyis las blangs te de las gzhan pa'i rim pa la byin pa dang / 'grangs nas kyang kham 'ga' yan chad lhag par blangs shing zos na dad pas byin pa chud gsan pa'o zhes pa ni lta ba rdzogs pa las blangs la lta ba ma rdzogs pa la byin pa dang /
analyzed: lta ba dang tshul khrims rdzogs pa gnyis las blangs te de las gzhan pa'i rim pa la byin pa dang / 'grangs nas kyang kham 'ga' yan chad lhag par blangs shing zos na dad pas byin pa chud gsan pa'o zhes pa ni lta ba rdzogs pa las blangs la lta ba ma rdzogs pa la byin pa dang /
translated: The first two are from the perspective of the view and ethics.

original: tshul khrims rdzogs pa las blangs la ma rdzogs pa la byin pa dang / 'grangs zin nas lhag par zan kham 'ga' yan chad zos kyang rung ste dad pas byin pa chud gzan par 'gyur ba'o //🔽de lta bas na su la yang sbyin du mi rung ngam zhe na /
analyzed: tshul khrims rdzogs pa las blangs la ma rdzogs pa la byin pa dang / 'grangs zin nas lhag par zan kham 'ga' yan chad zos kyang rung ste dad pas byin pa chud gzan par 'gyur ba'o // de lta bas na su la yang sbyin du mi rung ngam zhe na /
translated: The last two are from the perspective of the view and ethics.

original: pha ma nad pa rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa /
analyzed: pha ma nad pa rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa /
translated: If one asks, “Is it not suitable to give to anyone?”🔽It is not suitable to give to those who are not complete in view and ethics.

original: sbrum pa / gdul bar bsam pa /🔽bsod snyoms skugs pa /
analyzed: sbrum pa / gdul bar bsam pa /🔽bsod snyoms skugs pa /
translated: Those who are complete in view and ethics are the opposite of those.

original: khyim pa de'i khar 'ongs pa rnams la bgo bar bya zhes pa yin te 'di dag lta bu la byin pa ni nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa de'i khar 'ongs pa rnams la bgo bar bya zhes pa yin te 'di dag lta bu la byin pa ni nyes med pa'o //
translated: The phrase to those who come to the house of the householder means that one should give to those who come to the house of the householder. Giving to those like this is not a transgression.

original: de la pha ma ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing yin pa dang / nad pa dang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa ni bsod snyoms kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la pha ma ni phan 'dogs pa'i zhing yin pa dang / nad pa dang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa ni bsod snyoms kyi zhing yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In this regard, parents are a field of benefit, and the sick and those who wish to go forth are a field of alms.

original: sbrum pa ni snying rje ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbrum pa ni snying rje ba'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The pregnant are a field of compassion.

original: gdul bar bsam pa ni bsdu ba'i thabs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //🔽bsod snyoms skugs zhes pa ni khyim pa ched du slong zhing skugs pa'o //
analyzed: gdul bar bsam pa ni bsdu ba'i thabs su bsgrub pa'i phyir ro // bsod snyoms skugs zhes pa ni khyim pa ched du slong zhing skugs pa'o //
translated: Those who are disciplined are a field of practice, because they are established as a means of gathering.🔽The phrase alms in the form of a wager means that a householder makes a wager and then begs.

original: khyim pa de'i khar 'ongs zhes pa ni zan za'i khar 'ongs na gdong sol bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyim pa de'i khar 'ongs zhes pa ni zan za'i khar 'ongs na gdong sol bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase to those who come to the house of the householder means that if they come to the house of the householder while one is eating, one should turn one's face away.

original: bsdogs pa'i chang bu bzhag ces pa dang / sbyin pa chad bar mi bya zhes pa dang / byol song la yang sbyin zhes pa ni zan za ba'i tshe su la sbyin pa chad par mi bya bar chad bu gzhag pa dang bya rog la sogs pa byol song la yang byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsdogs pa'i chang bu bzhag ces pa dang / sbyin pa chad bar mi bya zhes pa dang / byol song la yang sbyin zhes pa ni zan za ba'i tshe su la sbyin pa chad par mi bya bar chad bu gzhag pa dang bya rog la sogs pa byol song la yang byin cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase set aside a portion means that you should not interrupt the practice of giving to others. The phrase do not interrupt giving means that you should not interrupt giving to those who are begging. The phrase give to the animals means that you should give to the birds and so on.

original: bza' ba'i phyir bstabs pa ma zin pa mi sbyin zhes pa ni bdag zas zos ma zin gyi bar du gzhan la sbyin pa ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bza' ba'i phyir bstabs pa ma zin pa mi sbyin zhes pa ni bdag zas zos ma zin gyi bar du gzhan la sbyin pa ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase do not give what has not been offered means that you should not give to others what has been offered to you until you have finished eating.

original: dad pas bstabs te sbyin pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni bdag la dad pas bdag gi khar ji son du bstabs te byin na de'i yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir gzhan la sbyin cig pa'o //
analyzed: dad pas bstabs te sbyin pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni bdag la dad pas bdag gi khar ji son du bstabs te byin na de'i yid dang sbyar ba'i phyir gzhan la sbyin cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase do not give what has been given out of faith means that you should give to others what has been given to you by someone who has faith in you, in accordance with that person's wishes.

original: lhag ma za ba la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma ji bde bya zhes pa ni lhag @220b rol lhag ma'am /
analyzed: lhag ma za ba la lhung bzed kyi lhag ma ji bde bya zhes pa ni lhag @220b rol lhag ma'am /
translated: The phrase with regard to eating leftovers, act as you like with regard to the leftovers in your bowl means that you should give to someone who is eating leftovers.

original: skyos pa'am / skyos ma za ba'i mi la byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: skyos pa'am / skyos ma za ba'i mi la byin cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase to someone who is eating what has been thrown away means that you should give to someone who is eating what has been discarded.

original: gnas pa rnams la gtor ma byin cig pa'o zhes pa dang / snga drol sogs pa de dag gi cho ga bzhin bya zhes pa ni /
analyzed: gnas pa rnams la gtor ma byin cig pa'o zhes pa dang / snga drol sogs pa de dag gi cho ga bzhin bya zhes pa ni /
translated: Give sacrificial cakes to those who dwell there.🔽In the morning and so forth, do those according to the ritual.

original: gtsug lag khang gi srung ma snga dro dang phyi dro la sogs pa de dag gi cho ga bzhin du so sor phyi la gtor ma byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: gtsug lag khang gi srung ma snga dro dang phyi dro la sogs pa de dag gi cho ga bzhin du so sor phyi la gtor ma byin cig pa'o //
translated: This means that the guardians of the monastery should be given sacrificial cakes in the morning and evening, and so forth, according to the ritual.🔽Do not eat unripe mango fruit.

original: aa mra rtsi gu ma chags pa'i rtsi mi bza' zhes pa ni shing tog aa mra ma smin par ma za shig pa'o //
analyzed: aa mra rtsi gu ma chags pa'i rtsi mi bza' zhes pa ni shing tog aa mra ma smin par ma za shig pa'o //
translated: This means do not eat unripe mango fruit.

original: rtsa ba / sdong bu /
analyzed: rtsa ba / sdong bu /
translated: The root, the stem,

original: me tog / lo ma /🔽'bras bu / bca' ba /
analyzed: me tog / lo ma / 'bras bu / bca' ba /
translated: the flower, the leaf,🔽the fruit, the vegetable,

original: 'bras chan / go 'dun /🔽phye sha / khur ba /
analyzed: 'bras chan / go 'dun / phye sha / khur ba /
translated: the rice, the barley,🔽the flour, the cake,

original: 'o ma / zho mar sar /
analyzed: 'o ma / zho mar sar /
translated: the milk, the curd, the butter,🔽the fish, and the dried meat are not prohibited.

original: nya sha / sha skam rnams mi rung ba ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bzar mi rung ba med par ston pa'o //
analyzed: nya sha / sha skam rnams mi rung ba ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams bzar mi rung ba med par ston pa'o //
translated: This shows that there is nothing wrong with eating these things mentioned by name.

original: gso ma yungs kar rtsa ba sdong bu lo ma me tog 'bras bu la sogs pa'i thug pa btung du mi rung bar ma dogs shig ces pa ni 'di dag gi thug pa'ang mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gso ma yungs kar rtsa ba sdong bu lo ma me tog 'bras bu la sogs pa'i thug pa btung du mi rung bar ma dogs shig ces pa ni 'di dag gi thug pa'ang mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: Do not fear that it is improper to drink a gruel of barley, mustard, roots, stems, leaves, flowers, fruits, and so on.

original: bcud ni khu bas so zhes ba ni skam po pas khu bar byas pa bcud du che ba'o //
analyzed: bcud ni khu bas so zhes ba ni skam po pas khu bar byas pa bcud du che ba'o //
translated: The essence is the juice, meaning that it is a great essence when made into a juice from the dry.

original: chus kyang ngo zhes pa chu yang btung du rung ba'o //🔽rkyal par gzhug pa mi rung ba ma yin zhes pa dang / snod du kha zas bzar rung zhes pa dang / shing gi yang ngo zhes pa dang / de'i yang ngo zhes pa dang / zos pa'i snod kyang ngo zhes pa ni zho la sogs pa rkyal par blugs pa la yang bzar mi rung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: chus kyang ngo zhes pa chu yang btung du rung ba'o // rkyal par gzhug pa mi rung ba ma yin zhes pa dang / snod du kha zas bzar rung zhes pa dang / shing gi yang ngo zhes pa dang / de'i yang ngo zhes pa dang / zos pa'i snod kyang ngo zhes pa ni zho la sogs pa rkyal par blugs pa la yang bzar mi rung ba med pa dang /
translated: Water is also proper to drink.🔽It is not improper to put it in a bag, meaning that it is proper to eat food in a vessel, in a wooden vessel, in that, and in a vessel that has been eaten from.

original: shing dang rdol sogs pa'i snod spyad du bzar rung ba dang / sngon kha zas blugs pa'i snod spyad kyang bla ba rnams su ston pa'o //
analyzed: shing dang rdol sogs pa'i snod spyad du bzar rung ba dang / sngon kha zas blugs pa'i snod spyad kyang bla ba rnams su ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that it is not improper to eat yogurt and so on that is put in a bag, that it is proper to eat from vessels made of wood, stone, and so on, and that it is proper to eat from vessels that have previously held food.

original: bkru ba ni gnas pa'i las so zhes pa dang / zos nas kyang zhes pa ni lhung bzed bsod snyoms la gar bkru ba dang / zan zos pa'i 'og tu bkru ba ni slob ma'am nye gnas kyi las yin par ston pa'o //🔽snod gcig tu cig car mi bza' zhes pa dang / byes su ni snod med na bza' zhes pa dang / dge slong dang ngo zhes pa dang / gcig gis lag pa bteg nas bdag gi gzhug ces pa ni byes su ni snod med na dge slong dang lhan cig tu bza' zhing snod du lag pa'ang cig car ma yin par spel gyi de ma yin pa'i skabs gzhan du lhan cig ma za shig pa'o //
analyzed: bkru ba ni gnas pa'i las so zhes pa dang / zos nas kyang zhes pa ni lhung bzed bsod snyoms la gar bkru ba dang / zan zos pa'i 'og tu bkru ba ni slob ma'am nye gnas kyi las yin par ston pa'o // snod gcig tu cig car mi bza' zhes pa dang / byes su ni snod med na bza' zhes pa dang / dge slong dang ngo zhes pa dang / gcig gis lag pa bteg nas bdag gi gzhug ces pa ni byes su ni snod med na dge slong dang lhan cig tu bza' zhing snod du lag pa'ang cig car ma yin par spel gyi de ma yin pa'i skabs gzhan du lhan cig ma za shig pa'o //
translated: Washing after eating is the work of the disciple or attendant.🔽One should not eat at once in a single vessel.🔽If there is no vessel in a foreign land, one may eat.🔽With a monk, means that if there is no vessel in a foreign land, one may eat with a monk, but not both hands in the same vessel.

original: dge tshul dang lhan cig pa ni ma ldan pa ma yin na 'og ma bzhin zhes @221a * //
analyzed: dge tshul dang lhan cig pa ni ma ldan pa ma yin na 'og ma bzhin zhes @221a * //
translated: With a novice monk, means that if one does not have a vessel, one may eat with a novice monk, but not together, as in the case of the lower.

original: pa ni dge tshul dang lhan cig tu bza' ba ni brtad pa'i rkyen ma yin na 'og ma dang 'dra bar spar zan du sbyin pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni dge tshul dang lhan cig tu bza' ba ni brtad pa'i rkyen ma yin na 'og ma dang 'dra bar spar zan du sbyin pa'o //
translated: The first is that if a novice monk is not a condition of haste, he should be given food in the manner of a handful.

original: rung bar byed pa ni spar zan du sbyin zhes pa ni g-yog sder la ma 'dogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: rung bar byed pa ni spar zan du sbyin zhes pa ni g-yog sder la ma 'dogs shig pa'o //
translated: The second is that if he is a condition of haste, he should be given food in the manner of a handful.🔽The third is that if a friend invites one to eat together, one should do so in a secluded place, and if the friend has not finished his meal, one should protect the other’s food.

original: gnyen mdza' bas bskul na thams cad du phyogs dben par ro zhes pa dang / byin len ma zhig pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang 'dres su 'ong na bsrung zhes pa ni gnyen mdza' bas sder gcig tu za bar bskul na dben par bza' zhing byin len ma zhig pa la sogs pa la ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ltar rim gro gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen mdza' bas bskul na thams cad du phyogs dben par ro zhes pa dang / byin len ma zhig pa dang / byin len ma byas pa dang 'dres su 'ong na bsrung zhes pa ni gnyen mdza' bas sder gcig tu za bar bskul na dben par bza' zhing byin len ma zhig pa la sogs pa la ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ltar rim gro gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The fourth is that if one’s friend invites one to eat together on a single plate, one should eat in a secluded place, and one should respect the other’s food by not finishing it and so on.

original: lham dang bcas te mi bza' zhes pa dang / nad pas ni mnan te'o zhes pa ni lham bgos te zan mi za ba dang nad bu can gyis ni lham gyi steng du rkang pas mnan la zo shig pa'o //
analyzed: lham dang bcas te mi bza' zhes pa dang / nad pas ni mnan te'o zhes pa ni lham bgos te zan mi za ba dang nad bu can gyis ni lham gyi steng du rkang pas mnan la zo shig pa'o //
translated: The fifth is that one should not eat with one’s shoes on, and the sixth is that if one is sick, one should do so by pressing down on the shoes with one’s feet.

original: gcer bur ma yin zhes pa dang gos gcig par ni ma yin zhes pa dang / nad pa ni nyes med ces pa dang / nad g-yog gis sum par bya zhes pa dang / nus na rdul gzan bgo zhes pa dang / dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes pa ni nad pa ma yin na sgren mo la sogs pa 'di rnams ltar ma za shig pa dang /🔽nad pa yin na'ang nad g-yog gis sum pa dang / rdul gzan tsam gyon nus na bgo ba dang / mi nus na phyogs dben par zar gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gcer bur ma yin zhes pa dang gos gcig par ni ma yin zhes pa dang / nad pa ni nyes med ces pa dang / nad g-yog gis sum par bya zhes pa dang / nus na rdul gzan bgo zhes pa dang / dben pa'i phyogs su'o zhes pa ni nad pa ma yin na sgren mo la sogs pa 'di rnams ltar ma za shig pa dang / nad pa yin na'ang nad g-yog gis sum pa dang / rdul gzan tsam gyon nus na bgo ba dang / mi nus na phyogs dben par zar gzhug pa'o //
translated: The line not naked means not in the buff, not wearing a single garment, not without a lower garment, and not without an upper garment. The line the sick are not at fault means that if one is sick, one may eat naked and so forth. The line the attendant should cover him means that if one is sick but can put on a lower garment and a dust cloth, one should do so. The line in a secluded place means that if one is sick but cannot put on a lower garment and a dust cloth, one should eat in a secluded place.

original: zas la bkad nas 'brim pa la 'di dang 'o ni las tshur zhes mi bya zhes pa ni 'brim pa la zas 'di dang 'o ni 'o na cig ces lto 'dun dang kham mchu'i bag ma zer cig pa'o /
analyzed: zas la bkad nas 'brim pa la 'di dang 'o ni las tshur zhes mi bya zhes pa ni 'brim pa la zas 'di dang 'o ni 'o na cig ces lto 'dun dang kham mchu'i bag ma zer cig pa'o /
translated: The line Do not say to the distributor 'Give me this and that' means that one should not say to the distributor, Give me this food and that food, and thus make one's desires known or make a face.

original: nad pa'i nyams dang 'phrod pa ni nyes med ces pa dang / de ni 'di lta ste drod chung bas bcos pa dang / drod che bas rje'o zhes pa ni nad pas 'di lta bu'i tshul nyams dang sbyar te tshur 'di 'o na cig ces zer ba ni nyes med pa'o //
analyzed: nad pa'i nyams dang 'phrod pa ni nyes med ces pa dang / de ni 'di lta ste drod chung bas bcos pa dang / drod che bas rje'o zhes pa ni nad pas 'di lta bu'i tshul nyams dang sbyar te tshur 'di 'o na cig ces zer ba ni nyes med pa'o //
translated: This is like the patient's experience. When he says, 'This is it,' it is without fault.🔽Place the perception of a patient on yourself, and eat food with the perception of it as medicine.🔽And also with mindfulness.

original: bdag la nad pa'i 'du shes bzhag pa dang / zas la sman du 'du shes par bza' zhes pa dang / dran pa yang ngo zhes pa ni zas bza' ba'i zas ni bkres pa'i sman yin bdag ni bkres ba'i nad yin par bsams pa dang /
analyzed: bdag la nad pa'i 'du shes bzhag pa dang / zas la sman du 'du shes par bza' zhes pa dang / dran pa yang ngo zhes pa ni zas bza' ba'i zas ni bkres pa'i sman yin bdag ni bkres ba'i nad yin par bsams pa dang /
translated: The food that is eaten is the medicine for hunger. I am the disease of hunger.

original: 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu'i dran pa dang yang nyes par zhog la zo shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'og nas 'byung ba lta bu'i dran pa dang yang nyes par zhog la zo shig pa'o //
translated: And as it will be said below, be mindful of the faults and eat.

original: kun 'byung ba 'dra bar 'gyur ba slar yogs pa rgyu mthun pa rkyen gyi rnam pa btsal ba /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba 'dra bar 'gyur ba slar yogs pa rgyu mthun pa rkyen gyi rnam pa btsal ba /
translated: The search for the conditions that are similar to the origin, the repetition, the natural outflow, and the result.

original: rag gzhan la lus pa nyen dang @221b bcas so sor 'gro ba rnams ched du mi mthun par bya zhes pa ste zas ming gis smos pa 'di lta bur soms la zo shig pa ste /🔽de la kun 'byung pa zhes pa ni lgong lud lta bu mi gtsang ba las 'byung bar bsam pa'o //🔽'dra ba zhes pa ni sha la srin bu phye la rus phye mar la rnag lta bu la sogs par bsam pa'o //
analyzed: rag gzhan la lus pa nyen dang @221b bcas so sor 'gro ba rnams ched du mi mthun par bya zhes pa ste zas ming gis smos pa 'di lta bur soms la zo shig pa ste / de la kun 'byung pa zhes pa ni lgong lud lta bu mi gtsang ba las 'byung bar bsam pa'o // 'dra ba zhes pa ni sha la srin bu phye la rus phye mar la rnag lta bu la sogs par bsam pa'o //
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.🔽 The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.🔽 The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.🔽 The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.

original: 'gyur zhes pa ni bad kan dang tshil snabs dang / nag khra la sogs par 'gyur ro bsam pa'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes pa ni bad kan dang tshil snabs dang / nag khra la sogs par 'gyur ro bsam pa'o //
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.

original: slar spogs zhes pa ni zas kyi phyir rtsod pa la sogs pa 'khon gyi gcugs su 'gyur ba'o //🔽rgyu mthun zhes pa ni zas la bshang gci lta bu sme bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: slar spogs zhes pa ni zas kyi phyir rtsod pa la sogs pa 'khon gyi gcugs su 'gyur ba'o //🔽rgyu mthun zhes pa ni zas la bshang gci lta bu sme bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase and so on refers to the fact that the body is a collection of various things that are not under one's control.

original: rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes pa ni rmo brko la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba dang zas la sred pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: rkyen gyi rnam pa zhes pa ni rmo brko la sogs pa'i rgyu rkyen las 'byung ba dang zas la sred pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba lta bu'o //
translated: The phrase “in the form of conditions” refers to the fact that food arises from the conditions of plowing, planting, and so on, and becomes the cause of craving for food.

original: btsal zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gron tshegs phal po ches btsal dgos pa'o //
analyzed: btsal zhes pa ni nyon mongs pa'i gron tshegs phal po ches btsal dgos pa'o //
translated: The phrase “sought with great effort” means that food must be sought with great effort and expense.

original: rag gzhan la lus zhes pa ni rnyed zin nas btso ba la sogs kyi rag gzhan la lus pa'o //
analyzed: rag gzhan la lus zhes pa ni rnyed zin nas btso ba la sogs kyi rag gzhan la lus pa'o //
translated: The phrase “dependent on others” means that after food is obtained, it must be cooked and so on, and is thus dependent on others.

original: nyen dang bcas pa zhes pa ni legs par ma zhun nad kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyen dang bcas pa zhes pa ni legs par ma zhun nad kyi rnam pa sna tshogs su 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The phrase “dangerous” means that if food is not properly digested, it can lead to various illnesses.

original: so sor 'gro zhes pa ni cha gcig lus kyi drod du 'gro ba dang cha gcig srin bu'i zas su 'gro ba dang cha gcig lus brta bar 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: so sor 'gro zhes pa ni cha gcig lus kyi drod du 'gro ba dang cha gcig srin bu'i zas su 'gro ba dang cha gcig lus brta bar 'gro ba ste /
translated: The phrase “dissipates” means that food is used up in four ways: one part of the food provides warmth to the body, one part becomes waste, one part becomes the food of microorganisms in the body, and one part becomes the body’s nourishment.

original: de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa bzhir 'gro ba'o //
translated: Thus, food is used up in these four ways.

original: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing mi g-yeng ba'i sems kyis so zhes pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan par sgra bskyungs zhes pa ni zan za kar ming gis smos pa 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar gzhag cing mi g-yeng ba'i sems kyis so zhes pa dang / shes bzhin dang ldan par sgra bskyungs zhes pa ni zan za kar ming gis smos pa 'di dag ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: With alertness means with a voice that is not loud. These are the things that should be done when eating.

original: 'di dag mi bya zhes pa ni rkang lag gi sgra ma 'byin cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag mi bya zhes pa ni rkang lag gi sgra ma 'byin cig pa'o //
translated: Do not do these things means do not make sounds with your hands and feet.

original: hub sgra mi bskyed ces pa dang / khrum khrum ma yin zhes pa dang / sgra 'byung na chu la sogs pa spar zhing brlan zhes pa ni sgra'am khrum sgra ma 'byin cig pa ste //
analyzed: hub sgra mi bskyed ces pa dang / khrum khrum ma yin zhes pa dang / sgra 'byung na chu la sogs pa spar zhing brlan zhes pa ni sgra'am khrum sgra ma 'byin cig pa ste //
translated: Do not make slurping sounds, do not make smacking sounds, and if a sound occurs, moisten the mouth with water, etc. means do not make sounds or smacking sounds.

original: khur skam lta bu la sogs te sgra 'byung ba zhig na spong shig pa'o //
analyzed: khur skam lta bu la sogs te sgra 'byung ba zhig na spong shig pa'o //
translated: If a sound occurs, such as when eating dry food, stop.

original: za ba'i khar rol mo mi bya zhes pa ni zan za ba'i khar rol mo byed du bcug cing za ba lta bu la sogs pa ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: za ba'i khar rol mo mi bya zhes pa ni zan za ba'i khar rol mo byed du bcug cing za ba lta bu la sogs pa ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not make music while eating means do not do things like making music while eating.

original: 'chad par byed pa'i tshe ma yin zhes pa dang / de thos pas so zhes pa ni sbyin pa 'chad pa'i thos pa nyen kor na 'dug pas de'i tshe zan ma za shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa'i tshe ma yin zhes pa dang / de thos pas so zhes pa ni sbyin pa 'chad pa'i thos pa nyen kor na 'dug pas de'i tshe zan ma za shig pa'o //
translated: When you are expounding, do not eat, and By listening to it, means: When you are sitting near to hear the exposition of generosity, do not eat at that time.

original: dus yol du cha na tshigs bcad gnyis sam gsum nas so zhes pa ni nyi tshod yol du cha na sbyin pa bshad pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis sam gsum @222a * //
analyzed: dus yol du cha na tshigs bcad gnyis sam gsum nas so zhes pa ni nyi tshod yol du cha na sbyin pa bshad pa'i tshigs bcad gnyis sam gsum @222a * //
translated: When the time is passing, listen to two or three verses, means: When the time of the day is passing, listen to two or three verses of the exposition of generosity.

original: tsam mnyan la de'i 'og tu zo shig pa'o //
analyzed: tsam mnyan la de'i 'og tu zo shig pa'o //
translated: Then eat.

original: zos zin nas zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad brjod ces pa ni zas zos zin pa'i 'og tu zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad lhogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: zos zin nas zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad brjod ces pa ni zas zos zin pa'i 'og tu zhal nas gsungs pa'i tshigs bcad lhogs shig pa'o //
translated: After eating, recite the verses spoken by the Buddha, means: After you have eaten, recite the verses spoken by the Buddha.

original: spyan drangs par zos zin nas sbyin pa bshad par bya zhes pa dang / kun gyis zos zin par shes nas so zhes pa dang / blta ste zhes pa dang / du ma na dang pos so zhes pa dang / mi nus na nus pa la bcol zhes pa ni zan zos zin tam ma zin bltas shing brtags la /
analyzed: spyan drangs par zos zin nas sbyin pa bshad par bya zhes pa dang / kun gyis zos zin par shes nas so zhes pa dang / blta ste zhes pa dang / du ma na dang pos so zhes pa dang / mi nus na nus pa la bcol zhes pa ni zan zos zin tam ma zin bltas shing brtags la /
translated: After the invitation, the explanation of the giving should be done, and After all have eaten, it should be known, and Look! and If many, the first should do it, and If unable, it should be entrusted to one who is able. This means that after the food has been eaten, it should be examined and investigated.

original: gnas brtan gyis sbyin pa bshad pa dang / chos bshad gyis shig pa dang / mi nus na gzhan nus pa la chol cig pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brtan gyis sbyin pa bshad pa dang / chos bshad gyis shig pa dang / mi nus na gzhan nus pa la chol cig pa'o //
translated: The elder should explain the giving, and Explain the Dharma! and If unable, entrust it to another who is able.

original: gal te ma byas pa 'dod pa'i rkyen cig na dge slong las 'khor bskos te'o zhes pa dang / bzhi yan chad zhes pa ni sbyin pa bshad par ma byas par myur du 'dong dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na /
analyzed: gal te ma byas pa 'dod pa'i rkyen cig na dge slong las 'khor bskos te'o zhes pa dang / bzhi yan chad zhes pa ni sbyin pa bshad par ma byas par myur du 'dong dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na /
translated: If there is a condition of desire not to do it, then the monk should be appointed, and Four or more means that if a condition arises where it is necessary to go quickly without explaining the giving,

original: sbyin pa bshad pa gcig gis bzhi 'khor bzhi yan chad skos la gzhan deng shig pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa bshad pa gcig gis bzhi 'khor bzhi yan chad skos la gzhan deng shig pa'o //
translated: if one who explains the giving appoints four or more, the others should go.

original: bskos pa'ang 'gro ba'i rkyen cig gis na zhus nas so zhes pa ni de'i 'khor bzhi tsam ma bskos pa'i nang nas kyang 'ga' zhig gud du 'gro dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na sbyin pa 'chad pa de la zhus la song shig pa'o //
analyzed: bskos pa'ang 'gro ba'i rkyen cig gis na zhus nas so zhes pa ni de'i 'khor bzhi tsam ma bskos pa'i nang nas kyang 'ga' zhig gud du 'gro dgos pa'i rkyen cig byung na sbyin pa 'chad pa de la zhus la song shig pa'o //
translated: If the appointed one is sick, he should ask permission to go.  This means that if one of the four retinues who are not appointed goes out, he should ask permission to go if there is a reason.

original: sbyin pa 'chad pa na dga' bo dang / nyer dga'i ming brjod pa zhes pa ni byin pa 'chad pa na klu 'di gnyis kyi ming nas kyang smos shig pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'chad pa na dga' bo dang / nyer dga'i ming brjod pa zhes pa ni byin pa 'chad pa na klu 'di gnyis kyi ming nas kyang smos shig pa'o //
translated: When the alms are finished, he should mention the names of Nanda and Upananda.  This means that when the alms are finished, he should also mention the names of these two nagas.

original: ming pa gnyis pa zhig ste /
analyzed: ming pa gnyis pa zhig ste /
translated: There is a second name.

original: dus ma yin par sgregs na thog ma'i kham gnyis sam gsum por la kha bkrus te mid ces pa ni phyogs dang 'dra bar mid pa gnyis pa zhig la zas slar yang sgregs shing 'ong na kham gnyis gsum 'or la slar mid cig pa'o /
analyzed: dus ma yin par sgregs na thog ma'i kham gnyis sam gsum por la kha bkrus te mid ces pa ni phyogs dang 'dra bar mid pa gnyis pa zhig la zas slar yang sgregs shing 'ong na kham gnyis gsum 'or la slar mid cig pa'o /
translated: If one belches at the wrong time, he should spit out the first two or three mouthfuls and swallow again.  This means that if one belches again after swallowing the second mouthful, he should spit out two or three mouthfuls and swallow again.

original: de zas ma yin pa ma yin zhes pa dang / de lta bas na gzhan gyis kyang dus ma yin pa dang btang ba las sgregs pa byung na bkru zhes pa ni de yang zas yin pas na mid pa gnyis pa la ma gtogs pa'i dge slong gzhan la yang sgregs na dus ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: de zas ma yin pa ma yin zhes pa dang / de lta bas na gzhan gyis kyang dus ma yin pa dang btang ba las sgregs pa byung na bkru zhes pa ni de yang zas yin pas na mid pa gnyis pa la ma gtogs pa'i dge slong gzhan la yang sgregs na dus ma yin pa dang /
translated: Since that is so, if one is sick and belches at an inappropriate time or after giving up food, one should rinse one’s mouth.

original: dus yin du zin kyang mi bza' bar btang ba'i 'og tu sgregs na de'i 'or la kha khrus gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dus yin du zin kyang mi bza' bar btang ba'i 'og tu sgregs na de'i 'or la kha khrus gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Since that is food, if one belches at an inappropriate time or after giving up food, one should rinse one’s mouth.

original: ma bshams pa'i phyogs su mchil ma mi 'dor zhes pa dang / byi bdar byas par ma yin zhes pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mdun du @222b de'i sgra mi bya zhes pa dang / za na 'ang ma yin /
analyzed: ma bshams pa'i phyogs su mchil ma mi 'dor zhes pa dang / byi bdar byas par ma yin zhes pa dang / gnas brtan gyi mdun du @222b de'i sgra mi bya zhes pa dang / za na 'ang ma yin /
translated: Do not spit in an unswept place, do not spit in a place that has been swept, do not make that sound in front of a sthavira, do not make that sound while eating, do not make that sound while drinking.

original: lhag ma'i thad du yang dang yang ma yin zhes pa dang / mi nus na gud du 'gro zhes pa ni mchil ma dor ba'i sa bshams pa dang / byi bad ra byas pa'i steng du mchil snabs mi dor ba dang / gnas brtan gyi mdun dang zas za ba'i tshe mchil snabs kyi sgra mi bya ba dang /
analyzed: lhag ma'i thad du yang dang yang ma yin zhes pa dang / mi nus na gud du 'gro zhes pa ni mchil ma dor ba'i sa bshams pa dang / byi bad ra byas pa'i steng du mchil snabs mi dor ba dang / gnas brtan gyi mdun dang zas za ba'i tshe mchil snabs kyi sgra mi bya ba dang /
translated: The phrase “not repeatedly” in the context of the remaining downfalls means that one should not spit on the ground where one has prepared to spit or urinate, or make a sound by spitting or blowing the nose in the presence of elders or while eating.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma gzhan gyi thad du'ang de dag gi sgra yang dang yang du slos shing ma zer cig pa dang / de dag gi sgra 'gegs par mi nus na gud du byol shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma gzhan gyi thad du'ang de dag gi sgra yang dang yang du slos shing ma zer cig pa dang / de dag gi sgra 'gegs par mi nus na gud du byol shig pa'o //

original: gzhan la gnod par mi bya zhes pa ni mchil snabs kyi sgra 'byung ba la sogs pa dge slong gzhan la gnod cing mi bde ba'i bag ma byed cig pa'o //

original: sdur cing mi nyal zhes pa dang bcag pa'am gud du 'gro bar ro /
analyzed: sdur cing mi nyal zhes pa dang bcag pa'am gud du 'gro bar ro /
