original: ma grub pa ni leb ma'i 'og re bya zhes pa ni tshad @223b pas btab na khri'u btags pa ni bshugs te khol dbyung btags pa ma yin pa ni dras te khol dbyung ba dang / de'i than kor rkub na lo ma'i lbong gzhag pa dang /
analyzed: ma grub pa ni leb ma'i 'og re bya zhes pa ni tshad @223b pas btab na khri'u btags pa ni bshugs te khol dbyung btags pa ma yin pa ni dras te khol dbyung ba dang / de'i than kor rkub na lo ma'i lbong gzhag pa dang /
translated: If it is not yet dry, to do it under a flat stone means that if it is measured with a scale, the mat should be cut and the edge sewn. If it is not sewn, it should be cut and the edge sewn.

original: sa mi sme bar gyo mo 'thol rab ma yin pa gzhag pa dang / de'i bkru bshal 'di ltar bya zhing 'theb bcang gyo mo med na de blangs te dor du rung ba'i gzhi gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sa mi sme bar gyo mo 'thol rab ma yin pa gzhag pa dang / de'i bkru bshal 'di ltar bya zhing 'theb bcang gyo mo med na de blangs te dor du rung ba'i gzhi gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The edge should be sewn with a piece of cloth. To place a cushion means to place a cushion on the seat. 🔽To wash it means to wash it with the two kinds of earth. To dry it means to dry it in the sun. 🔽To fold it means to fold it with the mouth of the bag facing up. To store it means to store it in a clean place.

original: song nas de byed pa phyis zhes pa dang / rtsi sbyar ram rtsa ba pos ma yin zhes pa dang / ra da'am leb ma'am shing lo'am bong ba'am shing bu 'dir dge zhes pa dang / sa rnams gnyis kyis bkru zhes pa ni bshang zin pa'i 'og tu de ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis phyi ba dang /
analyzed: song nas de byed pa phyis zhes pa dang / rtsi sbyar ram rtsa ba pos ma yin zhes pa dang / ra da'am leb ma'am shing lo'am bong ba'am shing bu 'dir dge zhes pa dang / sa rnams gnyis kyis bkru zhes pa ni bshang zin pa'i 'og tu de ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis phyi ba dang /
translated: To go means to go to the place where the urine is. To do it means to urinate there.

original: sas lan gnyis gsum tsam khrus shig pa'o //
analyzed: sas lan gnyis gsum tsam khrus shig pa'o //
translated: To wash it means to wash it with the two kinds of earth. 🔽To dry it means to dry it in the sun. 🔽To fold it means to fold it with the mouth of the bag facing up.

original: sa tshoms snga nas bkod pas de'i 'og tu bkru zhes pa dang / chal pas 'gu de dang rkang rten ma smos par dal gyis bya zhes pa ni phyir rol du byung nas sa phrar snga nas byas pa rnams kyis dal gyis bkru zhing chal pa mi 'chol bar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: sa tshoms snga nas bkod pas de'i 'og tu bkru zhes pa dang / chal pas 'gu de dang rkang rten ma smos par dal gyis bya zhes pa ni phyir rol du byung nas sa phrar snga nas byas pa rnams kyis dal gyis bkru zhing chal pa mi 'chol bar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase wash below that refers to the earlier placement of the mound, and the phrase wash slowly without splashing or making noise means that after one has gone outside, those who have already washed the feet should wash slowly without splashing or making noise.

original: bdun gyis g-yon pa ba zhes pa dang / bdun gyis gnyi ga zhes pa dang / dpung pa gnyis bkru zhes pa dang / sas yang lag pa gnyis bkru zhes pa dang / gzhan gyis kun bde zhes pa dang / rkang pa gnyis bkru zhes pa ni sa phung bdun gyis lag pa g-yon pa bkru ba dang /
analyzed: bdun gyis g-yon pa ba zhes pa dang / bdun gyis gnyi ga zhes pa dang / dpung pa gnyis bkru zhes pa dang / sas yang lag pa gnyis bkru zhes pa dang / gzhan gyis kun bde zhes pa dang / rkang pa gnyis bkru zhes pa ni sa phung bdun gyis lag pa g-yon pa bkru ba dang /
translated: The phrase wash the left foot with seven and the phrase wash both with seven and the phrase wash the two shoulders and the phrase wash the two hands with earth and the phrase wash the rest with water and the phrase wash the two feet means that one should wash the left hand with seven mounds of earth.

original: sa phung bdun gyis lag pa gnyis bkru ba dang / dpung pa gnyis bkru ba dang / sa phung gnyis kyis yang lag pa brku ba dang / tha ma'i sa phung gcig gis kun bde bkru ba dang / rkang pa gnyis kyang bkru ba rnams su ston pa'o //
analyzed: sa phung bdun gyis lag pa gnyis bkru ba dang / dpung pa gnyis bkru ba dang / sa phung gnyis kyis yang lag pa brku ba dang / tha ma'i sa phung gcig gis kun bde bkru ba dang / rkang pa gnyis kyang bkru ba rnams su ston pa'o //
translated: The seven heaps are for washing the two hands, washing the two shoulders, washing the hands again with two heaps, washing the whole body with the last heap, and washing the two feet.

original: tshad pa 'dzag pas mjug tshun chad phyi ba tsam bya ste stan la 'dug pa nyes med ces pa dang / de las gzhan ni chu yod na ma bkrus par mi 'dug ces pa ni bkru sman btang ste tshad pa rtag tu 'ong ba lta bu ni mjug ma chad kyi bar du phyis pa tsam gyis kyang cho ga pa dang /
analyzed: tshad pa 'dzag pas mjug tshun chad phyi ba tsam bya ste stan la 'dug pa nyes med ces pa dang / de las gzhan ni chu yod na ma bkrus par mi 'dug ces pa ni bkru sman btang ste tshad pa rtag tu 'ong ba lta bu ni mjug ma chad kyi bar du phyis pa tsam gyis kyang cho ga pa dang /
translated: It is said, It is permissible to sit on a seat after merely wiping up to the end with a dripping measure, and Otherwise, if there is water, one should not sit without washing. If one has taken a purgative and one's diarrhea is constant, merely wiping up to the end with a dripping measure is sufficient.

original: de ma yin pa gzhan ni chu yod pa la bkrus na stan la ma 'dug shig pa'o //
analyzed: de ma yin pa gzhan ni chu yod pa la bkrus na stan la ma 'dug shig pa'o //
translated: If it is not that, but there is water, one should not sit without washing.

original: phran tshegs la sogs pa sman gyi dngos por gtogs pa'o /
analyzed: phran tshegs la sogs pa sman gyi dngos por gtogs pa'o /
translated: Minor and so on refers to medicinal substances.

original: // / da ni las kyi dngos por gtogs pa bsdus te ston pa ni cho ga las 'gal na las mi skye zhes pa la sogs pa yin te las su bya'o //
analyzed: // / da ni las kyi dngos por gtogs pa bsdus te ston pa ni cho ga las 'gal na las mi skye zhes pa la sogs pa yin te las su bya'o //
translated: Now, the summary of the actual ritual is stated: “If there is a transgression of the ritual procedure, the rite does not arise.”

original: cho ga'i cho ga las 'gal @224a * //
analyzed: cho ga'i cho ga las 'gal @224a * //
translated: If there is a transgression of the ritual procedure,

original: bar byas na las su mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: bar byas na las su mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: it is taught that the rite is not suitable.

original: mi thos par byas pas thos na ma yin zhes pa ni tshul khrims zhig pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la sogs pas thos na yang las su mi rung ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: mi thos par byas pas thos na ma yin zhes pa ni tshul khrims zhig pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la sogs pas thos na yang las su mi rung ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: “If heard, not if not heard” means that if heard by one whose ethics are ruined, or by one not fully ordained, and so on, it is not that the rite is not suitable.

original: mi skye ba ni mi bya zhes pa ni las su mi rung ba nyes byas sam ltung ba dang bsngos la ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: mi skye ba ni mi bya zhes pa ni las su mi rung ba nyes byas sam ltung ba dang bsngos la ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: “Do not perform the non-arisen” means do not perform the rite that is not suitable, whether a fault or a downfall.

original: las kyi dngos po nyid ston pa ni de'i ni gsol ba zhu ba so sor thar pa 'don pa tshul nas 'byung ba'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: las kyi dngos po nyid ston pa ni de'i ni gsol ba zhu ba so sor thar pa 'don pa tshul nas 'byung ba'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The actual ritual is taught: “The request is from the recitation of the Prātimokṣa, as it occurs in the scriptures.”

original: las ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams so //
analyzed: las ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams so //
translated: The rites are these mentioned by name.

original: gang cho ga las 'gal na las su mi rung ba de ston pa ni chos ma yin pas mi bya zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gang cho ga las 'gal na las su mi rung ba de ston pa ni chos ma yin pas mi bya zhes pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of the statement, “Whatever is contrary to the rite is not Dharma and should not be done,” is that if something is contrary to the rite, it is not Dharma and should not be done.

original: ma glengs ma bskul bar chad pa la sogs pa nan gyis bcad pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ma glengs ma bskul bar chad pa la sogs pa nan gyis bcad pa ni chos ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not Dharma to forcefully impose a suspension without being requested to do so.

original: tshogs ma yin zhes pa ni khar ba dang dra ba'i sdom pa sbyin pa bzhi la sogs pa'i tshogs su bslang ba las ma sbyin cig pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs ma yin zhes pa ni khar ba dang dra ba'i sdom pa sbyin pa bzhi la sogs pa'i tshogs su bslang ba las ma sbyin cig pa'o //
translated: The statement, “Do not give the four gifts of the staff, the basket, the vow, and so on, in the assembly,” means do not give these in the assembly of those who have taken up the vow.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa de bzhin ma 'dus par ma yin zhes pa ni mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa rnams kyi dad pa ma blangs par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa de bzhin ma 'dus par ma yin zhes pa ni mtshams kyi nang na 'khod pa rnams kyi dad pa ma blangs par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The statement, “Do not give full ordination to one who is not present in the same community” means do not give full ordination to one who is not present within the confines of the same monastery.

original: dge 'dun du ma gyur na zhes pa ni dge 'dun bzhi yan chad dge 'dun gyi grangs su dgos pa bzhin du ma tshang bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma gyur na zhes pa ni dge 'dun bzhi yan chad dge 'dun gyi grangs su dgos pa bzhin du ma tshang bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The statement, “Do not give full ordination to one who is not a saṅgha” means do not give full ordination to one who is not a saṅgha of four or more.

original: byung ba ni nyi shu la sogs pas dge 'dun zhes pa ni lhag ma las byung ba'i dge 'dun ni nyi shu yan chad dgos pa'o //
analyzed: byung ba ni nyi shu la sogs pas dge 'dun zhes pa ni lhag ma las byung ba'i dge 'dun ni nyi shu yan chad dgos pa'o //
translated: The statement, “Do not give full ordination to one who is not a saṅgha that has arisen” means do not give full ordination to a saṅgha that has arisen from a remainder of less than twenty.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni bcu la sogs pas zhes pa dang / ma ldan na mtha' khob tu 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang lnga la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni yul dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge 'dun bcu yan chad dgos pa dang / mtha' khob tu lnga yan chad dgos pa'o /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni bcu la sogs pas zhes pa dang / ma ldan na mtha' khob tu 'dul ba 'dzin pa dang lnga la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni yul dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i dge 'dun bcu yan chad dgos pa dang / mtha' khob tu lnga yan chad dgos pa'o /
translated: ordination by five or more is in the border region pratyantadesa.

original: lhag ma ni bzhi la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun bzhi yan chad dgos pa'o //🔽dge slong ma dang ni las tha dad ces pa ni las gong du smos pa rnams kyang /
analyzed: lhag ma ni bzhi la sogs pa'o zhes pa ni dbyung ba dang bsnyen par rdzogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i las gzhan byed pa'i tshe dge 'dun bzhi yan chad dgos pa'o // dge slong ma dang ni las tha dad ces pa ni las gong du smos pa rnams kyang /
translated: The rest is by four or more is when other than the rites of leaving home and full ordination, the other rites require four or more.🔽And with nuns, the rite is separate.

original: dge slong ma dang ni tha dad par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma dang ni tha dad par ston pa'o //
translated: This teaches that the above rites are separate from those of nuns.

original: tha dad pa las kyang kha cig dge 'dun gyi btang dgos pa ni tshul nas 'byin pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang zhes pa la sogs pa yin te tshul nas 'byin pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun yang med du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa las kyang kha cig dge 'dun gyi btang dgos pa ni tshul nas 'byin pa ni dge slong gi dge 'dun gyis kyang zhes pa la sogs pa yin te tshul nas 'byin pa'i tshe dge slong gi dge 'dun yang med du mi rung ba'o //
translated: Some from the different schools say that the Sangha must give permission for the novice monk to leave the life of a monk.  The phrase “the Sangha of monks” and so forth means that when the novice monk leaves the life of a monk, the Sangha of monks is indispensable.

original: de dag 'dum bar gyur nas gso sbyin zhes pa ni @224b dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams dang mthun par gyur nas gdod gso sbyin gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag 'dum bar gyur nas gso sbyin zhes pa ni @224b dge slong gi dge 'dun rnams dang mthun par gyur nas gdod gso sbyin gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase “when they have reconciled, they should give the poṣadha” means that when the monks have become harmonious, they should give the poṣadha.

original: 'dun par bya ba ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
analyzed: 'dun par bya ba ji ltar bsgrub ce na /
translated: How is the consent accomplished?

original: dad pa dang gso sbyin phul bas de grub ces pa yin te /
analyzed: dad pa dang gso sbyin phul bas de grub ces pa yin te /
translated: The phrase “by faith and by giving the poṣadha” means that it is accomplished by that.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gso sbyin bya bar gsol nas gdod sdom pa de 'grub par ston pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun gyi gso sbyin bya bar gsol nas gdod sdom pa de 'grub par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase “having requested the Sangha of nuns to give the poṣadha” shows that the vow is accomplished only after the request.

original: 'dir gnyis kyi las so zhes pa ni dad pa dang gso sbyin 'bul ba dge slong ma gnyis kyi las yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis kyi las so zhes pa ni dad pa dang gso sbyin 'bul ba dge slong ma gnyis kyi las yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase “here it is the work of two” means that the work of the two nuns is the faith and the giving of the poṣadha.

original: 'di nus pa dag gis so zhes pa ni dad pa dang gso sbyin dbul ba dang nod nus pa'i dge slong ma gnyis skos shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nus pa dag gis so zhes pa ni dad pa dang gso sbyin dbul ba dang nod nus pa'i dge slong ma gnyis skos shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase by those who are able means that two nuns who have faith, who are able to give the poṣadha, and who are able to receive it should be appointed.

original: med na gcig gis kyang zhes pa ni nus pa gnyis med na gcig kyang bla'o //🔽dge 'dun gyis skad len pa'i dge slong bsko zhes pa dang / de'i gnas ni sgo khang ngo zhes pa dang / 'bros pa lta na bsgo zhes pa dang / des kyang 'di bzhin zhes pa dang / 'bros par ma yin zhes pa dang / mi shes na ming rus dri zhes pa ni dge slong ma'i cha skad len pa 'di dge slong bsko ba dang /
analyzed: med na gcig gis kyang zhes pa ni nus pa gnyis med na gcig kyang bla'o // dge 'dun gyis skad len pa'i dge slong bsko zhes pa dang / de'i gnas ni sgo khang ngo zhes pa dang / 'bros pa lta na bsgo zhes pa dang / des kyang 'di bzhin zhes pa dang / 'bros par ma yin zhes pa dang / mi shes na ming rus dri zhes pa ni dge slong ma'i cha skad len pa 'di dge slong bsko ba dang /
translated: If there are none, then even one is able to do it. The phrase the saṃgha appoints a monk to be the reciter of the code means that the saṃgha appoints a monk to be the reciter of the code.🔽The phrase his place is the doorway means that he should sit in the doorway. The phrase if she runs away, he should say, 'Stay!' means that if the nun runs away, he should say, Do not run away!🔽The phrase if he does not know, he should ask her name and clan means that the monk who has been appointed to be the reciter of the code of the nuns should ask the nun who has run away her name and clan.🔽The phrase he should sit in the doorway means that he should sit in the doorway. The phrase if she runs away, he should say, 'Stay!' means that if the nun runs away, he should say, Do not run away!

original: des sgo khang du bsdad pa dang / des 'bros na dge slong mas ma 'bros so zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ma bros na yang des 'bros su mi gnang ba dang / sus bskos pa'i rgyus mi shes na'ang ming rus dris shig pa'o //
analyzed: des sgo khang du bsdad pa dang / des 'bros na dge slong mas ma 'bros so zhes bya ba dang / dge slong ma bros na yang des 'bros su mi gnang ba dang / sus bskos pa'i rgyus mi shes na'ang ming rus dris shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase if the nun runs away, he should not allow her to run away means that even if the nun runs away, he should not allow her to run away. The phrase if he does not know because of the reason for which he was appointed, he should ask her name and clan means that if he does not know because of the reason for which he was appointed, he should ask her name and clan.

original: mgu ba dang dbyung ba ni gnyis tshogs te'o zhes pa ni dge slong ma lhag ma byung bas mgu ba dang dbyung ba gnyis ka dge 'dun sde gnyis la bya dgos pa'o //
analyzed: mgu ba dang dbyung ba ni gnyis tshogs te'o zhes pa ni dge slong ma lhag ma byung bas mgu ba dang dbyung ba gnyis ka dge 'dun sde gnyis la bya dgos pa'o //
translated: This means that satisfaction and expulsion must be done by two groups of the Sangha, because of the occurrence of the nun’s remainder offenses.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe'ang dge 'dun sde gnyis dgos pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i tshe'ang dge 'dun sde gnyis dgos pa'o //
translated: Also, full ordination, means that when a nun is fully ordained, she must have two groups of the Sangha.

original: 'di rnams kyi sde ni bcu gnyis so zhes pa ni dge slong ma yul gyi dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni dge 'dun bcu gnyis dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi sde ni bcu gnyis so zhes pa ni dge slong ma yul gyi dbus su bsnyen par rdzogs pa ni dge 'dun bcu gnyis dgos pa'o //
translated: Their group is twelve, means that when a nun is fully ordained in the central region, she must have twelve nuns.

original: sdom pa snga ma gnyis dang / 'god pa tshad med pa'i 'khor 'jog pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa ni dge 'dun gyi mthas so zhes pa ni dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa gnyis dang / 'khor dang tshad med pa'i 'khor 'jog pa'i sdom pa dpog pa dang /
analyzed: sdom pa snga ma gnyis dang / 'god pa tshad med pa'i 'khor 'jog pa'i sdom pa sbyin pa ni dge 'dun gyi mthas so zhes pa ni dge slong ma'i sdom pa dang tshangs pa'i gnas kyi sdom pa gnyis dang / 'khor dang tshad med pa'i 'khor 'jog pa'i sdom pa dpog pa dang /
translated: The two former vows, and the vow to set out an immeasurable retinue, are given by the Sangha, means that the two vows of a nun and the vow of the Brahma abodes, and the vow to set out an immeasurable retinue, are given by the Sangha.

original: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun bcu gnyis kyis phog shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i dge 'dun bcu gnyis kyis phog shig pa'o //
translated: The nuns’ community of twelve should be appointed.

original: las byed ma nus na des mnyan la dge slong phas zhu ba byar rung zhes pa ni dge slong mas las byed ma nus na dge slong phas byas la des mnyan du rung ba'o //
analyzed: las byed ma nus na des mnyan la dge slong phas zhu ba byar rung zhes pa ni dge slong mas las byed ma nus na dge slong phas byas la des mnyan du rung ba'o //
translated: If she is unable to perform the rite, then it is suitable for the monks to listen to her request. This means that if the nun is unable to perform the rite, the monks should do it, and it is suitable for the nuns to listen to that.

original: ji srid kyi bar du @225a * //
analyzed: ji srid kyi bar du @225a * //
translated: For how long?

original: zhe na gang gi phyir mi gsung bas na zhes pa tshun chad do zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: zhe na gang gi phyir mi gsung bas na zhes pa tshun chad do zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is said that it is until the Blessed One remains silent.

original: 'phags ma'i dge 'dun gyis bzod na zhes pa yan chad dge slong phas bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags ma'i dge 'dun gyis bzod na zhes pa yan chad dge slong phas bya'o //
translated: The monks should perform the rite from the point of “If the community of noble nuns consents” onward.

original: gang mi gsung bas zhes pa'i tshig nyid ni dge slong mas brjod dgos pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi gsung bas zhes pa'i tshig nyid ni dge slong mas brjod dgos pa'o //
translated: The very words “the Blessed One remains silent” must be spoken by the nun.

original: ma bkad na tshangs pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge 'dun ril gyis gral du ma bkad par la la 'dug la la 'chag bzhin du las byas na spyod lam tha dad pa'i phyir las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: ma bkad na tshangs pa ma yin zhes pa ni dge 'dun ril gyis gral du ma bkad par la la 'dug la la 'chag bzhin du las byas na spyod lam tha dad pa'i phyir las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: If they do not arrange the rows, it is not pure. This means that if the rite is performed while some are sitting and some are standing, the rite is invalid because the posture is different.

original: gang gis byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa dge slong gi phyir las byed pa de nyid dge 'dun gyi grangs su ma gzhug shig pa'o //
analyzed: gang gis byed pa ma yin zhes pa ni chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa dge slong gi phyir las byed pa de nyid dge 'dun gyi grangs su ma gzhug shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase by whom it is not done means that the very person who performs the action for the sake of the monk, such as the one who cuts him off, should not be counted as part of the Saṅgha.

original: de lta bas na dad pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i tshogs tshangs par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni gong ma lta na dad pa dang yongs su dag tsam gyis dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i kha bskang bar mi byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na dad pa dang / yongs su dag pa'i tshogs tshangs par mi 'gyur zhes pa ni gong ma lta na dad pa dang yongs su dag tsam gyis dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i kha bskang bar mi byed cig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the phrase the assembly of faith and purity is not complete means that if it is as stated above, one should not complete the Saṅgha with mere faith and purity.

original: 'di gnyis mi blang zhes pa dang / tshul nas 'byin pa mi bsko zhes pa ni dge 'dun bzhi las med na gcig gis dad pa blang ba dang / de bzhin du bzhi las med na gcig tshul nas 'byin par ma bsko shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di gnyis mi blang zhes pa dang / tshul nas 'byin pa mi bsko zhes pa ni dge 'dun bzhi las med na gcig gis dad pa blang ba dang / de bzhin du bzhi las med na gcig tshul nas 'byin par ma bsko shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase these two should not be accepted and one who expels from the rule should not be appointed means that if there are no more than four monks, one should not accept faith, and likewise, if there are no more than four, one should not appoint one who expels from the rule.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhig pa mtshams med par byas pa sdig par lta bas gzhan la gnas pa du mar gnas pa rnams ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i kha bskang bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa zhig pa mtshams med par byas pa sdig par lta bas gzhan la gnas pa du mar gnas pa rnams ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis dge 'dun ma tshang ba'i kha bskang bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: One who has not taken full ordination, one who has broken his vows, one who has committed a deed of immediate retribution, one who has a sinful view, and one who is in the company of many who are not complete.

original: de la zhig ces pa ni tshul khrims zhig pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhig ces pa ni tshul khrims zhig pa'o //
translated: One who has broken his vows means one who has broken his moral discipline.

original: sdig par lta zhes pa ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis gang yang rung bar bltas pa'o //🔽sa gzhan la gnas zhes pa ni dge slong tha mal ba'i sa de chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa'i las na 'dug pa'o //
analyzed: sdig par lta zhes pa ni lta ba drug cu rtsa gnyis gang yang rung bar bltas pa'o // sa gzhan la gnas zhes pa ni dge slong tha mal ba'i sa de chad pas bcad pa la sogs pa'i las na 'dug pa'o //
translated: One who has a sinful view means one who has any of the sixty-two views.🔽One who is in the company of many who are not complete means one who is in the company of ordinary monks who have been punished, and so on.

original: du mar gnas zhes pa ni skabs 'dir chos ma yin pa'i phyogs la gnas pa ste lhas byin gyi phyogs na 'khod pa ma tshang ba rnams kyi kha de'i phyogs su ma spong ba'i dge slong tha mal ba rnams kyis bskong du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: du mar gnas zhes pa ni skabs 'dir chos ma yin pa'i phyogs la gnas pa ste lhas byin gyi phyogs na 'khod pa ma tshang ba rnams kyi kha de'i phyogs su ma spong ba'i dge slong tha mal ba rnams kyis bskong du mi rung ba'o //
translated: One who is in the company of many who are not complete means one who is in the company of many who are not complete, that is, those who are on the side of Devadatta. It is not proper for ordinary monks who have not abandoned that side to make up the quorum.

original: smas pa yang zhes pa ni phas pham pa ma yin pa'i lhag ma man chad nyes pa bzhin byas pa la bya ste /
analyzed: smas pa yang zhes pa ni phas pham pa ma yin pa'i lhag ma man chad nyes pa bzhin byas pa la bya ste /
translated: The term also refers to those who commit faults other than the defeating offenses.

original: nyes pa de dag lta bu dang ldan pas dge 'dun gyi kha bskang du'ang mi rung bar ston pa'o /
analyzed: nyes pa de dag lta bu dang ldan pas dge 'dun gyi kha bskang du'ang mi rung bar ston pa'o /
translated: This teaches that those who possess such faults are not even suitable to be included in the Saṅgha.

original: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /🔽'gro ba las btsun pa ji tsam gyis na rang bzhin la mi gnas pa lags au p'a li sbyang pa ma yin pa spyod cing dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob pa 'di tsam gyis rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas na @225b tshul khrims yongs
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na / 'gro ba las btsun pa ji tsam gyis na rang bzhin la mi gnas pa lags au p'a li sbyang pa ma yin pa spyod cing dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob pa 'di tsam gyis rang bzhin la mi gnas pa'o zhes 'byung bas na @225b tshul khrims yongs
translated: Why is this?

original: su dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ji tsam yan chad kyis smras par gdags she na /
analyzed: su dag pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro // de ji tsam yan chad kyis smras par gdags she na /
translated: Because they are not completely pure in terms of ethical conduct.🔽Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.🔽Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.

original: bsdam par bya ba yang zhes pa yin bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa lta ci smos kyis bsdams par bya ba'i nyes byas kyis kyang smras par 'gyur ba'o //🔽ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba yang zhes pa yin bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa lta ci smos kyis bsdams par bya ba'i nyes byas kyis kyang smras par 'gyur ba'o //🔽ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.🔽Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.🔽Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.🔽Upāli, if one does not train in the training of a fully ordained monk and engages in nonvirtue, to that extent one does not abide in the nature of a fully ordained monk.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba'i dngos po las 'gal te bsdam par bya bar khas len na yang bsdams nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes 'byung bas na kha cig na re de lta na ni rna rdum dang nad la sogs par bsnyen par rdzogs par byed na dang po rtsom pa
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba'i dngos po las 'gal te bsdam par bya bar khas len na yang bsdams nas 'byung bar bya'o zhes 'byung bas na kha cig na re de lta na ni rna rdum dang nad la sogs par bsnyen par rdzogs par byed na dang po rtsom pa
translated: If you accept that it arises from the object of the vow, then it would arise from the object of the vow that is to be guarded, since it arises from the object of the vow that is to be guarded.

original: nas dge 'dun kun nyes byas can du gyur na ni dge 'dun du ma longs /🔽dge 'dun du ma longs na ni las su mi rung /
analyzed: nas dge 'dun kun nyes byas can du gyur na ni dge 'dun du ma longs / dge 'dun du ma longs na ni las su mi rung /
translated: Some say: If that is so, then if one is fully ordained in the presence of a blind person, one with a skin disease and so on, then from the beginning the saṅgha is not complete.🔽If the saṅgha is not complete, then the rite is not suitable.

original: las su mi rung na ni bsnyen par rdzogs par yang mi 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: las su mi rung na ni bsnyen par rdzogs par yang mi 'gyur bas na /
translated: If the rite is not suitable, then one is not fully ordained.🔽Some say: That is illogical. It refers to the absence of a downfall that is a basis of defeat.

original: bshad pa mi rigs kyi phas pham pa'i smras pa ma byung ba la bya'o zhes rgol ba yang yod mod kyi de ltar yang mi 'gyur te gsol ba'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs na yongs su gtsang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad pa mi rigs kyi phas pham pa'i smras pa ma byung ba la bya'o zhes rgol ba yang yod mod kyi de ltar yang mi 'gyur te gsol ba'i las kyis byin gyis brlabs na yongs su gtsang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: But that is not so, because if the rite of proposal is empowered, then it is completely pure.

original: bshags pa med du zin kyang yongs su dag pa ston pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa ni dag par 'gyur zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa'i nyes pa byin gyis brlabs pa na yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bshags pa med du zin kyang yongs su dag pa ston pa ni byin gyis brlabs pa ni dag par 'gyur zhes pa yin te dge 'dun gyi lhag ma la sogs pa'i nyes pa byin gyis brlabs pa na yongs su dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even if confession is not possible, the teaching of complete purification is the statement, “Purification occurs through consecration,” because when the faults of a partial defeat of the Saṅgha and so on are consecrated, complete purification occurs.

original: de mod la bshags su rung ba yang byin gyis brlabs pas slon nam zhe na /
analyzed: de mod la bshags su rung ba yang byin gyis brlabs pas slon nam zhe na /
translated: Is it also possible to confess immediately?

original: nus na ma yin zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: nus na ma yin zhes pa yin te /
translated: It is not possible if one is able.

original: de'i mod la bshags su rung ba ni byin gyis brlabs su zin gyis kyang yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mod la bshags su rung ba ni byin gyis brlabs su zin gyis kyang yongs su dag par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: If it is possible to confess immediately, then even if one is consecrated, complete purification does not occur.

original: de'i mod la bshags su rung ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i mod la bshags su rung ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is it that is possible to confess immediately?

original: de'i mod la nus pa ni ltung ba nyi tshe dang so sor bshags pa dang nyes byas bcos su rung ba rnams te /
analyzed: de'i mod la nus pa ni ltung ba nyi tshe dang so sor bshags pa dang nyes byas bcos su rung ba rnams te /
translated: It is possible to confess immediately if one is able to confess immediately, if one is able to confess a single downfall, if one is able to confess individually, and if one is able to amend a minor offense.

original: len pa yod na bshags pa tsam gyis cho ga pa'i phyir zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: len pa yod na bshags pa tsam gyis cho ga pa'i phyir zhes pa yin te /
translated: If one is able to take it back, then it is possible to confess it through the ceremony.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis nyes pa bshags pa'i mod la dag pa'i phyir las byed pa'i tshe ma bshags par len pa yod bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa ni byin gyis brlabs kyang mi phan pa'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyis nyes pa bshags pa'i mod la dag pa'i phyir las byed pa'i tshe ma bshags par len pa yod bzhin du byin gyis brlabs pa ni byin gyis brlabs kyang mi phan pa'o //
translated: Since these named ones are purified the moment they confess their faults, it is not beneficial to bless them while taking them without confessing them when performing the rite.

original: nyes par gyur pa ni 'du shes ji bzhin du bya zhes pa ni nyes par gyur pa la kha mi 'dum na so sor ji ltar bkyig pa'i 'du shes bzhin du gyis shig pa'o //🔽gcig la yang bskrad pa'am /🔽mi bskrad pa'am /
analyzed: nyes par gyur pa ni 'du shes ji bzhin du bya zhes pa ni nyes par gyur pa la kha mi 'dum na so sor ji ltar bkyig pa'i 'du shes bzhin du gyis shig pa'o // gcig la yang bskrad pa'am / mi bskrad pa'am /
translated: “One should act according to one’s perception of what is wrong” means that if one does not reconcile with what is wrong, one should act according to one’s perception of how to bind it individually.🔽“It is not suitable to expel or not expel or to do many kinds of corrections to even one person.”

original: bcos pa'i rnam pa du mar yang mi rung ba med ces pa ni gong ma ltar kha du ma na gang zag gcig la @226a * //
analyzed: bcos pa'i rnam pa du mar yang mi rung ba med ces pa ni gong ma ltar kha du ma na gang zag gcig la @226a * //
translated: As above, it is not suitable to expel or not expel or to do many kinds of corrections to even one person.

original: yang lhag ma ma lus par 'du shes pa rnams kyi ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su bcug pa dang tshangs par bya ba yang gong ma dang 'dra bar so sor 'du shes ji lta ba bzhin du gnyen po la brten du bcug na mi rung ba med par
analyzed: yang lhag ma ma lus par 'du shes pa rnams kyi ni dge 'dun gyi khongs su bcug pa dang tshangs par bya ba yang gong ma dang 'dra bar so sor 'du shes ji lta ba bzhin du gnyen po la brten du bcug na mi rung ba med par
translated: As above, it is not unsuitable to make them rely on the antidotes according to their individual perceptions.

original: ston pa'o // 'di dag gi bya bar ma yin zhes pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa nas smos pa zhes pa'i bar du smos pa rnams kyis gsol ba la sogs pa'i las ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: ston pa'o // 'di dag gi bya bar ma yin zhes pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa nas smos pa zhes pa'i bar du smos pa rnams kyis gsol ba la sogs pa'i las ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase “these are not your duties” means that from the time of full ordination until the time of the request, one should not perform the duties of the rite.

original: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gleng gzhi las btsun pa bslab pa byin pa las bgyis na las bgyis pa'am ma bgyis pa zhe na /
analyzed: gleng gzhi las btsun pa bslab pa byin pa las bgyis na las bgyis pa'am ma bgyis pa zhe na /
translated: In the nidāna it says, “Venerable, if one performs the rite of giving training, is the rite performed or not?”

original: au p'a li ma byas pa yin gyis slar skyos shig ces pa dang / de bzhin du ma ning dang za ma dang / dge slong ma slu ba dang / pha ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i las byas pa rnams dang / mu stegs pa dang mu stegs par zhugs pa dang /
analyzed: au p'a li ma byas pa yin gyis slar skyos shig ces pa dang / de bzhin du ma ning dang za ma dang / dge slong ma slu ba dang / pha ma gsod pa la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i las byas pa rnams dang / mu stegs pa dang mu stegs par zhugs pa dang /
translated: and the same applies to those who have committed heinous acts such as killing their mother, father or an arhat, or who have caused a schism in the saṅgha, or who have maliciously drawn blood from a tathāgata.

original: rkun bur gnas pa dang / du mar gnas pa rnams kyi las byas pa yang skyos shig ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkun bur gnas pa dang / du mar gnas pa rnams kyi las byas pa yang skyos shig ces 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It also applies to those who are non Buddhists, those who have entered the non Buddhist order, those who are thieves, and those who are living in a community.🔽Those who have a remainder should be expelled in accordance with the Dharma.

original: lhag ma can chos bzhin pas gdon par bya zhes pa ni lhag ma gnyen po la brten bzhin pas ni so sor thar pa gdon du rung ba ste /
analyzed: lhag ma can chos bzhin pas gdon par bya zhes pa ni lhag ma gnyen po la brten bzhin pas ni so sor thar pa gdon du rung ba ste /
translated: Those who have a remainder who are relying on the antidote are suitable to be expelled through individual liberation.

original: 'di dag gi bya ba ma yin zhes pa'i mdo 'brel ba yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gi bya ba ma yin zhes pa'i mdo 'brel ba yin no //
translated: This is related to the sutra that states, “They are not to be engaged with.”🔽Those who are not others should not listen.

original: de las gzhan pa dag gis thos par mi bya zhes pa ni lhag ma chos bzhin pa las gzhan pa dag gis ni dge 'dun gyi las thos par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag gis thos par mi bya zhes pa ni lhag ma chos bzhin pa las gzhan pa dag gis ni dge 'dun gyi las thos par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Those who are not others who have a remainder should not listen to the actions of the saṅgha.

original: thams cad kyi de lta 'am zhe na /🔽ma spangs pa ma log pa ni ma gtogs zhes pa yin te /🔽bkar zhing bye ba'i spangs pa ma yin pa dang mtshams med pa byas pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i log pa ma yin pa ni thos par mi bya ba ma gtogs par ston pa ste /🔽de la bkar zhing bye ba ci'i phyir spangs pa zhe na /🔽chos dang zang zing gi spyod pa mi gcig par dge 'dun gyis spangs pa'i phyir ro //🔽mtshams med par byas pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir log pa zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyi de lta 'am zhe na / ma spangs pa ma log pa ni ma gtogs zhes pa yin te / bkar zhing bye ba'i spangs pa ma yin pa dang mtshams med pa byas pa dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i log pa ma yin pa ni thos par mi bya ba ma gtogs par ston pa ste / de la bkar zhing bye ba ci'i phyir spangs pa zhe na / chos dang zang zing gi spyod pa mi gcig par dge 'dun gyis spangs pa'i phyir ro // mtshams med par byas pa la sogs pa ci'i phyir log pa zhe na /
translated: Are all of these to be avoided?🔽The text says, “except for those who have not abandoned or rejected the precepts.”🔽Those who have not abandoned the precepts by a formal act of the community, those who have not committed a heinous act, and those who have not rejected the precepts of full ordination are to be taught, except for those who are not to be taught.🔽Why is one who has abandoned the precepts by a formal act of the community to be avoided?🔽Because the community has rejected him, since his behavior with regard to the Dharma and material things is not the same as that of others.🔽Why is one who has committed a heinous act, etc., to be rejected?🔽

original: mtshams med par byas pa ni bde 'gro las log pa'i phyir ro //🔽zhig pa ni tha ma pa las log pa'o //🔽bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa ni bsnyen par rdzogs pa las log pa'i phyir ro //

original: de la ma spangs pa'i dngos po ni bsdigs pa dang smras pa dang bskrad pa dang mgod thod dang bslab pa byin pa dang / de'i rang bzhin tshol ba rnams so bkar ba nyid kyi las kyang ngo zhes pa ni bkar ba'i chad pa brag bkar tshangs pa'i las thos kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: de la ma spangs pa'i dngos po ni bsdigs pa dang smras pa dang bskrad pa dang mgod thod dang bslab pa byin pa dang / de'i rang bzhin tshol ba rnams so bkar ba nyid kyi las kyang ngo zhes pa ni bkar ba'i chad pa brag bkar tshangs pa'i las thos kyang bla ba'o //
translated: The thing that is not abandoned is the act of threatening, the act of speaking, the act of banishing, the act of ridiculing, the act of giving training, and the act of searching for the nature of the offense.🔽Also, the act of accusing is the punishment of accusation.🔽When one wishes to be fully ordained, one also hears the act of requesting, and so on, in order to ask about the internal.

original: bsnyen par @226b rdzogs par 'dod pa na nang du 'dri ba'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dge 'dun gyi nang du bar chad kyi chos dri ba'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa'i las thos kyang bla ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par @226b rdzogs par 'dod pa na nang du 'dri ba'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa yang ngo zhes pa bsnyen par rdzogs par 'dod pa dge 'dun gyi nang du bar chad kyi chos dri ba'i phyir gsol ba la sogs pa'i las thos kyang bla ba'o //
translated: When one wishes to be fully ordained, one hears the act of requesting, and so on, in order to ask about the phenomena that are obstacles in the Saṅgha.🔽Even though one hears the act of accusation, one is not afraid.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang kha cig ni mngon sum du bya /
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la yang kha cig ni mngon sum du bya /
translated: Even though one is not fully ordained, some things are to be done in person,

original: kha cig ni thos par bya ba la mngon sum dang thos pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: kha cig ni thos par bya ba la mngon sum dang thos pa'i thabs ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: and some things are to be done by hearing. How are the methods of doing in person and by hearing done?

original: mngon sum ni mthong ba'i lam du bzhag pa dang thos pa ni spran pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum ni mthong ba'i lam du bzhag pa dang thos pa ni spran pa ste /
translated: Doing in person is established as the path of seeing, and hearing is the act of accusing.

original: de ltar byas pas bsgrub ces pa yin te /🔽bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mngon sum gyi las su bya ba yang mthong ba'i lam du bzhag nas bya ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la thos pa'i las bya bas bskrad pa lta bu yin te mig lam du mi snang bar bzhag la dge slong gcig gis
analyzed: de ltar byas pas bsgrub ces pa yin te / bsnyen par rdzogs pa la mngon sum gyi las su bya ba yang mthong ba'i lam du bzhag nas bya ba dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la thos pa'i las bya bas bskrad pa lta bu yin te mig lam du mi snang bar bzhag la dge slong gcig gis
translated: Thus, it is said that one should do it in that way.🔽The act of the ceremony for full ordination is also posited as the path of seeing.🔽The act of the ceremony for those not fully ordained is like the expulsion of a monk who has committed a defeating offense.

original: spran cing skad sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: spran cing skad sbyar ba'o //
translated: One monk should ask the aspirant about the obstacles to ordination.

original: gtsug lag khang smos pa la phyag mi bya /🔽mi smra mi spyod pa rnams kyi sdom pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur par ro zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi sdom pa dbog pa ni gang zag de nyid la ltos mi dgos par dbang dge 'dun la yod pas na mngon sum du
analyzed: gtsug lag khang smos pa la phyag mi bya / mi smra mi spyod pa rnams kyi sdom pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur par ro zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams kyi sdom pa dbog pa ni gang zag de nyid la ltos mi dgos par dbang dge 'dun la yod pas na mngon sum du
translated: One should not bow down to the mention of a monastery.🔽The vows of those who do not speak or act are not conferred in the presence of the aspirant.

original: mi bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi bya ba'o //
translated: The vows of those mentioned by name are conferred by the Saṅgha without the need to rely on the presence of the aspirant.🔽Therefore, the vows are not conferred in the presence of the aspirant.

original: de la gtsug lag khang zhes pa ni gang zag gcig gi gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun gzhan mi 'grul bar sdom pa bca' ba'o //
analyzed: de la gtsug lag khang zhes pa ni gang zag gcig gi gtsug lag khang du dge 'dun gzhan mi 'grul bar sdom pa bca' ba'o //
translated: A monastery is a place where the Saṅgha does not travel.

original: smos zhes pa ni dge slong smos pa'i sdom pa dpog pa'o //
analyzed: smos zhes pa ni dge slong smos pa'i sdom pa dpog pa'o //
translated: The term “and so on” indicates that the monk’s vows are also inferred.

original: phyag mi bya zhes pa ni dge slong ma dang ma bos par 'dul ba lta bu dge slong gis bkar zhing dge slong mas phyag mi bya bar de bca'/
analyzed: phyag mi bya zhes pa ni dge slong ma dang ma bos par 'dul ba lta bu dge slong gis bkar zhing dge slong mas phyag mi bya bar de bca'/
translated: “Do not bow down” means that the monk should not bow down to the nun, and the nun should not bow down to the monk, unless the monk is invited to do so.

original: mi smra zhes pa ni gleng bas bskul ba'i skabs mi 'byed na dge 'dun gyis de dang gtam mi bya bar sdom pa bca' ba'o //
analyzed: mi smra zhes pa ni gleng bas bskul ba'i skabs mi 'byed na dge 'dun gyis de dang gtam mi bya bar sdom pa bca' ba'o //
translated: “Do not speak” means that if one does not give an opportunity to speak by initiating a conversation, the Saṅgha should vow not to speak with that person.

original: mi spyod pa ni chos dang zang zing gi spyod pa lhan cig tu mi bya bar dam bca' ba'o //
analyzed: mi spyod pa ni chos dang zang zing gi spyod pa lhan cig tu mi bya bar dam bca' ba'o //
translated: “Do not associate” means vowing not to associate with the Dharma or material things.

original: de la zhal nas gsungs pa la ni lhung bzed kha dbub cing dgon pa dang / khyim du mi 'dod par bslab pa'i dam bca' zhing dgrol ba dang / dge tshul gyi snang bar bskrad pa'i sdom pa lnga dang spyir bcu byung la 'dir ni lnga las mi smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de la zhal nas gsungs pa la ni lhung bzed kha dbub cing dgon pa dang / khyim du mi 'dod par bslab pa'i dam bca' zhing dgrol ba dang / dge tshul gyi snang bar bskrad pa'i sdom pa lnga dang spyir bcu byung la 'dir ni lnga las mi smos pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Regarding the words of the Buddha, there are five vows: not desiring to cover the begging bowl with the upper robe in the wilderness or in a house, and the vows of releasing, expelling the novice, and generally ten. Why are only five mentioned here and not all ten?

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyi phyir bcas pa yin pas na mngon sum du bya bar dogs pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'dir mi smos so //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa rnams kyi phyir bcas pa yin pas na mngon sum du bya bar dogs pa mi skye ba'i phyir 'dir mi smos so //
translated: Since it is for those who have not completed the novitiate, there is no fear of its being done in the presence of the novitiate, and so it is not mentioned here.

original: de'i ched ma gtogs par mi zhu ba zhes pa ni zhu ba gcig la sogs pa'i las gang brtsams kyang rung ste /🔽dang po nyid du dge @227a * //
analyzed: de'i ched ma gtogs par mi zhu ba zhes pa ni zhu ba gcig la sogs pa'i las gang brtsams kyang rung ste / dang po nyid du dge @227a * //
translated: Except for that purpose, do not ask means that whatever rite one has begun, whether it is the first or any other,

original: 'dun go bar bya ba'i gsol ba je ma byas par las kyi tshig ma rtsom shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'dun go bar bya ba'i gsol ba je ma byas par las kyi tshig ma rtsom shig pa'o //
translated: one should not begin the rite without first making a request to inform the saṅgha.

original: gong du mi 'dum par ma yin zhes smos pa de'i mi 'dum pa gang la bya ba ston pa ni mtshams de'i nang du gtogs pa la bskang bar yang 'os pa las lus sam dad pas bkad par ma zhugs pa dang / rgyus mi shes shing 'khon yod pa ma gtogs par spyod lam yang ma nyams rang bzhin la'ang gnas gcig pas kho na nyid kyi las gzhan zhing chos dang 'gal ba la mi ster ba mi mthun pa'o zhes pa yin te mtshams de'i nang du gtogs shing bskang bar

original: 'os pa las bkad gral ma bzung ngam dad pa ma phul na mi mthun par 'gyur ba dang rgyus mi shes shing kho na yod pa ma gtogs par spyod lam ma nyams pa la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu kho na nyid kyi phyir
analyzed: 'os pa las bkad gral ma bzung ngam dad pa ma phul na mi mthun par 'gyur ba dang rgyus mi shes shing kho na yod pa ma gtogs par spyod lam ma nyams pa la sogs pa ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu kho na nyid kyi phyir
translated: Those who are not in harmony with the saṅgha are those who are not in harmony with the saṅgha of that boundary.🔽Those who are not in harmony with the saṅgha are those who are not in harmony with the saṅgha of that boundary.🔽Those who are not in harmony with the saṅgha are those who are

original: yang ma yin chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyis las su mi rung ngo zhes byed du mi ster na mi mthun par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: yang ma yin chos dang 'gal ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyis las su mi rung ngo zhes byed du mi ster na mi mthun par 'gyur bar ston pa'o //
translated: Moreover, if the Saṅgha does not permit the performance of an action because it is contrary to the Dharma, then it is said to be discordant.

original: de la chos dang 'gal bar ni skabs 'dir gang zag gang gi phyir las bya ba'i mi de nyid stams las chad pa'o //
analyzed: de la chos dang 'gal bar ni skabs 'dir gang zag gang gi phyir las bya ba'i mi de nyid stams las chad pa'o //
translated: In this context, contrary to the Dharma is the person for whom the action is to be performed, and the punishment is the action.

original: de'i tshig la gtsigs pa'i 'bru gnyer 'chad pa ni brdzun du smras pa la phal che ba ni tshig mi gtsigs pas so zhes pa dang / phra ma tshig rtsub po ngag kyal ba rnams so zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshig la gtsigs pa'i 'bru gnyer 'chad pa ni brdzun du smras pa la phal che ba ni tshig mi gtsigs pas so zhes pa dang / phra ma tshig rtsub po ngag kyal ba rnams so zhes pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the analysis of the words is that most lies are not weighty words, and that divisive speech, harsh speech, and idle speech are.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu ma yin na tshig gtsigs pa'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu ma yin na tshig gtsigs pa'o //
translated: If they are not mentioned by name, they are weighty words.

original: rang bzhin la gnas pa'i 'bru gnyer 'chad pa ni 'di dang bya ba las 'gal zhing mi bya ba byed pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas pa'o zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: rang bzhin la gnas pa'i 'bru gnyer 'chad pa ni 'di dang bya ba las 'gal zhing mi bya ba byed pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas pa'o zhes pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of the analysis of the natural state is that those who are contrary to the performance of actions and who perform what should not be done do not abide in the natural state.

original: gong du smos pa'i brdzun la sogs pa dang gzhan yang bya ba mi byed cing mi bya ba byed pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ste /
analyzed: gong du smos pa'i brdzun la sogs pa dang gzhan yang bya ba mi byed cing mi bya ba byed pa ni rang bzhin du mi gnas pa ste /
translated: The opposite of the above mentioned lying and so on, and also not doing what is to be done and doing what is not to be done, is not to abide in one's nature.

original: 'di la bzlog na rang bzhin la gnas pa nyid du rig par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la bzlog na rang bzhin la gnas pa nyid du rig par bya ba'o //
translated: The opposite of this is to abide in one's nature.

original: spyod lam nyams pa'i 'bru gnyer ston pa ni /
analyzed: spyod lam nyams pa'i 'bru gnyer ston pa ni /
translated: The instruction on the faults of bad behavior is:

original: de nas 'byol bar bsams te /
analyzed: de nas 'byol bar bsams te /
translated: Then, thinking of leaving,

original: 'di btang ba ni spyod lam nyams pa'o zhes pa yin te dge 'dun las byed pa'i bkad gral de nas gud du 'gro bar bsams te gral nas langs na spyod lam nyams pa yin pas na 'di lta bur ma gyur na spyod lam ma nyams pa'o //
analyzed: 'di btang ba ni spyod lam nyams pa'o zhes pa yin te dge 'dun las byed pa'i bkad gral de nas gud du 'gro bar bsams te gral nas langs na spyod lam nyams pa yin pas na 'di lta bur ma gyur na spyod lam ma nyams pa'o //
translated: One should think, This is the fault of bad behavior, and if one gets up from one's seat in the assembly of monks, thinking of going elsewhere, it is the fault of bad behavior. Therefore, if one does not act like this, one's behavior is not bad.

original: dge 'dun la lta ba bsnyad ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi las su bya ba'i phyi nas bdag gi yid la bab bam ma bab pa la sogs pa dge 'dun la blo gdab cing @227b shad kyis spyod shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la lta ba bsnyad ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi las su bya ba'i phyi nas bdag gi yid la bab bam ma bab pa la sogs pa dge 'dun la blo gdab cing @227b shad kyis spyod shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should inform the Saṅgha of one's view means that after the Saṅgha has done its work, one should inform the Saṅgha with one's mind, thinking, Is this agreeable to me or not?

original: gzhan la ma yin zhes pa dad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ma yin zhes pa dang / bskang bar mi 'os pa la yang zhes pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa la ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu la ni bdag gis bsam pa'am lta ba ma snyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin zhes pa dad bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa la ma yin zhes pa dang / bskang bar mi 'os pa la yang zhes pa dang / lhag ma ma lus pa la ma yin zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu la ni bdag gis bsam pa'am lta ba ma snyod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to others means not to those who have not completed the approach of going for refuge. The phrase not to those who are not suitable to restore means not to those who are not suitable to restore the vows. The phrase not to those who have not completely relinquished means not to those who have not relinquished the remainder of the offense. These are the ones who are mentioned by name. Do not accuse them of having the thought or view of the offense.

original: gzhan la ma yin zhes pa ni dge 'dun las gzhan pa ste gsum man chad kyi gang zag la ma snyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ma yin zhes pa ni dge 'dun las gzhan pa ste gsum man chad kyi gang zag la ma snyod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to others means not to those who are not part of the saṅgha, that is, not to individuals who are not part of a group of three or more.

original: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes pa ni bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa 'dus pa rnams la 'di ma zer cig pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par ma rdzogs zhes pa ni bsnyen bar ma rdzogs pa 'dus pa rnams la 'di ma zer cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase not to those who have not completed the approach means not to those who have not completed the approach of going for refuge.

original: bskang bar mi 'os pa la yang zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang par mi 'os pa rnams la yang ma zer cig pa'o //🔽lhag ma ma lus zhes pa ni phas pham pa byung ba'o //
analyzed: bskang bar mi 'os pa la yang zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang par mi 'os pa rnams la yang ma zer cig pa'o //🔽lhag ma ma lus zhes pa ni phas pham pa byung ba'o //
translated: The phrase not to those who are not suitable to restore means not to those who are not suitable to restore the vows in the saṅgha.🔽 The phrase not to those who have not completely relinquished means not to those who have committed a defeating offense.

original: ces dge ba dang ces phal cher byed na bskos pa phyung la bsgo zhes pa ni sngar gang zag gi las su bskos pa bas zho sha che ba gzhan yod na snga ma phyung la gzhan skos shig pa'o //
analyzed: ces dge ba dang ces phal cher byed na bskos pa phyung la bsgo zhes pa ni sngar gang zag gi las su bskos pa bas zho sha che ba gzhan yod na snga ma phyung la gzhan skos shig pa'o //
translated: If one says “virtue” and “most” in the above, then “remove the appointment and order another” means that if there is another person who is more capable than the one appointed, remove the former and appoint the latter.

original: dus dang gtan pa dang gzhan rnams des par mi bya zhes pa ni gang zag gis las su bskos pa la yang yun 'di srid kyi bar du gyis shig ce'am las 'di las byung nas kyang yang bsgo'i zhe'am las kyi rnam grangs du ma bsdus te de'i las
analyzed: dus dang gtan pa dang gzhan rnams des par mi bya zhes pa ni gang zag gis las su bskos pa la yang yun 'di srid kyi bar du gyis shig ce'am las 'di las byung nas kyang yang bsgo'i zhe'am las kyi rnam grangs du ma bsdus te de'i las
translated: “ Do not definitely assign time, a fixed number, or another” means that even if a person is appointed to a task, do not definitely assign, “Do it for this length of time” or “After you finish this task, do it again” or “Gather many types of tasks and do them.”

original: shig ces nges pa'am chad par ma bsko shig pa'o //
analyzed: shig ces nges pa'am chad par ma bsko shig pa'o //
translated: “ Do not definitely assign” means do not definitely assign or order, “Do this.”

original: gzhan du ni dga' la ji dga' ba sbyin zhes pa ni las su bskos pa de nyid 'gel 'dod na ni gong ma ltar bskos kyang bla'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ni dga' la ji dga' ba sbyin zhes pa ni las su bskos pa de nyid 'gel 'dod na ni gong ma ltar bskos kyang bla'o //
translated: “ Otherwise, give it to whomever you like” means that if you wish to assign the appointed task to someone else, it is also acceptable to appoint someone else as above.

original: bskos pa med na tshul shing brim pas bsgo zhes pa ni mal stan la sogs pa 'god par bskos pa'i mi med na mdung gis gos shig pa'o //🔽gang bskang bar mi 'os pas ni tshul shing brim pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar mi 'os pa ni tshul shing 'brim du'ang ma gzhug shig pa'o //
analyzed: bskos pa med na tshul shing brim pas bsgo zhes pa ni mal stan la sogs pa 'god par bskos pa'i mi med na mdung gis gos shig pa'o // gang bskang bar mi 'os pas ni tshul shing brim pa yang ngo zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang bar mi 'os pa ni tshul shing 'brim du'ang ma gzhug shig pa'o //
translated: If there is no one appointed, it is said that the voting sticks should be distributed. This means that if there is no one appointed to arrange the bedding and so forth, they should be distributed by lot.🔽It is said that those who are not suitable to be appointed should not distribute the voting sticks. This means that those who are not suitable to be appointed by the Saṅgha should not be allowed to distribute the voting sticks.

original: gang mi 'os pas tshul shing brim pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen du mi skye zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang par mi 'os pa tshul shing brims te dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas kyang dbyen du mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi 'os pas tshul shing brim pa ni dge 'dun gyi dbyen du mi skye zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi kha bskang par mi 'os pa tshul shing brims te dge 'dun gyi dbyen byas kyang dbyen du mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is said that the distribution of voting sticks by those who are not suitable does not create a schism in the Saṅgha. This means that even if those who are not suitable to be appointed by the Saṅgha distribute the voting sticks and create a schism in the Saṅgha, it is not a schism.

original: las kyi dngos po'o /
analyzed: las kyi dngos po'o /
translated: This is the main part of the rite.

original: // / las kyi dngos po de ltar bstan nas las rgyas par 'byed pa ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / las kyi dngos po de ltar bstan nas las rgyas par 'byed pa ston pa ni /
translated: Having thus presented the main part of the rite, it is taught that the rite should be extensively analyzed.

original: zhu ba lhag kyang ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa dang / ma tshang ba ni ma byas pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te zhu ba'i tshig lhag pa ni las su mi rung bar da kyi ma tshad na mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: zhu ba lhag kyang ma byas pa ma yin zhes pa dang / ma tshang ba ni ma byas pa'o zhes pa la sogs pa yin te zhu ba'i tshig lhag pa ni las su mi rung bar da kyi ma tshad na mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: The petition is not incomplete, but if the assembly is incomplete, it is not suitable.

original: byed pa na song ba ni ma rdzogs pas 'khrugs pa'o zhes @228a * //
analyzed: byed pa na song ba ni ma rdzogs pas 'khrugs pa'o zhes @228a * //
translated: When performing the rite, if one has gone but not completed it, it is disturbed.

original: pa ni dang po gsol ba'i las byed pa'i tshe dge slong kha cig gral nas langs te dong na las kyi tshig ma rdzogs par dong ba'i phyir las 'khrugs te las su mi rung bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: pa ni dang po gsol ba'i las byed pa'i tshe dge slong kha cig gral nas langs te dong na las kyi tshig ma rdzogs par dong ba'i phyir las 'khrugs te las su mi rung bar ston pa'o //
translated: When first performing the rite of petition, if some monks rise from their seats and leave, because the words of the rite are not completed, the rite is disturbed and is not suitable.🔽Even if complete, if the assembly of the rite has not gathered, it is disturbed.

original: tshang yang las de'i dge 'dun snyed du ma lus par langs na'o zhes pa dang / lus na ma yin zhes pa ni gal te las kyi tshig rdzogs nas dong na yang phyi na las de'i dge 'dun du dgos pa snyed du ma lus na 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: tshang yang las de'i dge 'dun snyed du ma lus par langs na'o zhes pa dang / lus na ma yin zhes pa ni gal te las kyi tshig rdzogs nas dong na yang phyi na las de'i dge 'dun du dgos pa snyed du ma lus na 'khrugs par 'gyur ba dang /
translated: If the words of the rite are completed and they leave, but later the assembly of the rite has not gathered to the required extent, it is disturbed.

original: kha cig dong du zin kyang phyi na grangs de snyed yod na ni 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: kha cig dong du zin kyang phyi na grangs de snyed yod na ni 'khrugs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Some say: Even if one is seized by a pit, if there are that many outside, there is no disturbance.🔽If one wishes to be released, the venerable ones should request it.🔽The words of disturbance are to be announced to the Saṅgha and requested. As above, if one who has been disturbed through doubt wishes to be released, one should also be released.

original: slos par 'dod na btsun pa dag kyang gsol bar bgyi'o zhes 'khrugs pa'i tshig dge 'dun la bsnyad cing gsol bar bya ba zhes pa ni gong ma ltar gyur tam the tshom zos te 'khrugs pa slar slos par 'dod na yang bslas par bgyi'o zhes tshig mi smos
analyzed: slos par 'dod na btsun pa dag kyang gsol bar bgyi'o zhes 'khrugs pa'i tshig dge 'dun la bsnyad cing gsol bar bya ba zhes pa ni gong ma ltar gyur tam the tshom zos te 'khrugs pa slar slos par 'dod na yang bslas par bgyi'o zhes tshig mi smos
translated: One should not say the words

original: su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: su mi rung ba'o //
translated: It is not suitable for anyone.

original: zhu ba'i tshig gsum gyis bsgrub pa'i las gang gang yin pa rnams bsdus te ston pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir bsgo ba mi snang bar bya de'i rang bzhin tshol ba bslab pa 'dum pa dang de'i gso sbyin mu stegs pa gzhag pa lhag ma'i chad pa mgu ba
analyzed: zhu ba'i tshig gsum gyis bsgrub pa'i las gang gang yin pa rnams bsdus te ston pa ni bzlog pa'i phyir bsgo ba mi snang bar bya de'i rang bzhin tshol ba bslab pa 'dum pa dang de'i gso sbyin mu stegs pa gzhag pa lhag ma'i chad pa mgu ba
translated: The words of request gather and show the actions of establishment by the three words. The command for the sake of reversal is to make it invisible. The search for its nature is the reconciliation of training. The poṣadha of that is the placement of tīrthikas. The remainder punishment is satisfaction.

original: brgyad pa dang de'i rang bzhin tshol ba ni nyes pa gang byas pa gsal por mi smra na de'i rang bzhin tshol du gzhug ste dgu pa dang bslab pa shes pa'i bslab pa dbog pa ste bcu pa dang 'dum pa'i gso sbyin zhes pa ni dge 'dun bye🔽ba las slar du ma'i gso sbyin bya ba ste /
analyzed: brgyad pa dang de'i rang bzhin tshol ba ni nyes pa gang byas pa gsal por mi smra na de'i rang bzhin tshol du gzhug ste dgu pa dang bslab pa shes pa'i bslab pa dbog pa ste bcu pa dang 'dum pa'i gso sbyin zhes pa ni dge 'dun bye ba las slar du ma'i gso sbyin bya ba ste /
translated: The eighth is the search for the nature of the offense, which is to search for the nature of the offense if the monk does not clearly admit the offense. The ninth is the bestowal of training to those who know the training. The tenth is the poṣadha of reconciliation, which is the poṣadha of reconciliation for those who have caused a schism in the saṅgha.

original: bcu gcig pa dang mu stegs pa bzhag ces pa ni zla ba bzhi'i bar du brtag cing bzhag pa ste bcu gnyis pa dang / lhag ma'i chad pa dang mgu ba gnyis te bcu bzhi pa dang / rtsa ba dang @228b bskyar ba zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i chad pa gnyis dang rtsa ba'i mgu pa dang bskyar ba'i mgu ba gnyis te bco brgyad dang /
analyzed: bcu gcig pa dang mu stegs pa bzhag ces pa ni zla ba bzhi'i bar du brtag cing bzhag pa ste bcu gnyis pa dang / lhag ma'i chad pa dang mgu ba gnyis te bcu bzhi pa dang / rtsa ba dang @228b bskyar ba zhes pa ni rtsa ba'i chad pa gnyis dang rtsa ba'i mgu pa dang bskyar ba'i mgu ba gnyis te bco brgyad dang /
translated: The eleventh is the placement of tīrthikas, which is to examine and place them for four months. The twelfth is the two, the punishment for the remainder and the satisfaction of the remainder. The thirteenth is the two, the root punishment and the repeated punishment. The fourteenth is the two, the root satisfaction and the repeated satisfaction. The fifteenth is the two, the root punishment and the root satisfaction. original: 'dod pa sdang ba gti mug 'jigs par 'gro ba rnams med cing byas pa dang ma byas pa dran pa dang nus pa spro bar byas pa la bsko zhes pa ni khang skyong la sogs pa las su bsko'o cog 'dzin zham med cing ngo zlog phod pa dang

translated: Those who are without desire, anger, ignorance, fear, who remember what was done and what was not done, and who are capable and enthusiastic, should be appointed.

original: bya'am mi bya ba'i dmigs phyed cing nus pa skos shig pa'o //
analyzed: bya'am mi bya ba'i dmigs phyed cing nus pa skos shig pa'o //
translated: Those who are without attendants, who are not deceitful, who are capable of distinguishing what should and should not be done, and who are capable, should be appointed.🔽After it is done, it should be announced.

original: byas zin nas brjod ces pa ni gsol ba ma gtogs pa'i gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byas zin nas 'jug tu dge 'dun la bsnyad pa'ang gyis shig pa ste /

translated: After the karma of requesting once, requesting twice, and the karma of requesting four times is done, it should be announced to the saṅgha.

original: dngos su dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba rung ba'i gnas su khang ba rtsig pa dge 'dun gyi snang ba byin pa gang gi phyir bzod cing mi gsung bas na de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dngos su dge slong ming 'di zhes bya ba rung ba'i gnas su khang ba rtsig pa dge 'dun gyi snang ba byin pa gang gi phyir bzod cing mi gsung bas na de de bzhin du 'dzin to zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In actuality, it is like this: The saṅgha has given permission for the monk named so-and-so to build a hut in a suitable place. Since there is no objection, it is to be taken as agreed.

original: mtshams gcod pa na yang bcad bzhin du bsgrub ces pa ni mtshams bcad pa'i nang du mi 'dug pa'i dge 'dun las su mi rung ba bzhin du mtshams chod pa ni mi 'dug pa yang las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams gcod pa na yang bcad bzhin du bsgrub ces pa ni mtshams bcad pa'i nang du mi 'dug pa'i dge 'dun las su mi rung ba bzhin du mtshams chod pa ni mi 'dug pa yang las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Also, when the boundary is being established, while being established, it should be accomplished means that the Saṅgha who is not included in the establishment of the boundary, like one who is not fit to be a worker, is also not fit to establish the boundary.

original: 'du bar byed pas 'du ba rnams la spran pa ni gand'i brdung ba dang dri ba'i lan glon gnyis so zhes pa ni dge 'dun bsdu bar gand'i brdung zhing dge 'dun bsdu ba 'dri ba rnams kyi lan glon pa gnyis gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'du bar byed pas 'du ba rnams la spran pa ni gand'i brdung ba dang dri ba'i lan glon gnyis so zhes pa ni dge 'dun bsdu bar gand'i brdung zhing dge 'dun bsdu ba 'dri ba rnams kyi lan glon pa gnyis gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The one who assembles should inform the assembled ones of the two: striking the ghaṇṭā and answering the questions, means that the one who assembles the Saṅgha should strike the ghaṇṭā and answer the two questions of assembling the Saṅgha.

original: des de'i phyir stan gding zhes pa ni dge 'dun sdud mar byed pa de stan gding ba la sogs pa'i las kyang gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: des de'i phyir stan gding zhes pa ni dge 'dun sdud mar byed pa de stan gding ba la sogs pa'i las kyang gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, he should prepare the seat means that the one who assembles the Saṅgha should also perform the actions of preparing the seat and so on.

original: de'i phyir bskos pas kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni mal cha 'god par bskos pa cho ga gi dge 'dun bsdu dgos na gand'i brdung ba la sogs pa stan gding byang chad de'i las gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bskos pas kyang de bzhin zhes pa ni mal cha 'god par bskos pa cho ga gi dge 'dun bsdu dgos na gand'i brdung ba la sogs pa stan gding byang chad de'i las gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Therefore, “even if appointed” means that if the one appointed to arrange the bedding must gather the Saṅgha for the rite, he should do the act of striking the gandi, etc.

original: thams cad du rgan rims so zhes pa ni lam du zhugs nas nar bde ba bstabs pa yan chad ci bya'o cog rgan rims sha dag tu gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad du rgan rims so zhes pa ni lam du zhugs nas nar bde ba bstabs pa yan chad ci bya'o cog rgan rims sha dag tu gyis shig pa'o //
translated: “Always according to seniority” means that whatever is to be done, from setting out on the road to offering the best seat, should be done according to seniority.

original: lan pa ni bstabs pa mchog ces pa ni mal stan nod pa na yang gdams pa la sogs pa nod cing len pa'i tshe na rgan rims kyis gang gang blangs pa de brtsan par ston pa'o //🔽las rgyas par @231a * //
analyzed: lan pa ni bstabs pa mchog ces pa ni mal stan nod pa na yang gdams pa la sogs pa nod cing len pa'i tshe na rgan rims kyis gang gang blangs pa de brtsan par ston pa'o //🔽las rgyas par @231a * //
translated: “The best is what is offered” means that when receiving and taking instructions, etc. when receiving bedding, it shows that what is taken by the senior should be respected.

original: smra ba'o // de dang mi 'dra ba rnams zhus pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni bsgo ba las 'byung ba slar ma bcos par las myong bar mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa la sogs pa bsgo ba
analyzed: smra ba'o // de dang mi 'dra ba rnams zhus pa la sogs pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni bsgo ba las 'byung ba slar ma bcos par las myong bar mi bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa la sogs pa bsgo ba
translated: The summary of the questions and so on that are not like that is the instruction that arises from the command, which is not to experience the karma without correcting it and so on, which is the fault that arises from the command of schism, following and so on.

original: las byung ba'i nyes pa rnams slar gnyen po ma bsten cing bcos pa ma byas kyi bar dge 'dun gyi las myong bar ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: las byung ba'i nyes pa rnams slar gnyen po ma bsten cing bcos pa ma byas kyi bar dge 'dun gyi las myong bar ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The faults that arise from the command should not be experienced by the saṅgha until one has relied on the antidotes and corrected them.

original: gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba ma gtogs zhes pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir gso sbyin bya pa dang / chos rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshul nas 'byung ba ni bsgo ba las byung ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis bya dgos pa'i phyir ming gis smos pa 'di gnyis myong bar mi bya bam gtogs so //
analyzed: gso sbyin dang tshul nas 'byung ba ma gtogs zhes pa ni tshul khrims rnam par dag pa'i phyir gso sbyin bya pa dang / chos rnam par dag pa'i phyir tshul nas 'byung ba ni bsgo ba las byung ba'i nyes pa dang ldan pa de dag gis bya dgos pa'i phyir ming gis smos pa 'di gnyis myong bar mi bya bam gtogs so //
translated: Except for the poṣadha and pravāraṇa, the poṣadha is performed for the sake of pure morality and the pravāraṇa is performed for the sake of pure Dharma, because those who possess the faults that arise from the command must perform these two. Therefore, these two that are mentioned by name are not to be experienced.

original: mtshams gud na 'dug pa gang gi yan lag kyang ma yin zhes pa ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa lta bu mtshams logs shig na 'dug pa ni rung ba dang mi rung ba la sogs pa gang gi yan lag tu 'ang ma gtogs par ston pa'o //🔽lhan cig tu gtogs phar der song na 'jig ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi las su bya'o cog mtshams tha mi dad cing lhan cig tu bya ba ma yin pa las dad pa blangs nas nam mkha' la 'phags pa lta bu la sogs pa mtshams gzhan du song
analyzed: mtshams gud na 'dug pa gang gi yan lag kyang ma yin zhes pa ni nam mkha' la 'dug pa lta bu mtshams logs shig na 'dug pa ni rung ba dang mi rung ba la sogs pa gang gi yan lag tu 'ang ma gtogs par ston pa'o // lhan cig tu gtogs phar der song na 'jig ces pa ni dge 'dun gyi las su bya'o cog mtshams tha mi dad cing lhan cig tu bya ba ma yin pa las dad pa blangs nas nam mkha' la 'phags pa lta bu la sogs pa mtshams gzhan du song
translated: The phrase it is not a part of any other means that it is not like something in space, for it is not included as a part of anything, whether proper or improper.

original: na dad pa la sogs pa de dag 'jig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: na dad pa la sogs pa de dag 'jig par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase if one goes there, the community is destroyed means that all the actions of the community are to be done within the same boundary, without distinction. If one accepts the faith and then goes to another boundary, as if flying up into the sky, then that faith and so forth is destroyed.

original: gcig tu rkang pa ya gcig na gnyis ka 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni mtshams kyis so rkang pa g-yas g-yon gyis mnan na mtshams de gnyis kar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu rkang pa ya gcig na gnyis ka 'dug pa'o zhes pa ni mtshams kyis so rkang pa g-yas g-yon gyis mnan na mtshams de gnyis kar gtogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase if one is in one place, with one foot in each means that if one places one's right and left feet in two different boundaries, one is in both.

original: mnan pa la 'dug par thams cad du mnan pa'o zhes pa ni mtshams du ma'i so shing ngam re lde la sogs pas mnan te mtshams gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas na mtshams de kun du'ang gtogs par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mnan pa la 'dug par thams cad du mnan pa'o zhes pa ni mtshams du ma'i so shing ngam re lde la sogs pas mnan te mtshams gcod pa la sogs pa'i las byas na mtshams de kun du'ang gtogs par ston pa'o //
translated: The phrase in all places where one is staying in the section on subduing means that if one performs the rites of establishing the boundaries, such as the tooth-stick or the fence, in all the places where one is staying, then one is included in all those boundaries.

original: de lta bus tshul du mar zhugs pas skye zhes pa ni gong ma ltar byas te tshul du zhugs na'ang kha du mar tshul du zhugs par 'gyur ba'o //

original: mal stan du ma blang du'ang rung zhes pa dang / 'dis gar dga' bar gnas zhes pa ni de lta bus mal stan kha du ma nas nod du'ang rung ba dang / gnas kyang gar dga' dgur 'dug kyang rung ba'o //

translated: The phrase “do not restore it with an incomplete Saṅgha” means do not restore it with an incomplete Saṅgha.🔽The phrase “it does not arise through non-action” means that if the rite of the ceremony for full ordination and so on is not performed according to the rite, it is not suitable to be a rite.

analyzed: las mjug rdzogs par ma byas kyi bar du phal cher byas kyang byas zin pa ma yin pa dogs pa bstsal ba'i phyir phal cher byas pa'o zhes pa yin te las su bya ba la phal cher zin na mjug tu ma phyin kyang zin khongs su chug shig

translated: By means of the intention not to be born means that if a schism or a delay is created with the intention of being fit for action, whether or not one is fit for action, it is a serious offense.

analyzed: dge 'dun du ma langs na nyes byas zhes pa ni gcig gis gcig gam gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi'i dbyen dang bkar ba byas pa dang / de bzhin du gnyis kyis gcig gam gsum gyis dbyen dang bkar ba byas pa dang / gsum gyis gcig gam gnyis gsum gyi dbyen dang bkar ba byas na nyes byas su 'gyur ba'o // tha dad du gnas pa las gzhan bskang bar mi 'os pa 'dus te gsol ba dang zhu ba byas kyang ma yin zhes pa ni du mar gnas pas nyid kyis 'khor gyi gsol ba dang zhu ba bya ba ma gtogs pa zhig la sogs pa gzhan gyis gsol
translated: This means that if one person creates a schism and a proclamation of schism with one, two, three, or four others, or if two people create a schism and a proclamation of schism with one, or if three people create a schism and a proclamation of schism with one, two, or three others, it is a wrong action.🔽If they are not suitable to be reconciled except by remaining separate, even if they request and petition, it is not.

original: ba dang zhu ba'i las byas kyang las su mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: ba dang zhu ba'i las byas kyang las su mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: This means that except for a group of many who remain separate themselves requesting and petitioning, if others perform the rite of requesting and petitioning for one who is not suitable to be reconciled, the rite is not a rite.

original: rigs pa nyid dge 'dun gyis kyang myong bar ma grub pa ma yin zhes pa ni bskang bar 'os pa rnams nyid kyi 'khor du las byed pa'i tshe na yang gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis las myong bar ma gyur na las su mi rung ba'o
analyzed: rigs pa nyid dge 'dun gyis kyang myong bar ma grub pa ma yin zhes pa ni bskang bar 'os pa rnams nyid kyi 'khor du las byed pa'i tshe na yang gnyid log pa la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis las myong bar ma gyur na las su mi rung ba'o
translated: When those who are worthy of being restored are in the assembly of the Saṅgha, if they do not experience the rite due to conditions such as sleeping, the rite is not valid.

original: // 'di'ang gsol ba thos na grub pa'o zhes pa ni des kyang gsol ba ni thos la gzhan ma thos na ni las su rung ba'o //
analyzed: // 'di'ang gsol ba thos na grub pa'o zhes pa ni des kyang gsol ba ni thos la gzhan ma thos na ni las su rung ba'o //
translated: If they hear the request, it is established. If they hear the request but do not hear the other parts, the rite is valid.🔽It is not the case that there is no ordination by a messenger who is like a fortunate one.

original: skal ba can 'dra ba'i pho nyas rab tu 'byin pa ni cho ga ma yin pa ma yin zhes pa ni bden pa mthong bar 'gyur ba la sogs pa'i skal ba yod pa ni bdag dang 'dra ba'i pho nyas gsol zhing skyabs su 'gyur ba la sogs pa
