translated: If one requests ordination from a messenger who is like oneself, who has the fortune to see the truths, and so on, and becomes a refuge, and so on,

original: byas te rab tu 'byin na yang mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: byas te rab tu 'byin na yang mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: there is no problem with the rite.

original: gzhan yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa man chad do zhes pa ni skal ba can de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i tshe pho nyas bsgrub par ma zad kyi bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yan chad gong ma bzhin du pho nyas bsgrub bo //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsnyen par rdzogs pa man chad do zhes pa ni skal ba can de lta bu rab tu byung ba'i tshe pho nyas bsgrub par ma zad kyi bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa yan chad gong ma bzhin du pho nyas bsgrub bo //
translated: Moreover, the statement “at least up to full ordination” means that not only is one who is so fortunate to be established by messenger when going forth, but also one who is not fully ordained is established by messenger as above.🔽If one does not agree, it is not conferred.

original: mi mthun na phog pa ma yin zhes pa dang / 'dir gsol ba'ang 'jig ces pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa la bslab pa dbog pa la sogs pa khyod de nyid len du ma btub na las su mi rung zhing dang po kho na nyid kyis gsol ba yang mi brtsan te 'jig par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mi mthun na phog pa ma yin zhes pa dang / 'dir gsol ba'ang 'jig ces pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa la bslab pa dbog pa la sogs pa khyod de nyid len du ma btub na las su mi rung zhing dang po kho na nyid kyis gsol ba yang mi brtsan te 'jig par ston pa'o //
translated: And here, the request is also destroyed means that if one who wishes to go forth is not allowed to take the vows of full ordination and so on, then the rite is not suitable.🔽The rite of reconciliation is the procedure means that the procedure of reconciliation must be performed first for those who have engaged in schism and so on.

original: bzhams pas bsgo ba ni cho ga'o zhes pa ni dbyen la zhugs pa la sogs pa thog ma nyid du bzhams shing bsgo ba ba'i cho ga je bya dgos pas na bzham pa'i cho ga sngar ma byas par gsol ba la sogs pa'i las byas kyang las su🔽mi rung ba'o //

translated: If the rite of reconciliation is not performed first, then the rite of full ordination and so on is not suitable.

original: bkar ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni dge slong bkar ba'i las bya ba yang @232b sngar bzhams pa'i cho ga ma byas par bkar ba'i las de byas na las su mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: bkar ba'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni dge slong bkar ba'i las bya ba yang @232b sngar bzhams pa'i cho ga ma byas par bkar ba'i las de byas na las su mi rung ba'o //
translated: Also, it is the same for the announcement means that if the announcement of a monk is done without first performing the ritual of reconciliation, that announcement is not a proper action.

original: pha rol gyi mnyan pa ni dgongs shig ces pa la sogs pa gtso bo zhes pa ni dge 'dun nam gang zag pha rol po nyan na ni dgongs shig ces pa la sogs pa ma byas su zin na mi rung ba med pa'o //🔽don gyis tshig rims las 'gal yang mi skye ba ma yin zhes pa ni las su bya ba'i tshig rna go rims bzhin du ma byas te /
analyzed: pha rol gyi mnyan pa ni dgongs shig ces pa la sogs pa gtso bo zhes pa ni dge 'dun nam gang zag pha rol po nyan na ni dgongs shig ces pa la sogs pa ma byas su zin na mi rung ba med pa'o // don gyis tshig rims las 'gal yang mi skye ba ma yin zhes pa ni las su bya ba'i tshig rna go rims bzhin du ma byas te /
translated: If the other listens, it is said, Pay attention, and so on. The principal one is the Saṅgha or the other person. If they listen, it is said, Pay attention, and so on. If they do not listen, there is no fault.

original: btsun pa gson cig btsun pa'i dge 'dun ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun las bsnyen par rdzogs par gsol lo zhes pa las dge 'dun btsun pa gson cig / dge 'dun las ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bsnyen par rdzogs par gsol lo zhes go rims bsnor te
analyzed: btsun pa gson cig btsun pa'i dge 'dun ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dge 'dun las bsnyen par rdzogs par gsol lo zhes pa las dge 'dun btsun pa gson cig / dge 'dun las ming 'di zhes bgyi ba bsnyen par rdzogs par gsol lo zhes go rims bsnor te
translated: Even if the meaning contradicts the sequence of words, it is not unarisen. The words to be acted upon are not done in the proper sequence, such as Venerable, listen! Venerable so-and-so requests full ordination from the Saṅgha. Instead, it is done in the reverse sequence, such as Venerable Saṅgha, listen! So-and-so requests full ordination from the Saṅgha.🔽If the Saṅgha is ready, I ask the Saṅgha to grant full ordination to so-and-so.

original: byas su zin kyang las su mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: byas su zin kyang las su mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: Even if done, there is no invalidity.

original: 'gal bar mi bya zhes pa ni gong ma ltar las su mi rung ba med du zin kyang bsnor bar ni ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'gal bar mi bya zhes pa ni gong ma ltar las su mi rung ba med du zin kyang bsnor bar ni ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not do it in conflict means that even if there is no invalidity as above, do not do it in a way that is contrary to the rite.

original: mtshan tha dad pa brten pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni pho mo'i mtshan so sor brjod pa bsnor na yang las su mi rung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan tha dad pa brten pa yang ma yin zhes pa ni pho mo'i mtshan so sor brjod pa bsnor na yang las su mi rung ba med pa'o //
translated: Also do not rely on different genders means that even if you switch the genders of the words for male and female, there is no invalidity.

original: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i las las gzhan pa byas na yang yin zhes pa ni dge slong pha bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho gas byas pa lta bus cho ga go bsnor te byas na yang las su mi rung ba
analyzed: dge slong dang dge slong ma'i las las gzhan pa byas na yang yin zhes pa ni dge slong pha bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i cho gas byas pa lta bus cho ga go bsnor te byas na yang las su mi rung ba
translated: If you do it other than the rite of a fully ordained monk or nun, it is also means that if you do it by switching the rite, such as a fully ordained monk doing the rite of full ordination for a fully ordained nun, there is no invalidity.

original: med pa'o // las kyi dngos por zhus par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: med pa'o // las kyi dngos por zhus par gtogs pa'o //
translated: It is included in the request for the substance of the rite.

original: las kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
analyzed: las kyi dngos po rdzogs so /
translated: The substance of the rite is complete.

original: // / slar bcos pa'i dngos po ston pa ni /
analyzed: // / slar bcos pa'i dngos po ston pa ni /
translated: The presentation of the substance of amendment is:

original: ma zhi ba'i dngos po shes gleng ba bas brgal /
analyzed: ma zhi ba'i dngos po shes gleng ba bas brgal /
translated: The substance of non-pacification is to be known.

original: mngon sum du gtugs nas chad pa'i las bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa zhes pa'i dmigs yod par mngon gleng ba bas kyang brgal /
analyzed: mngon sum du gtugs nas chad pa'i las bya zhes pa la sogs pa yin te 'thab krol byed pa la sogs pa zhes pa'i dmigs yod par mngon gleng ba bas kyang brgal /
translated: The phrase having confronted them directly, one should mete out the punishment and so on refers to engaging in disputes and so on.🔽🔽

original: dge 'dun gyi nang du bkug cing mngon sum du thug nas chad pa bcad pa'i las gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi nang du bkug cing mngon sum du thug nas chad pa bcad pa'i las gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase having brought him into the midst of the community, one should impose the penalty and so on means that one should impose the penalty after having brought him into the midst of the community and having confronted him with the accusation.🔽If he does not come, one should impose the penalty on the basis of his reputation alone.

original: 'dur mi thub na grags pa tsam gyis so zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi nang du dgug cing mngon sum du byar ma thub na nyas pa'i g-yong mtshang yod par grags pa dang sbyar te chad pas chod cig pa'o //🔽ma mthong bar bsnyon pa ni yod pa btsugs pas na khas blangs pa yan lag ma yin zhes pa ni nyes pa khas len du ma btub ste /
analyzed: 'dur mi thub na grags pa tsam gyis so zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyi nang du dgug cing mngon sum du byar ma thub na nyas pa'i g-yong mtshang yod par grags pa dang sbyar te chad pas chod cig pa'o // ma mthong bar bsnyon pa ni yod pa btsugs pas na khas blangs pa yan lag ma yin zhes pa ni nyes pa khas len du ma btub ste /
translated: If one cannot bring him into the midst of the community and confront him, one should impose the penalty on the basis of his reputation for having committed the offense.🔽If he does not admit it, saying I did not see it, one should impose the penalty on the basis of his refusal to admit what is not a part of the rules.

original: bsnyon pa'i sran tshugs na mtshang bcad pa'i phyir @233a * //
analyzed: bsnyon pa'i sran tshugs na mtshang bcad pa'i phyir @233a * //
translated: If he does not admit the offense, he should be pressed to admit the accusation.

original: chad pas bcad pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: chad pas bcad pa nyid yin te /
translated: If he does not admit it, he should be punished.

original: chad pas mi bcad pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chad pas mi bcad pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not a part of the rules that he should not be punished.

original: skabs ma phye na yang mi rung zhes pa ni gleng ba'i skabs 'byed du mi btub pa'i sran btsugs pas kyang mi glon te /
analyzed: skabs ma phye na yang mi rung zhes pa ni gleng ba'i skabs 'byed du mi btub pa'i sran btsugs pas kyang mi glon te /
translated: It is not proper to say, I will not give an opportunity to speak, and then not to give an opportunity to speak because one is stubborn.

original: de yang yan lag ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: de yang yan lag ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: This also shows that it is not a part of the debate.

original: gleng ba nyid kyis ma rgal na rgol ba ma bskos zhes pa ni rgol ba'i ngos ngan byed pa nyid ma byung na rgol ba gcig ched du skos shig pa'o //🔽gshe khro bsdigs pa dang dge 'dun la rnyed pa dang gnas kyi gzhi brjes byed pa dang / rgyal po zhal che ba gnyen /
analyzed: gleng ba nyid kyis ma rgal na rgol ba ma bskos zhes pa ni rgol ba'i ngos ngan byed pa nyid ma byung na rgol ba gcig ched du skos shig pa'o // gshe khro bsdigs pa dang dge 'dun la rnyed pa dang gnas kyi gzhi brjes byed pa dang / rgyal po zhal che ba gnyen /
translated: If one does not cross over by debating, it is said, Do not appoint a debater, meaning that if the bad side of the debate does not occur, one should not appoint a debater.🔽It is not proper to scold, be angry, threaten, or to change the basis of the acquisition and the basis of the dwelling of the Saṅgha, or to appoint a king as the chief judge,

original: gang zag rgyab rten 'char ba dang / dge 'dun la mi 'char ba rnams kyi nang na 'dus mi byed pa dang / khyim pa dang mu stegs pa'i rgyal mtshan 'chang ba mu stegs la /
analyzed: gang zag rgyab rten 'char ba dang / dge 'dun la mi 'char ba rnams kyi nang na 'dus mi byed pa dang / khyim pa dang mu stegs pa'i rgyal mtshan 'chang ba mu stegs la /
translated: or to appoint a person who is not a member of the Saṅgha, or to appoint a householder or a tīrthika who holds the banner of a tīrthika,

original: brten pa mi rigs pa spyod pa dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob pa rnams mi brjed la sro shing /
analyzed: brten pa mi rigs pa spyod pa dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob pa rnams mi brjed la sro shing /
translated: or to appoint a bhikṣu who does not train in the training of a bhikṣu and engages in improper conduct.

original: dge 'dun la spu snyol gnong bkur ging gong byed /
analyzed: dge 'dun la spu snyol gnong bkur ging gong byed /
translated: If you insult the Saṅgha, you should be purified by shaving your head and wearing the robes.🔽If you supplicate a sign, you should be purified by being celibate.

original: mtshan ma gsol ba 'debs na tshangs par bya zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnam pa 'di rnams ltar gyur na gdod dge 'dun gyi nyes pa bar gnang zhing tshangs par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma gsol ba 'debs na tshangs par bya zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnam pa 'di rnams ltar gyur na gdod dge 'dun gyi nyes pa bar gnang zhing tshangs par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This refers to those mentioned by name. If you act in these ways, you should be purified by the Saṅgha’s permission and by being celibate.

original: de la gshe khro bsdigs zhes pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba la 'di dag ltar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la gshe khro bsdigs zhes pa ni khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba la 'di dag ltar byed pa'o //
translated: “Scolding, anger, and threats” refers to acting in this way toward householders and those gone forth.

original: dge 'dun la rnyed pa dang gnas kyi zhe brdegs byed ces pa ni dge 'dun nyi tsher yang ma zad de gang zag yan chad la rnyed pa dang / gnas kyi zhe brdegs mi byed na tshangs par bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la rnyed pa dang gnas kyi zhe brdegs byed ces pa ni dge 'dun nyi tsher yang ma zad de gang zag yan chad la rnyed pa dang / gnas kyi zhe brdegs mi byed na tshangs par bya'o //
translated: “If you strike the Saṅgha with the stick of gain and status” means that not only the Saṅgha, but also any individual should not be struck with the stick of gain and status. If you do not do this, you should be purified.

original: rgyal po zhes pa nas rgya brten 'cha' zhes pa'i bar du smos pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la rgyab rten mi 'cha' na tshangs par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po zhes pa nas rgya brten 'cha' zhes pa'i bar du smos pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams la rgyab rten mi 'cha' na tshangs par bya'o //
translated: “King” up to “support” refers to those mentioned by name. If you do not form a support with these, you should be purified.

original: de la gang zag ces pa ni khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba gang yang rung khyim pa'i mtshan ma ni rab tu ma byung ba'i cha lugs su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang zag ces pa ni khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba gang yang rung khyim pa'i mtshan ma ni rab tu ma byung ba'i cha lugs su byed pa'o //
translated: The person is either a householder or one gone forth. The householder's marks are the attire of one who has not gone forth.

original: mu stegs ba'i mtshan ma shes pa ni 'phral ba la so ris byed pa dang // rigs kyi g-yang gzhi la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs ba'i mtshan ma shes pa ni 'phral ba la so ris byed pa dang // rigs kyi g-yang gzhi la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
translated: The heretic's marks are the forehead mark, the carrying of a water pot, and so on.

original: mu stegs pa brten ces pa ni mu stegs la 'jar zhing gzhol ba'o //
analyzed: mu stegs pa brten ces pa ni mu stegs la 'jar zhing gzhol ba'o //
translated: The heretic's reliance is the inclination towards and devotion to the heretics.

original: mi rigs pa spyod ces pa ni spyad pa dang spyod lam bgags pa rnams spyod pa'o //
analyzed: mi rigs pa spyod ces pa ni spyad pa dang spyod lam bgags pa rnams spyod pa'o //
translated: The improper conduct is the conduct and behavior that is prohibited.

original: dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob ces pa ni srog gcod las log pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams mi slob pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gi bslab pa mi slob ces pa ni srog gcod las log pa la sogs pa'i dngos po rnams mi slob pa'o //
translated: The non-training in the monk's training is the non-training in the things such as turning away from killing and so on.

original: sro shing zhes pa ni skra yegs pa la sogs pa dmus byung ba'o //
analyzed: sro shing zhes pa ni skra yegs pa la sogs pa dmus byung ba'o //
translated: The shaven head is the baldness and so on.

original: dge 'dun la sbu snyol zhes pa ni snyems @233b shing bsdo ba dang bral te 'jar ba'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun la sbu snyol zhes pa ni snyems @233b shing bsdo ba dang bral te 'jar ba'o //
translated: The bowing to the Saṅgha is the bowing without pride and arrogance.

original: gnong bkur zhes pa nyes par tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gnong bkur zhes pa nyes par tshor ba'o //
translated: The respect is the feeling of guilt.

original: ging gong byed ces pa ni pho theg btang zhing gsags byed pa'o //
analyzed: ging gong byed ces pa ni pho theg btang zhing gsags byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who is a goner is one who has been expelled and is being collected.

original: mtshan las ldog ces pa ni gang gi phyir chod pa'i dmigs der 'dor zhing gtong ba'o //
analyzed: mtshan las ldog ces pa ni gang gi phyir chod pa'i dmigs der 'dor zhing gtong ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who has turned back is one who has been expelled and is being sent back to the place from which he was expelled.

original: gsol ba 'debs zhes pa ni dge 'dun la gsol ba 'debs na gdod tshangs par bya ba'i gsol ba mi 'debs na gong ma rnams ltar byed du zin kyang tshangs par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs zhes pa ni dge 'dun la gsol ba 'debs na gdod tshangs par bya ba'i gsol ba mi 'debs na gong ma rnams ltar byed du zin kyang tshangs par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one who requests means that if one requests the Saṅgha, one should not request purification. If one does not request, one should not do as the above.

original: gsol ba 'debs na las su bya ba gzhan yang ston pa ni las dbog pa //
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs na las su bya ba gzhan yang ston pa ni las dbog pa //
translated: If one requests, the text also teaches the other actions to be done: The action of the Saṅgha is to give leave.

original: 'byung ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhig pa bkan pa rnams kyang ngo zhes pa yin te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gsol ba 'debs na gdod las su gyis shig pa ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba bsnyen par rdzogs pa zhig pa bkan pa rnams kyang ngo zhes pa yin te ming gis smos pa 'di rnams gsol ba 'debs na gdod las su gyis shig pa ste /
translated: The phrase those who have been fully ordained by a schismatic Saṅgha means that if these named ones request, they should be given leave.

original: de la dbog ces pa ni khang pa dang gtsug lag khang brtsig tu gzhug pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la dbog ces pa ni khang pa dang gtsug lag khang brtsig tu gzhug pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The phrase to give leave means to have them build a house, a temple, and so on.

original: 'byung zhes pa ni lhag ma las dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung zhes pa ni lhag ma las dbyung ba'o //
translated: The phrase to give rise means to give rise from the remainder.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes pa ni dge slong gi sngom pa dbog pa'o//
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs zhes pa ni dge slong gi sngom pa dbog pa'o//
translated: The phrase “he is fully ordained” means that he is conferred the vows of a fully ordained monk.

original: gzhi zhes pa ni khyim du mi 'dong bar bslab pa bcas par de gtong ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi zhes pa ni khyim du mi 'dong bar bslab pa bcas par de gtong ba'o //
translated: The phrase “the basis” refers to the rule not to enter a house, and he is released from that.

original: bkan ces pa ni lhung bzed khas phub ste btang ba'o /
analyzed: bkan ces pa ni lhung bzed khas phub ste btang ba'o /
translated: The phrase “he is suspended” means that he is suspended by turning his alms bowl upside down.

original: chad pa bcad pa'i spyi'i tshul de ltar bstan nas /
analyzed: chad pa bcad pa'i spyi'i tshul de ltar bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the general way of imposing penalties,🔽the text now presents the individual categories of penalties that are imposed based on the specific nature of the offense.

original: nyes pa'i dmigs las chad pa'i rim pa so sor dbye ba dang ston pa ni 'thab krol byed pa las kyis spyo zhes bya ba yin te 'thab krol byed pa la ni rgya gag gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i dmigs las chad pa'i rim pa so sor dbye ba dang ston pa ni 'thab krol byed pa las kyis spyo zhes bya ba yin te 'thab krol byed pa la ni rgya gag gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one who quarrels is reprimanded” means that one who quarrels should be reprimanded.

original: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma gor mor byed cing mi 'chos nas med ces pa ni 'di ltar byed na sma dbab pa'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi lhag ma gor mor byed cing mi 'chos nas med ces pa ni 'di ltar byed na sma dbab pa'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one who commits a partial defeat of the saṅgha and does not amend it is expelled” means that if one acts in this way, one should be expelled by the penalty of demotion.

original: khyim sun 'byin pa ni bskrad ces pa ni 'di ltar byed na mdzes pa spang ba'i phyir gang na byed pa'i gnas de nas phyung la skrod cig pa'o //
analyzed: khyim sun 'byin pa ni bskrad ces pa ni 'di ltar byed na mdzes pa spang ba'i phyir gang na byed pa'i gnas de nas phyung la skrod cig pa'o //
translated: The phrase “one who causes householders to lose faith is expelled” means that if one acts in this way, in order to abandon what is improper, one should be expelled from the place where one is staying and expelled from the saṅgha.

original: de'i ched la 'dur mi btub cing skabs mi 'byed na yang ngo zhes pa dang de ma mthong bar sgrogs pa yang zhes pa ni skrod pa'i gcom tshor nas 'dur mi btub pa dang / gleng pa la skabs mi ster ba dang / snyon ngas pa rnams kyang bskrad pa'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: de'i ched la 'dur mi btub cing skabs mi 'byed na yang ngo zhes pa dang de ma mthong bar sgrogs pa yang zhes pa ni skrod pa'i gcom tshor nas 'dur mi btub pa dang / gleng pa la skabs mi ster ba dang / snyon ngas pa rnams kyang bskrad pa'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
translated: If he does not run away from the punishment of expulsion, if he does not make time for the accusation, and if he does not admit the accusation, then he should be expelled.🔽If he insults a layman, he should be expelled from the monastery.

original: khyim pa la 'phya na 'gong thod du dbyung zhes pa ni khyim pa la kha ma klas par zer na dge 'dun gyis 'gong thod du dbyung ba 'am nyes pa de gtong du chug shig pa'o //🔽'dir ni tshangs par bya ba'i las kyi gor de bzod par bya'o zhes pa ni skabs gzhan du tshangs @234a * //
analyzed: khyim pa la 'phya na 'gong thod du dbyung zhes pa ni khyim pa la kha ma klas par zer na dge 'dun gyis 'gong thod du dbyung ba 'am nyes pa de gtong du chug shig pa'o // 'dir ni tshangs par bya ba'i las kyi gor de bzod par bya'o zhes pa ni skabs gzhan du tshangs @234a * //
translated: If he speaks harshly to a layman, the Saṅgha should expel him from the monastery or make him give up that fault.🔽Here, he should be made to ask for forgiveness in the presence of the one who is to be purified.

original: par bya ba'i las 'di'i sgabs su khyim pa de la bzod par gsol du chug shig pa'o //
analyzed: par bya ba'i las 'di'i sgabs su khyim pa de la bzod par gsol du chug shig pa'o //
translated: In another context, he should be made to ask for forgiveness from that layman in the presence of the one who is to be purified.

original: bsdam pa'i gnyen por bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes par grags pa mi 'chos shing bsnyon ngas pa dang / gnyen po bsgrub tu mi btub pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba mi gtong ba rnams bkar zhes pa ni nyes par grags pa bsdam par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa gnyen pos mi 'chos par bsnyon ngas pa dang /
analyzed: bsdam pa'i gnyen por bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes par grags pa mi 'chos shing bsnyon ngas pa dang / gnyen po bsgrub tu mi btub pa dang / sdig pa'i lta ba mi gtong ba rnams bkar zhes pa ni nyes par grags pa bsdam par bya ba ma yin pa'i nyes pa gnyen pos mi 'chos par bsnyon ngas pa dang /
translated: The remedy for the fault of concealment is to confess the fault of not correcting the ill-fame of the unwholesome, to deny it, to not be able to practice the remedy, and to not give up the sinful view.🔽The word “confiscate” means that if one does not correct the ill-fame of the unwholesome by the remedy, denies it,

original: gnyen pos bcos su mi rung ba dang / sdig pa'i lta ba mi gtong na bkar ba'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
analyzed: gnyen pos bcos su mi rung ba dang / sdig pa'i lta ba mi gtong na bkar ba'i chad pas chod cig pa'o //
translated: is not able to correct it by the remedy, and does not give up the sinful view, then one should be punished by the penalty of confiscation.

original: nyes pa 'di'ang 'di nyid du gnyen po byas na ni dge 'dun 'di dag nyid kyis khyod la 'dra bar mdzad do zhes de la bsgo zhes pa ni bkar ba de la snyad 'di skad du bsgo shig pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa 'di'ang 'di nyid du gnyen po byas na ni dge 'dun 'di dag nyid kyis khyod la 'dra bar mdzad do zhes de la bsgo zhes pa ni bkar ba de la snyad 'di skad du bsgo shig pa'o //
translated: “If you remedy this fault in this very life, then these very Saṅgha members will act in a similar way toward you.” This is what should be said to him.

original: nyes pa mi bcab ces pa ni nyid kyi nyes pa sus kyang yong ye ma bcabs shig pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa mi bcab ces pa ni nyid kyi nyes pa sus kyang yong ye ma bcabs shig pa'o //
translated: “Do not conceal the fault” means that one should never conceal one’s own fault.

original: tha na ming yang bsgrags zhes pa ni nyes pa'i rigs yin par ma zhus na nyes pa'i ming tsam la yang gzhan la sgrogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: tha na ming yang bsgrags zhes pa ni nyes pa'i rigs yin par ma zhus na nyes pa'i ming tsam la yang gzhan la sgrogs shig pa'o //
translated: Even the name is proclaimed means that if one does not confess the type of offense, one should proclaim the mere name of the offense.

original: nyes byas ni ji ltar yang rung zhes pa ni nyes she'am kha na ma tho ba byas zhes bsgrags pa tsam gyis kyang nyes byas bsgrags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: nyes byas ni ji ltar yang rung zhes pa ni nyes she'am kha na ma tho ba byas zhes bsgrags pa tsam gyis kyang nyes byas bsgrags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: A misdeed is proclaimed by merely proclaiming that one has committed a fault or a sin.

original: su la bsgrags she na /
analyzed: su la bsgrags she na /
translated: To whom is it proclaimed?

original: rang bzhin du gnas pa la zhes pa yin te smos pa las ma yin gyi dge slong tha mal pa la smros shig pa'o //
analyzed: rang bzhin du gnas pa la zhes pa yin te smos pa las ma yin gyi dge slong tha mal pa la smros shig pa'o //
translated: To one who is naturally abiding means that it is proclaimed to an ordinary fully ordained monk, not to one who is not.

original: lta ba tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la yang bsgrags sam zhe na /
analyzed: lta ba tha dad pa'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la yang bsgrags sam zhe na /
translated: Is it proclaimed to one who is naturally abiding with a different view?

original: gzhan du mi lta ba la zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du mi lta ba la zhes pa yin te /
translated: To one who does not view others as different means

original: gzhan du mi lta ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la sgrogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du mi lta ba'i rang bzhin du gnas pa la sgrogs shig pa'o //
translated: that it is proclaimed to one who is naturally abiding who does not view others as different.

original: gzhan du mi lta ba'i dge tshul yan chad la yang bsgrags sam zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du mi lta ba'i dge tshul yan chad la yang bsgrags sam zhe na /
translated: Is it proclaimed to one who is not viewing others as different, such as a novice?🔽To one fully ordained means

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la zhes pa yin te /
translated: that it is proclaimed to one who is fully ordained.

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la sgrogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa la sgrogs shig pa'o //
translated: The monk who is to be expelled should say, I will do so.🔽The monk who is to be expelled should be expelled by monks who are complete in number and who are pure.🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number, should he be expelled?

original: bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mi ma thun pa la bsgrags sam zhe na /🔽mtshan mthun par zhes pa yin te dge slong phas dge slong phal sgrogs shig pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen par rdzogs pa mtshan mi ma thun pa la bsgrags sam zhe na / mtshan mthun par zhes pa yin te dge slong phas dge slong phal sgrogs shig pa'o //
translated: If the monk who is to be expelled is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number but is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is pure but is not complete in number, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number and is pure, should he be expelled?

original: mthun mthun du bsgrags na dge tshul gyis kyang dge tshul la bsgrags shing bshags par bya ba yin nam zhe na de nyid la ste /🔽'di'ang phyi ma dang bcas par ro zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: mthun mthun du bsgrags na dge tshul gyis kyang dge tshul la bsgrags shing bshags par bya ba yin nam zhe na de nyid la ste / 'di'ang phyi ma dang bcas par ro zhes pa yin te /
translated: If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number but is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is pure but is not complete in number, should he be expelled?

original: dge tshul gyis kyang bsnyen par rdzogs pa la bsgrags shing de'i rjes la bshags pa yang gyis shig pa'o //🔽chos 'di pa rnams la na'ang 'di byas pa'o zhes pa yin te /🔽dge bsnyen yan chad 'di'i @234b chos su blta pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul gyis kyang bsnyen par rdzogs pa la bsgrags shing de'i rjes la bshags pa yang gyis shig pa'o // chos 'di pa rnams la na'ang 'di byas pa'o zhes pa yin te / dge bsnyen yan chad 'di'i @234b chos su blta pa'o //
translated: If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number and is pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number but is not pure, should he be expelled?

original: cho ga bsgrags na nyes byas yod du zin gyi bsgrags par ni mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga bsgrags na nyes byas yod du zin gyi bsgrags par ni mi 'gyur ba ni ma yin pa'o //
translated: If the monk who is to be expelled is pure but is not complete in number, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number and is pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is not complete in number and is not pure, should he be expelled?🔽 If the monk who is to be expelled is complete in number but is not pure, should he be expelled?

original: mtshams gung na 'dug kyang zhes pa ni nam mkha' lta bu mtshams logs shig na 'dug pa la bsgrags na yang bsgrags par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams gung na 'dug kyang zhes pa ni nam mkha' lta bu mtshams logs shig na 'dug pa la bsgrags na yang bsgrags par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Even if he is in the middle of the Saṅgha, means that even if he is in the middle of the Saṅgha, which is like the sky, he is proclaimed.

original: bsgo ba la dbyung ba'o //
analyzed: bsgo ba la dbyung ba'o //
translated: The proclamation is the expulsion.

original: cho ga ni dge 'dun la'o zhes pa ni dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa la sogs pa bsgo ba las byung ba'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga ni dge 'dun la'o zhes pa ni dbyen dang rjes su phyogs pa la sogs pa bsgo ba las byung ba'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The rite is in the Saṅgha, means that the offense that arises from the proclamation of schism, siding with a schismatic, and so on, is the rite in the Saṅgha.

original: cho ga ni dge 'dun la bsgo shig pa'o //
analyzed: cho ga ni dge 'dun la bsgo shig pa'o //
translated: The rite is the proclamation in the Saṅgha.

original: so sor bshags pa ni dge sbyong gi gnas der 'dug la'o zhes pa dge sbyong gi gnas su 'dus so cog la so sor bshags pa'i nyes pa bsgos shig pa'o//
analyzed: so sor bshags pa ni dge sbyong gi gnas der 'dug la'o zhes pa dge sbyong gi gnas su 'dus so cog la so sor bshags pa'i nyes pa bsgos shig pa'o//
translated: The confession is to the one who is in the state of a śramaṇa, means that the offense of confession is to be confessed to all who are assembled in the state of a śramaṇa.

original: ji skad du bsgrags she na /
analyzed: ji skad du bsgrags she na /
translated: How is it proclaimed?🔽Venerable ones, this is a shameful state for me, a contradictory state that should be confessed. By this Dharma, I confess.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gi ni smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'gal ba can bshags par 'gyur ba ste chos des so sor bshags par bgyi'o zhes so zhes pa yin te bsgrags pa'i snyad 'di skad gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag bdag gi ni smad pa'i gnas su gyur pa 'gal ba can bshags par 'gyur ba ste chos des so sor bshags par bgyi'o zhes so zhes pa yin te bsgrags pa'i snyad 'di skad gyis shig pa'o //
translated: This is the proclamation.

original: de la bsgrags pa ni thabs 'di ltar bya'i bshags pa ni gang zag gcig la gung du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: de la bsgrags pa ni thabs 'di ltar bya'i bshags pa ni gang zag gcig la gung du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The announcement is the method of doing it; the confession is the individual confession.

original: 'di dag sngags bzhin du ma yin zhes pa ni bsgrags pa de yang sngags bzhin du lan gsum du bzlas mi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag sngags bzhin du ma yin zhes pa ni bsgrags pa de yang sngags bzhin du lan gsum du bzlas mi dgos pa'o //
translated: The phrase not like the mantra means that the announcement does not need to be repeated three times, as the mantra does.

original: bsdam par bya ba ni yid kyis slon zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rjes su rtogs pa la sogs pa bsdam bar bye ba'i nyes pa rnams ni yid kyis mi bya bar dam bcas 'dag cing slon par ston pa'o //🔽de las gzhan pa ni de dang bshags pa na bcas pas so zhes pa ni gong ma las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba ni yid kyis slon zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i rjes su rtogs pa la sogs pa bsdam bar bye ba'i nyes pa rnams ni yid kyis mi bya bar dam bcas 'dag cing slon par ston pa'o // de las gzhan pa ni de dang bshags pa na bcas pas so zhes pa ni gong ma las gzhan pa ste /
translated: The restraint is the mental vow, which shows that the faults to be restrained, such as the pursuit of desire, are not to be done by the mind, and are to be restrained by the mental vow.

original: lus sam ngag gi nyes pa rnams yid kyis bsdams pa dang / bshags pa gnyis ka byas pas gdod 'dag par ston pa'o//
analyzed: lus sam ngag gi nyes pa rnams yid kyis bsdams pa dang / bshags pa gnyis ka byas pas gdod 'dag par ston pa'o//
translated: The other is purified by that and by confession, which shows that the other, besides the above, is purified by both the mental restraint and the confession of the faults of body and speech.

original: su la bshags she na /
analyzed: su la bshags she na /
translated: To whom is it confessed?

original: gcig la'o zhes pa dang / gzhan du mi lta ba de la'o zhes pa dang / nyes pa mi 'dra la zhes pa dang / sde yang zhes pa yin te /
analyzed: gcig la'o zhes pa dang / gzhan du mi lta ba de la'o zhes pa dang / nyes pa mi 'dra la zhes pa dang / sde yang zhes pa yin te /

analyzed: gang zag gcig la bshags pa dang / de'ang gzhan du mi lta ba dang / nyes pa mi 'dra pa dang / ltung ba'i sde mi mthun pa la bshags shig pa'o //

analyzed: med na yang zhes pa ni sde mi mthun pa med na nyes pa'i dmigs mi 'dra ba tsam la bshags shig pa'o //

original: spang ba ni rje spangs shing phral nas zhes pa ni spang ba bshags pa'i thabs ni dngos po je spangs te de dang gcig bral nas gdod bshags shig pa'o //
analyzed: spang ba ni rje spangs shing phral nas zhes pa ni spang ba bshags pa'i thabs ni dngos po je spangs te de dang gcig bral nas gdod bshags shig pa'o //
translated: Abandonment means having abandoned and separated from. The method of confessing abandonment is that having abandoned the thing, one should confess having become separated from it.

analyzed: pa'o // dge slong ma dang 'drul bar spyod pa yang bkar zhes pa dang / 'di bkar nas dge slong mas kyang phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa bca' zhes pa ni dge slong ma dang / rtag tu 'drul ba bkar ba dang / bkar nas dge slong mas kyang phyag mi bya ba'i sdom pa chos shig pa'o //
translated: The excommunication of a monk who has sexual intercourse with a nun, and the vow not to salute a nun who has been excommunicated, is the excommunication of a monk who always has sexual intercourse, and the vow not to salute a nun who has been excommunicated.

translated: “One is not born in the hell of the Reviving” means that even if one is punished by other punishments, such as being reviled, after being punished by the punishment of excommunication, one does not live together with or associate with those who are excommunicated.

original: grags pa dang bsod nams chen po dang mdo dang 'dul ba ma mo 'dzin cing phyogs dang 'khor dang thos pa yang mang po can ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu la bkar ba'i chad pas bcad na dge 'dun gyi gcugs
analyzed: grags pa dang bsod nams chen po dang mdo dang 'dul ba ma mo 'dzin cing phyogs dang 'khor dang thos pa yang mang po can ni sbom po'o zhes pa ni ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu la bkar ba'i chad pas bcad na dge 'dun gyi gcugs
translated: “One who is famous, has great merit, upholds the sūtras, the vinaya, and the mātṛkā, and has many followers, retinue, and learning is a serious offense” means that if one like those mentioned by name is excommunicated, one becomes an object of respect for the saṅgha.

original: khyim pa ni dper zad kyi dge slong la sogs pa lnga la 'phya na 'ang 'gong thod du dbyung zhes pa ni dge slong dang dge tshul dang dge tshul ma dang dge slob ma lnga la 'phya zhing kha tshas zer na yang 'gong thod du dbyung ba 'am

translated: The householder is just an example, but if one insults the five, such as the fully ordained monk, one should endure it.  The five are the fully ordained monk, the novice monk, the female novice, and the female probationer.

original: de gtong du chug shig pa'o //🔽gshe ba ni 'phya ba ma yin zhes pa ni khyim pa dge slong la gang yang rung rtag tu gshe shing kha tshas zer na yang 'phya ba dang khrin cig pa'o //

translated: If one insults and reviles them, one should endure it.🔽Or one should tell them, Please forgive me. Insulting is not the same as reviling. If a householder constantly scolds and reviles a fully ordained monk, one should endure it.

translated: One should not fear that the punishment will be uncommon.  Punishment means that it is not only the fully ordained monk who is to be punished, but also the fully ordained nun is included in those to be punished.

original: 'di dag bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i rab tu dbyung ba la 'ang bya zhes pa dang / khyim pa la ni ma yin zhes pa ni chad pa rnams bdun gyis dge tshul la sogs pa la'ang gcad pa dang khyim pa la ni ma yin par ston pa'o //

translated: This shows that the punishments are to be done for novices and so on by the seven, but not for householders.

translated: If a fully ordained monk makes a monk who has not committed a defeating offense carry his seat and so on and scolds him, he should be made to turn his alms bowl upside down. The fault is that he should be made to turn his alms bowl upside down for doing this to householders.

original: dam bca' bas so zhes pa dang / gsol bas zhes pa ni gong ma ltar khas phub pa lhung bzed ngo bo khas phub pa 'ang ma yin gyi rtsis mgo bca' bas khas phub par bya ba dang gsol ba'i las kyis gyis shig pa'o //

translated: By agreement and by request means that he should be made to turn his alms bowl upside down not by the nature of turning his alms bowl upside down, but by the beginning of the calculation of turning his alms bowl upside down and by the rite of request.

original: lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim du mi 'dong zhes pa dang / stan cha mi spyad ces pa dang phul ba'i chos bshams pa lam yin zhes pa dang / bsod snyoms mi blang zhes pa dang / chos mi bshad ces pa ni gong ma ltar dam bcas ba'i nang du ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ltar gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim du mi 'dong zhes pa dang / stan cha mi spyad ces pa dang phul ba'i chos bshams pa lam yin zhes pa dang / bsod snyoms mi blang zhes pa dang / chos mi bshad ces pa ni gong ma ltar dam bcas ba'i nang du ming gis smos pa 'di rnams ltar gyis shig pa'o //
translated: Do not enter a house where a begging bowl is kept upside down, do not use a seat, do not explain the Dharma that is set out, do not accept alms, and do not explain the Dharma.🔽As above, these are the vows that are named in the text.

original: de la phul ba'i chos bshams pa zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa la sogs pa dang / dkon mchog gi yo byad du phul zhing bshams pa'o //
analyzed: de la phul ba'i chos bshams pa zhes pa ni gtsug lag khang brtsigs pa la sogs pa dang / dkon mchog gi yo byad du phul zhing bshams pa'o //
translated: As for “the Dharma that is set out,” this refers to the construction of a temple and so on, and to that which is set out and offered as an article for the Three Jewels.

original: las gar byas pa des chung ba rnams khas phub pa'o //
analyzed: las gar byas pa des chung ba rnams khas phub pa'o //
translated: The action of keeping it upside down is done by the youngest.

original: khyim du mar lhung bzed khas phub pa'i las mtshams du mar cig car gcod pa dang 'dra bar byas na cig car khas phub pa'i las su gyur par ston pa'o //
analyzed: khyim du mar lhung bzed khas phub pa'i las mtshams du mar cig car gcod pa dang 'dra bar byas na cig car khas phub pa'i las su gyur par ston pa'o //
translated: If one acts like the action of simultaneously cutting many threads, it is shown that the action of keeping it upside down becomes simultaneous.

original: nyid kyi phyogs ma yin ba'i khyim dang bkar ba yan chad kyi cha mi skye zhes pa ni chos ma yin pa rnams kyi khyim pa dang bkar ba yan chad kyi khyim pa la khas phub pa'i las byas kyang de'i las su mi rung ba'o //

translated: The phrase one does not generate the portion of a householder or monk who is not of his own faction means that even if a householder or monk who is not a Buddhist performs the act of covering the bowl, that act is not suitable to be that action.

original: 'di la 'gas sbran zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyis khas phub pa'i las byas na de la 'gas sbran cing shes par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'gas sbran zhes pa ni dge 'dun gyis khas phub pa'i las byas na de la 'gas sbran cing shes par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should inform him means that if the Saṅgha performs the act of covering the bowl, one should inform him and make him aware of it.

original: bzod par gsol na gsol bas dgan pa zhes pa ni lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim pa de 'chags shing bzod par gsol na gsol ba'i las kyis dam bcas pa de thong shig pa'o //
analyzed: bzod par gsol na gsol bas dgan pa zhes pa ni lhung bzed khas phub pa'i khyim pa de 'chags shing bzod par gsol na gsol ba'i las kyis dam bcas pa de thong shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase if he requests forbearance, he is purified by the request means that if the householder whose bowl has been covered confesses and requests forbearance, he should be released from that vow by the act of requesting.

original: bcabs pa'i sems ma skye na tha ma yang tshangs par 'gyur zhes pa ni bcabs sems cung zad kyang ma g-yos na phas pham pa tshangs par rung ba'o //

translated: The phrase if the thought of concealment has not arisen, he is purified even by the last means that if he does not waver at all from the thought of concealment, he is suitable to be purified of the defeating offense.

original: bslab pa spyad na'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar tshangs par rung ba yang bslab pa spyad na gdod 'don du rung ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa spyad na'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar tshangs par rung ba yang bslab pa spyad na gdod 'don du rung ba'o //
translated: If one practices the precepts. This means that if one is fit to be a monk as explained above, and if one practices the precepts, then one is fit to be ordained.

original: de ni dge 'dun las 'thob bo zhes pa ni bslab pa de yang dge 'dun gyis phog na gdon du rung ba'o //
analyzed: de ni dge 'dun las 'thob bo zhes pa ni bslab pa de yang dge 'dun gyis phog na gdon du rung ba'o //
translated: It is obtained from the Saṅgha. This means that if the precepts are conferred by the Saṅgha, then one is fit to be ordained.

original: las kyis dbog ces pa ni de lta bu la bslab pa dbog pa yang tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gdod dbog pa ni ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyis las bya'o //
analyzed: las kyis dbog ces pa ni de lta bu la bslab pa dbog pa yang tshul khrims kyi bslab pa gdod dbog pa ni ma yin gyi dge 'dun gyis las bya'o //
translated: The conferral of the precepts is by means of a rite. This means that the conferral of the precepts is not the initial conferral of the training of morality, but rather the Saṅgha performs a rite.

original: chos des gyis @238a * //
analyzed: chos des gyis @238a * //
translated: The precepts are to be practiced by means of that Dharma.

original: shig pa'i bslab pa gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis dbog par bya'o //
analyzed: shig pa'i bslab pa gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis dbog par bya'o //
translated: The conferral of the precepts is by means of a rite of four proclamations and requests.

original: nam 'tsho ba'i bar ro zhes pa ni nam 'tsho ba'i bar du bslab pa de srungs shig pa'o //
analyzed: nam 'tsho ba'i bar ro zhes pa ni nam 'tsho ba'i bar du bslab pa de srungs shig pa'o //
translated: For as long as one lives. This means that one should guard the precepts for as long as one lives.

original: ngo smin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gyur pa ni gcig gi mdun du bshags pas kyang 'dag go zhes pa dang mdo dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang / grags pa yang zhes pa ni ngo smin pa 'am mdo sde 'dzin pa la sogs pa lhag ma spyad pa ni chad pa dang /
analyzed: ngo smin pa dge 'dun gyi lhag mar gyur pa ni gcig gi mdun du bshags pas kyang 'dag go zhes pa dang mdo dang 'dul ba dang ma mo 'dzin pa dang / grags pa yang zhes pa ni ngo smin pa 'am mdo sde 'dzin pa la sogs pa lhag ma spyad pa ni chad pa dang /
translated: One with a ripened identity who commits a partial defeat of the Saṅgha is purified by confessing in the presence of one person.

original: mgu ba la sogs pa ma byas par gang zag gcig gi mdun du snying thag pa nas bshags na 'byang zhing 'dag tu rung /
analyzed: mgu ba la sogs pa ma byas par gang zag gcig gi mdun du snying thag pa nas bshags na 'byang zhing 'dag tu rung /
translated: One who has a ripened identity or who upholds the sūtras and so on and commits a partial defeat is purified by confessing from the heart in the presence of one person without performing the ceremony of demotion and so on.

original: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de ltar zhe na /

original: nyes pa ni bsam pas slon gyi chad pa'i las kyis ma yin zhes pa yin te snga ma la 'gyod cing phyin chad mi bya ba'i bsam pa de'i gnyen por 'gyur gyi chad pa'i las de'i gnyen por 'gyur ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //

translated: Because faults are overcome by attitude, not by actions of punishment.

analyzed: gong du nyes pa'i rigs smos te'o zhes 'byung ba'i ming dang rigs ji lta bu yin par ston pa ni /

analyzed: ming ni phas pham pa dang lhag ma zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The name is like the name of a defeating offense and a residual offense.🔽The type is like the defeating offense that arises from sexual misconduct and the residual offense that arises from expulsion.

analyzed: // /'di la bcos pa'i dngos por gdags pa ci'i phyir zhe na /

translated: Although the text says, “Kauśika, it is an entity and a remedial entity,” it is merely said that way in the context of a limited dispute. original: bcos pa'i dngos po zhes smos pa yin na dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / go chu rub kyi dngos po rnams bsdus te ston pa ni 'dir dge 'dun gyi lhag mar ma shes pa dang / sems kyis bcabs par ma bshags pa brjid pa dang byas sam ma byas ji dang ji 'dra bar ma nus pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang bkar ba rnams bcabs par mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: bcos pa'i dngos po zhes smos pa yin na dus dang dus ma yin pa dang / go chu rub kyi dngos po rnams bsdus te ston pa ni 'dir dge 'dun gyi lhag mar ma shes pa dang / sems kyis bcabs par ma bshags pa brjid pa dang byas sam ma byas ji dang ji 'dra bar ma nus pa dang bsnyen par ma rdzogs pa dang bkar ba rnams bcabs par mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Here, it is not understood to be a partial defeat of the Saṅgha, and it is not confessed to be concealed by the mind, and it is not remembered, and it is not able to be done or not done, and it is not similar to what is done, and it is not concealed by one who is not fully ordained, and it is not concealed by one who is accused.

original: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu ni bcabs pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: ming gis smos pa 'di rnams lta bu ni bcabs pa ma yin pa'o //

analyzed: de'i rang bzhin tshol ba dang bslab pa yang de bzhin zhes pa dang / 'don du mi gzhug ces pa ni rang bzhin tshol ba dang / bslab pa byin pa gnyis kyi dka' slas su bya ba'ang gong ma dang 'dra bar ston pa dang / so sor thar pa ni 'don du ma gzhug shig pa'o //
translated: The nature of that is to be sought and training is also like that, and one should not be made to recite it, indicates that the nature of that is to be sought and that the difficulty of bestowing training is similar to the former.

original: snga ma ni tshangs par byas pas rang bzhin du 'gyur zhes pa dang / phyi ma ni dgra bcom pa na'o zhes pa ni snga ma ste /

original: de'i rang bzhin tshol ba ni tshangs par byas pas sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur phyi ma ste /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin tshol ba ni tshangs par byas pas sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur phyi ma ste /
translated: The nature of that is to be sought through purification, since one’s former nature becomes that of a brahmin.

original: bslab pa byin pa ni dgra bcom na gdod sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa byin pa ni dgra bcom na gdod sngon gyi rang bzhin du 'gyur ba'o //

original: bral ba dang spyad zin kyang sgo da phye zhing gnas la sogs pa yang ngo ces pa ni chad pa dang // mgu ba spyad zin kyang dge 'dun gyi byung ba'i cho ga byas kyi bar du sgo dbye ba la sogs pa dka' blas bya dgos pa dang /

analyzed: gzhan du'ang dang po gnyis skya rengs kyis chod par mi bya zhes pa ni dang po ste chad pa dang mgu ba gnyis spyod pa'i tshe mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs kyis chod par ma 'dug shig pa'o //
translated: Also, in other cases, the first two should not be interrupted by dawn. The first means that when one is practicing both the suspension and the reconciliation, one should not stay outside the boundary and be interrupted by dawn.

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa rnams la zin cing lus pa bsnyad ces pa dang / ring por mi spyod na nyin re zhing ngo zhes pa dang / gzhan ni gsum bzhi zhing ngo zhes pa ni chad pa dang mgu pa spyod pa'i tshe zhag grangs su spyad zin pa dang /

translated: The text says, One should inform the assembled community of the suspension and the remainder, and If one does not practice for a long time, then daily, and The other, for three or four days, means that when one is practicing the suspension and the reconciliation, one should practice for the number of days that have passed.

original: phyin dus ring por mi spyod pa zhig na ni nyin re dge 'dun 'dus pa bsnyad /
analyzed: phyin dus ring por mi spyod pa zhig na ni nyin re dge 'dun 'dus pa bsnyad /
translated: If one does not practice for a long time, then one should inform the assembled community daily.

original: yun ring du spyod pa zhig na ni zhag gsum bzhi tsam gyis spyad /
analyzed: yun ring du spyod pa zhig na ni zhag gsum bzhi tsam gyis spyad /
translated: If one practices for a long time, one should practice for three or four days.

original: dge 'dun 'dus pa rnams la snyod cig pa'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun 'dus pa rnams la snyod cig pa'o //
translated: One should inform the assembled community.

original: de dag la 'di'i phyir mi dpya zhes pa ni chad pa ni chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa la dge slong gzhan gyis 'dren kyang du'ang ma dpya shig pa'o //
analyzed: de dag la 'di'i phyir mi dpya zhes pa ni chad pa ni chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa la dge slong gzhan gyis 'dren kyang du'ang ma dpya shig pa'o //
translated: The phrase one should not investigate this for that reason means that even if a monk is led to the act of being expelled or being satisfied, one should not investigate it.

original: 'thab krol can 'ong bar thos la des 'jigs na dge 'dun nam gang zag gi mdun du btang bar bya zhes pa ni dge slong 'thab krol can 'ongs pas gtses su dogs na gang zag la ni gong gong bor @242b 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa gson cig
analyzed: 'thab krol can 'ong bar thos la des 'jigs na dge 'dun nam gang zag gi mdun du btang bar bya zhes pa ni dge slong 'thab krol can 'ongs pas gtses su dogs na gang zag la ni gong gong bor @242b 'dug nas tshe dang ldan pa gson cig
translated: If one hears that a quarrelsome person is coming and one is afraid of him, one should send a monk in front of the Saṅgha or an individual. The phrase one should send means that if one fears being harmed by the arrival of a quarrelsome monk, one should say to an individual, Venerable, listen!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dang chad pa spyod pa dang / dge slong gud nas mchi bar rigs mi 'phrog pas na /
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba dang chad pa spyod pa dang / dge slong gud nas mchi bar rigs mi 'phrog pas na /
translated: I, named so-and-so, and the one who is acting with the penalty, and the monk who is coming from elsewhere, are not to be deprived of our status.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba chad pa'i cho ga re zhig gzhi la dor zhing phyis bsgrub par 'tshal gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la brun bar ma dgongs shig ces pa lan gnyis lan gsum du sngags kyi tshig 'di skad zlos la gzhi la 'or
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba chad pa'i cho ga re zhig gzhi la dor zhing phyis bsgrub par 'tshal gyis tshe dang ldan pa dag gis bdag la brun bar ma dgongs shig ces pa lan gnyis lan gsum du sngags kyi tshig 'di skad zlos la gzhi la 'or
translated: I, named so-and-so, will put aside for a while the rite of the schism and will later accomplish it. May the Venerable Ones not think of me as a fool. Saying this, he should repeat these words twice or three times and put it aside.

original: cig pa'o // dge 'dun la yang btsun pa dge 'dun gson cig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di bzhin du snyed cig pa'o //
analyzed: cig pa'o // dge 'dun la yang btsun pa dge 'dun gson cig ces bya ba la sogs pa 'di bzhin du snyed cig pa'o //
translated: Also to the Saṅgha, he should say, Venerable Saṅgha, listen! and so on, as much as he can.

original: 'jigs pa med par gyur nas de nyid du mnod ces pa ni gong ma ltar 'jigs pa med par gyur nas sngon gyi so nas zung shig pa'o ;
analyzed: 'jigs pa med par gyur nas de nyid du mnod ces pa ni gong ma ltar 'jigs pa med par gyur nas sngon gyi so nas zung shig pa'o ;
translated: When he becomes fearless, he should take back the original position. This means that when he becomes fearless as before, he should take back the original position.

original: ; sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po'o /
analyzed: ; sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po'o /
translated: The things to be practiced by one abiding in another stage.

original: // / sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po zhus pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa rang bzhin du gnas par bkab pa gcig tu lhan cig nyal na nyin zhag gcig yal lo zhes pa la sogs pa yin
analyzed: // / sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po zhus pa las 'byung ba bsdus te ston pa ni chad pa dang mgu ba spyod pa rang bzhin du gnas par bkab pa gcig tu lhan cig nyal na nyin zhag gcig yal lo zhes pa la sogs pa yin
translated: The summary of the topic of the practice of one who is on another stage is: “If one who is suspended or on probation sleeps together with a regular monk, he loses the day.”

original: te / 'di ltar lhan cig nyal na yang chad pa'i zhag grangs la gcod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: te / 'di ltar lhan cig nyal na yang chad pa'i zhag grangs la gcod par ston pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is taught that if one sleeps together with a regular monk, he loses the day of the suspension.

original: mtshams kyi phyi rol du yang zhes pa dang / ma bstan na yang zhes pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs kyis tshod dam dge 'dun la ma bsnyad na yang zhag grangs las gcod par ston pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi phyi rol du yang zhes pa dang / ma bstan na yang zhes pa ni mtshams kyi phyi rol du skya rengs kyis tshod dam dge 'dun la ma bsnyad na yang zhag grangs las gcod par ston pa'o //
translated: “Even outside the boundary” and “even if not announced” teach that if one is outside the boundary, or if one does not announce it to the saṅgha, he loses the day of the suspension.

original: mtshams de'i nyin par rnams med na 'di mi skye /
analyzed: mtshams de'i nyin par rnams med na 'di mi skye /
translated: If the days of the boundary do not occur, this does not arise.

original: de'i nyin par byas pa ni dge 'dun gyis byas pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nyin par byas pa ni dge 'dun gyis byas pa'o //
translated: The days of the boundary are made by the saṅgha.

original: slar 'khor na mtshams gzhan du slar song yang bla zhes pa ni dge 'dun la bsnyad pa yang mtshams de na 'khod pa ma yin pa la bsnyad na mi phan pa dang / dgongs slar 'khor na ni gud du song ba yang bla ba'o //🔽bla gab gcig gi 'og tu chad pa pa dang chad pa lhan cig mi nyal zhes pa ni chad pa pa rnams bla gab gcig gi 'og tu lhan cig ma nyal cig pa'o //
analyzed: slar 'khor na mtshams gzhan du slar song yang bla zhes pa ni dge 'dun la bsnyad pa yang mtshams de na 'khod pa ma yin pa la bsnyad na mi phan pa dang / dgongs slar 'khor na ni gud du song ba yang bla ba'o // bla gab gcig gi 'og tu chad pa pa dang chad pa lhan cig mi nyal zhes pa ni chad pa pa rnams bla gab gcig gi 'og tu lhan cig ma nyal cig pa'o //
translated: If he returns again, he may go to another boundary, but he is still expelled.🔽He should not sleep together with a monk who is suspended in the same shelter.

original: de dang gzhan pa'i mu stegs pa lhan cig ni 'dir nyes med ces pa ni gzhan pa'i mu stegs dang lhan cig tu nyal yang bla ba'o //
analyzed: de dang gzhan pa'i mu stegs pa lhan cig ni 'dir nyes med ces pa ni gzhan pa'i mu stegs dang lhan cig tu nyal yang bla ba'o //
translated: He may sleep together with non-Buddhist ascetics who are not suspended.

original: sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po zhus pa'o /
analyzed: sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos po zhus pa'o /
translated: He should ask about the things to be practiced by one who is in another region.

original: // / gzhung las ni chad pa'i dngos po zhes 'byung la 'dir ming 'di skad du gdags pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: // / gzhung las ni chad pa'i dngos po zhes 'byung la 'dir ming 'di skad du gdags pa ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: In the scriptures, it says “the things of suspension,” but why is it designated by this name here?

original: lhag ma'i chad pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi bslab pa sbyin pa la sogs pa las gzhan la gnas pa'o cog gi cho ga ston pas na don dang sbyar te sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos por gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: lhag ma'i chad pa nyi tsher ma zad kyi bslab pa sbyin pa la sogs pa las gzhan la gnas pa'o cog gi cho ga ston pas na don dang sbyar te sa gzhan la gnas pas spyad pa'i dngos por gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The remaining punishments are not only temporary, but also the rules for abiding in the precepts other than giving and so on are taught, so they are connected with the meaning and belong to the subject matter of abiding in other stages.

original: bstad pa'i dngos po ston pa la rtsa ba @243a * //
analyzed: bstad pa'i dngos po ston pa la rtsa ba @243a * //
translated: The remaining punishments are not just temporary. Since it teaches the procedures for all the other precepts such as giving, it is connected with the meaning and belongs to the subject matter of the practice of one who abides in another stage.🔽The root of the subject matter to be taught is mentioned below.

original: bcabs pas gleng ngo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba de'i rtsa ba ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: bcabs pas gleng ngo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba de'i rtsa ba ma yin pa ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is not a root of that?

original: ma grags pa rtsa bar mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ma grags pa rtsa bar mi 'gyur zhes pa la sogs pa yin te /
translated: It is said that what is not well known is not a root.

original: 'phrul gyis mig dang rna ba la sogs pa 'jig rten du grags pa'am mngon par shes pa la sogs pa 'di lta bus glengs pa ni gleng ba'i rtsa ba'am bzhir mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: 'phrul gyis mig dang rna ba la sogs pa 'jig rten du grags pa'am mngon par shes pa la sogs pa 'di lta bus glengs pa ni gleng ba'i rtsa ba'am bzhir mi rung ba'o //
translated: If one mentions with magical eyes, ears, etc. that are well known in the world or with such superknowledges, it is not suitable as a root or basis for mentioning.

original: tshul nas 'byung ba bsnyad zin nas byung ba'i bkyigs pa mi skye zhes pa ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i las bsnyad zin pa'i 'og tu tshul nas mi 'byung ba bkyigs kyang bkyigs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: tshul nas 'byung ba bsnyad zin nas byung ba'i bkyigs pa mi skye zhes pa ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i las bsnyad zin pa'i 'og tu tshul nas mi 'byung ba bkyigs kyang bkyigs par mi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Having explained the origination from the rule, it is said that the origination from the rule does not arise. After the origination from the rule has been explained, even if the origination from the rule is prohibited, it is not prohibited.

original: nad pas byed pa'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni nad pas tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs par byed pa'ang gong ma 'dra bar mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: nad pas byed pa'ang de bzhin zhes pa ni nad pas tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs par byed pa'ang gong ma 'dra bar mi rung ba'o //
translated: The same is true for the sick person.  The sick person's prohibition of the origination from the rule is also not appropriate, like the previous.

original: phrin gyis kyang zhes pa ni phrin gyis tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs na'ang de bzhin du mi rung ba'o //
analyzed: phrin gyis kyang zhes pa ni phrin gyis tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs na'ang de bzhin du mi rung ba'o //
translated: Also by messenger.  If the origination from the rule is prohibited by messenger, it is also not appropriate, like that.

original: nad pa la yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyis ni nad pa dge 'dun gyi chad pa nad pa 'chos na phrin las mi mdzad du gsol zhes bkyigs kyang bkyigs par mi chud do //
analyzed: nad pa la yang ngo zhes pa ni dge slong gzhan gyis ni nad pa dge 'dun gyi chad pa nad pa 'chos na phrin las mi mdzad du gsol zhes bkyigs kyang bkyigs par mi chud do //
translated: Also for the sick person.  If another monk prohibits the sick person's amendment of the Saṅgha's punishment, saying 'Please do not perform the procedure,' it is not considered a prohibition.

original: 'di mi blang zhes pa ni gong du smos pa bkyigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rnams dge 'dun gyis kyang sdom par ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di mi blang zhes pa ni gong du smos pa bkyigs par mi 'gyur ba'i rnams dge 'dun gyis kyang sdom par ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Do not accept this.  The Saṅgha should not confirm the above-mentioned prohibitions that are not considered prohibitions.

original: nad pa la sogs pas tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs pa la dge 'dun gyis mi sdom pa'i snyad ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: nad pa la sogs pas tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs pa la dge 'dun gyis mi sdom pa'i snyad ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: If a sick person and so on is bound by the assembly, how should he respond to the accusation?🔽He should say, “Venerable, you are sick and unable to act. Stay here.”🔽“Venerable, you are a messenger.”🔽“This is not a sick person speaking.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod nad pa ste sbyor mi nus kyi sdod cig ces pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa phrin pa zhes pa dang / 'di nad pa pas gleng pa ma yin no zhes lan gdab ces pa yin te nad pa de ltar bkyigs na ni tshe dang ldan pa khyod nad pa yin te /🔽sbyor mi nus kyis sdod cig ces de bya ba deng phrin du spring ste /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod nad pa ste sbyor mi nus kyi sdod cig ces pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa phrin pa zhes pa dang / 'di nad pa pas gleng pa ma yin no zhes lan gdab ces pa yin te nad pa de ltar bkyigs na ni tshe dang ldan pa khyod nad pa yin te / sbyor mi nus kyis sdod cig ces de bya ba deng phrin du spring ste /
translated: If a sick person is bound in this way, he should say, “Venerable, you are sick and unable to act. Stay here.”🔽If he is bound, he should say, “Venerable, you are a messenger. Do not speak.”

original: 'khyigs na tshe dang ldan pa phrin pa khyod ma smra shig ces pa dang / nad pa la 'khyigs na 'di nad pa ste /
analyzed: 'khyigs na tshe dang ldan pa phrin pa khyod ma smra shig ces pa dang / nad pa la 'khyigs na 'di nad pa ste /
translated: If a sick person is bound, he should say, “This is a sick person.🔽It is not suitable to speak. Do not speak.”

original: gleng du mi rung gis ma gleng ces lan gdab cing mi sdom par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gleng du mi rung gis ma gleng ces lan gdab cing mi sdom par bya ba'o //
translated: He should not be bound.

original: byas pa'am byed pa'i dngos nyid ma gtogs na glengs kyang zhes pa ni nyes pa byas pa'i dmigs gang yin pa dang / nyes pa med pa'am mi su yin pa rnams kyis nan rtags med par glengs kyang gleng bar mi chung ba'o //
analyzed: byas pa'am byed pa'i dngos nyid ma gtogs na glengs kyang zhes pa ni nyes pa byas pa'i dmigs gang yin pa dang / nyes pa med pa'am mi su yin pa rnams kyis nan rtags med par glengs kyang gleng bar mi chung ba'o //
translated: Except for the nature of what was done or is being done, even if one is accused without grounds, or if one is accused without grounds or with grounds by those who are not suitable accusers.

original: lhag mas kyang dus ma yin par mi bya zhes pa ni ma yin pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams las bzlog pas gleng na yang skabs sam dus ma yin par ni ma glengs shig pa'o //
analyzed: lhag mas kyang dus ma yin par mi bya zhes pa ni ma yin pa la sogs pa gong du smos pa rnams las bzlog pas gleng na yang skabs sam dus ma yin par ni ma glengs shig pa'o //
translated: The rest also means that one should not accuse at the wrong time.

original: dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma bzhag pas ma yin zhes pa ni snga nas dran pa dang shes bzhin du bcabs par glengs pa'i las ma byed cig pa'o //
analyzed: dran pa dang shes bzhin nye bar ma bzhag pas ma yin zhes pa ni snga nas dran pa dang shes bzhin du bcabs par glengs pa'i las ma byed cig pa'o //
translated: Not without mindfulness and introspection means that one should not accuse without having previously been mindful and introspective.

original: mi dben par ma yin zhes pa @243b ni mi mang ba'i mdun na ma reg mi 'phrod pa'i mdun du ma glengs shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi dben par ma yin zhes pa @243b ni mi mang ba'i mdun na ma reg mi 'phrod pa'i mdun du ma glengs shig pa'o //
translated: Not in a place that is not private means that one should not accuse in the presence of many people who are unsuitable to hear it.

original: skabs ma phye bar ma yin zhes pa ni de skabs ma phye ba'i bar du gleng bar ma byed cig pa'o //🔽tshul nas 'byung ba ni de'o zhes pa ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ni skabs phye ba ma yin par ston pa'o //
analyzed: skabs ma phye bar ma yin zhes pa ni de skabs ma phye ba'i bar du gleng bar ma byed cig pa'o // tshul nas 'byung ba ni de'o zhes pa ni tshul nas 'byung ba'i tshe ni skabs phye ba ma yin par ston pa'o //
translated: When it is the right time, do not say, “I did not speak of it until the time was right.”🔽If you do not remember, remind yourself.

original: mi dran na dran par bya zhes pa ni glengs pa'i tshe nyes pa byas par mi dran zhes zer na dran par sems su chug shig pa'o //
analyzed: mi dran na dran par bya zhes pa ni glengs pa'i tshe nyes pa byas par mi dran zhes zer na dran par sems su chug shig pa'o //
translated: If you do not remember committing an offense when it is brought up, think, “I must remember.”🔽If you do not open the discussion, you should be reprimanded.

analyzed: ma phye na 'di la bsdigs par bya zhes pa ni skabs 'byed du ma btub na bsdigs shig pa'o //
translated: If you are unable to open the discussion, you should be reprimanded.

original: bsdigs pa'i snyad ji skad du bya zhe na /
analyzed: bsdigs pa'i snyad ji skad du bya zhe na /
translated: What is the reprimand?🔽“Venerable, you have a case. Venerable, you have a reprimand. Do not leave this place without permission.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la bya ba yod de tshe dang ldan pa bsdigs pa'i snyad yod kyis gnas 'di nas ma zhum par ma 'gro shig ces pa'o zhes pa yin te tshe dang ldan pa khyod tshar bcad cing gtan la dbab pa'i snyad mang du yod kyis
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa khyod la bya ba yod de tshe dang ldan pa bsdigs pa'i snyad yod kyis gnas 'di nas ma zhum par ma 'gro shig ces pa'o zhes pa yin te tshe dang ldan pa khyod tshar bcad cing gtan la dbab pa'i snyad mang du yod kyis
translated: “Venerable, you have many cases and reprimands.

analyzed: sdod cig ces tshig gis snyad 'di skad du bsdigs shig pa'o //

analyzed: des kyang gso sbyin bkyigs zhes pa dang / 'on kyang tshul nas mi dbyung ba'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar byas kyang ma slon na gso sbyin bkyigs pa dang / des kyang ma slon na tshul nas 'byung ba bkyigs pa rnams gyis shig pa'o //
translated: And he should be told to fast, and not to leave the monastery, means that if he does not learn even though he is treated as above, he should be told to fast, and if he does not learn by that, he should be told not to leave the monastery.

original: 'dir bkyigs pa bkyigs pa dang / lhan cig tu byas na tshangs pa'o zhes pa ni drug sdes dge slong cig la sku rer bkyigs ba phyis drug sde po nyid dang lhan cig tu gso sbyin byas pas tshangs par gyur pa bzhin du dang po sus bkyigs pa des brtsangs nas gzhan bya mi dgos

translated: If one is released by the one who bound him, he does not need to be released by another.

original: par tshangs pa'o// skabs phye yang rang reng byed na skobs su gzhug ces pa ni skabs phyer zin gyi rna lam mam lhan por mi btub na skobs su gzhug pa thabs kyis gyis shig pa'o //

translated: If one is released but does not act independently, one should be released by the saṅgha. This means that if one who has been released is not able to hear or to be near the saṅgha, one should be released by the saṅgha through skillful means.

original: chos dang 'dul bas der gyur la chos ma yin pa la ji nas kyang zhen par shes na dge 'dun mthun pa la yal lo zhes pa ni dngos po rtag chad kyi chos la kha ma dum ba'am spyad pa lci yang gi 'dul ba kha ma dum ste

translated: If one knows that the Saṅgha is attached to non-Dharma, then the harmonious Saṅgha is lost.

original: / rtsod na chos ma yin pa'i phyogs su lta ba rnams snying nas gtong du mi btub cing zhen ches che bar mngon na dge 'dun mthun pa yal zhing med par ston pa'o //

translated: This means that if one is attached to the Dharma of eternalism and nihilism, or to the Vinaya of heavy and light conduct, then if one disputes, one cannot give up from the heart the views of the side of non-Dharma, and if one's attachment is very strong, it shows that the harmonious Saṅgha is lost and non-existent.🔽Therefore, even if one performs actions together with others, it will not arise, and they will not be separated from each other even for a moment.

original: de bas na de las gzhan pa dang 'dus te las byas kyang mi skye zhing gcig la gcig bskal bar yang mi 'gyur ba'o zhes pa ni gong ma ltar bas na de dang 'dus te las lhan cig tu byas kyang las su mi rung ba dang /

translated: This means that even if one performs actions together with those who are like that, the actions will not be suitable,

original: gcig la gcig bskal par yang mi 'gyur ba'o //
